So if you are looking for the boring pages of typical MM sex then look elsewhere. But then you are probably not a sci-fi fan because this is one of the best sci-fi fictions I have read in a while. This is not to say there is no romance. If anything the bond, love and trust between Ondry and Liam are so well expressed in their actions and between the lines, so subtle but absolutely convincing and touching. This has to be the best interpretation of a human and alien interspecies relationship and their dom/sub dynamics only make it more interesting and memorable. Ondry has to be the best Dom I have read. He is totally in control and never waver in his protection, love (as a Rownt knows it) and nurturing of his "palteia." There is no emotional breakdown or sudden role reversal like a human Dom, which MM BDSM romances loves to explore and often ends up annoyingly pathetic. But then Ondry is not a human, lol.What I love about this sequel is the story is told from both Ondry's and Liam's view points. It is just fascinating how Ondry perceive the humans. Time and again I have to pause and marvel at the writer's analysis of human's emotions, weirdness, societal values, culture and so call norms, agreeing with Ondry's view of how unwarranted and pointless human's certain behaviors are. Liam's viewpoints is just as absorbing as he finds himself losing his human traits and instead thinking, feeling and responding like a Rownt. Not that this is a loss as Liam prosper as a human being as a result.The plot itself is intelligent, intricate, multi-layered, deep and at times invoke some "aha" response from this reader. There is no dull page even if there is only one action scene. It is the writer's use of words, her amazing imagination, the exchanges between alien and human, among aliens and among humans which is just captivating, totally capturing this reader's attention. The writer has really created a truly credible and likable, even enviable, alien race. So much so that I found myself siding with the Rownt and wishing ills on the humans, (my own kind!) when a confrontation seems inevitable.This is such a fitting continuation of the series and I hope fervently it is a series. It ends satisfactorily but left me with a hunger for much more of this universe Lyn Gala has created. The writer has really excel with this one. This should be read by all sci-fi fans and to sum it up, brilliant is the word.

I do like this one and practically read it straight through. Michael is a lovely character with his big giving heart and kindness. James is likable too and I really feel for this guy. The writer shows her brilliance as a writer when she relates James' sad childhood and his suicidal state at one point, which have me in tears. I enjoy their developing romance but I feel there is not enough focus on it. I want more time for them to be together and less time given to Michael's interaction with his patients, in particular one patient named Lem. Another little niggle is that even if it says 237 pages, I am sure there are less word count for a novel. Maybe it is because this writer started off giving us shorts and novellas and has yet to get the feel for a true novel. That said I do enjoy every bit of this story (minus that long interaction with Lem) and I love those little excerpts on James' Sentimental Cyanide. I would love it if the writer is to give us a story out of it!

This one is so different from the usual cheesy MM romances out there. This writer can write! Ben and Nikolas are no vanilla characters. Call them special forces, secret agents, black-ops, soldiers for hire, even a little of James Bond, there is no doubt the complexity of these two guys including their very dark pasts. Equally complex is their very convoluted relationship which as a reader I never know what to expect. As the plot progresses there are a lot of twists and turns on the true identities of these two especially the so enigmatic Nikolas. I was just totally caught up in these two complex characters and the growing depth of their bond. Most of all I love that there is no girly fluff in their romance. Then there is the thrilling plot with its drawn out tension, filled with suspense which have me sometimes breathless because I was waiting for something bad to happen to either of them. The story does end somewhat in a cliff hanger when Nikolas twisted past caught up with them. But fortunately their relationship is not in a limbo because there is no doubt the desperate need one has for the other. Oh I have to mention their dog who is quite a character himself, lol. And of course the sex which I thought was well done, graphic but never chessy or gratuitous. And I did not skip any scene, which for me is a rare thing so many MM romances later. I am so glad the 2nd and 3rd book are already out.

This is a well written coming out YA story with a little mystery featuring two seventeen years old. The contrasting personalities, one openly gay and the other fearfully in the closet but came out eventually because of their love has all been told countless times. But I am never tired of it if well told as it is the case here. Also there are the extras in this one which I really like.  The close and heartwarming relationships which Tristant has with his mother and grandmother is just wonderful to read. Their reaction to Tristant first date with his first boy friend is so lovely and refreshing in that it is what you will read if a daughter is to go out with her boyfriend. Then there is that little mystery on Tristant's great grand uncle. Narrated in the great grand uncle's journal, this is a story within a story, the only difference is that it is just so sad. I admit I got all teary eyed when all the truths are revealed. Back to the boys story, it is easy to immerse in it because the writing is so  fluid, without unwanted angst and therefore credible. The ending is quite nicely done as our two boys held hands and start an important phase in their journey. My only niggle is that the story is a tad short for a novel. Will be watching out for this writer as I really enjoy her style.

I really love the dystopian plot, the revelations towards the last 30% stunning. I like the Children characters a lot but somehow felt cheated because of the writing which seemed to lack just that extra. Piri  and Niko could have been so much more if the writing has dug deeper into their characters. That said I could not stop reading because I need to know what happen next. Piri's fate and that of the Children's held me captive.At the heart are three absolutely contrasting societies so alien from each other but connected in such a dark and twisted way, the themes gripping if one is to dwell deeper into the meanings.There are such a lot to love about this story. Piri's emotional growth and discovery of what it mean to be a real human being as he lived with the Children. How he helped them with his inventions even if he is physically weaker. The fact that same sex love is the norm in this dystopian society. A society living in such extreme difficulty conditions but never losing the capacity to enjoy simple things whenever they are able. How this society ultimately triumphs against all odds is a riveting part of the story.But at last the writing which I felt let down such a brilliant plot. it would have been a great novel if supported by stronger writing, even if English is not my mother's tongue. On the other hand maybe it is meant to cater to younger readers even if the themes do not. It really does come across as a simplified version meant for easier reading. However there is no doubt I love the story till the end.

This medieval period piece is a gem of a little story. It says 49 pages but it reads much longer because it has so much story in it and the two MCs are so well developed and likable. I love Bertie, the cross dressing effeminate brother of a king, who rose to the occasion when wars demanded it. Bertie's openness is delightful and his public  declaration of his love for the great General Godric is funny yet touching. Godric is quite a character. Stoic like a rock it is wonderful when he finally gave in to his heart desire. This is a fantastic short. I always thought this writer has great and original ideas and once again I am proven right.

Ok after this one I think I have enough of this writer. The MCs interaction is too typical Mary Calmes and after a while I was just bored with them. Their sexual roles was kind of silly which I ended up skipping. As for the action parts there were so many names involved. Miro getting hurt as he hurled himself into action was just inconsistent with this character we were told in the beginning (a little bit of Jory here, huh). And of course Miro with his 4 female best friends is rather formulaic Calmes. The only two parts I like were glimpses of Sam Kage and  when one of Miro's 4 female best friends insisted on keeping one loveable wolf like dog named Chickie.

From Who We Are to the Art of Breathing, this has been a wonderfully fulfilling week of reading for me. Enough has been said of this 3rd book by 59 reviewers before me. All I have to add is that  TJ Klune is one extraordinary writer, his style unique. There is no other writer who writes like him. It is just crazily astounding and engrossing, his characters completely captivating and so alive that their dialogues, musings resonate long after I finish the book. Beautiful beautiful Bear and The Kid. My only little niggle is Dominic's action which left me annoyed because The Kid should only have the best. Looking forward to the 4th book.

This steam punk fantasy adventure is so well written. The world this writer has created is just remarkable and amazing, the description so vivid and interesting that it is so easy to visualize it in my head. Practically another world floating on top of another one! Class distinction like the Victorian time. The working of magic told from a very refreshing angle. Then there are the boys made to slave away beneath really rotten and cruel scoundrels, so reminiscent of the classic Oliver Twist. There are times when my heart is in my throat because I do not want anything bad to happen to any of these poor boys. And right in the center is Neil, a very likable hero. I love Neil's character. He may have lost nearly everything, stripped off a wealthy environment he knew so well, forced to adapt to a life without any luxury but not once did he mop in self pity. He quickly accepted his misfortunes and tried to be the best teacher to his boys. I love his compassion towards his young charges and his love for his half sister. I also like the gruff Leofa and their slow burning romance is so fitting to the story itself. As for the plot, it is seamless, the thrilling parts have me at the edge of my seat. The little twist at the end, on Leofa's identify is a nice one. Gay love is frowned upon in this Victorian-like society and I like how the writer make it work for these guys. While I am most satisfied with the ending I would love to visit this fantasy world again. Great stuff. If this is a debut, this writer has blown me away.

I finished all 4 books in one go. So much fun. Great development in their romance and lovely plot. Love this couple. Ao is such a cutie pie and Ryomei is such an adorable brooding seme, lol. These two provide so many delightful and entertaining moments together. Their facial expressions are priceless, their interactions whether it is 10 years ago or now just divine. The supporting characters are great especially both guys' best friends each one having a say in the guys' relationship. This Yaoi series has earned its place in the front placing of my shelves  to be reread and reread... Love it.

Four distinct stories here with alternating chapters. They are pretty good but like all short stories one is left wanting towards the end. The weakest story is the one involving two co-workers which I guess is meant to be a comedy. The romance between a kindergarten teacher and one of the kids' high school brother is the longest and has a wistful tone to it. My favorite is the one of the same title where two friends met 10 years later and rekindled their relationship. The one about brotherly love (not the romantic type) is quite good too.

I am so glad I held off reading Volume 1 until Volume 2 is released. Reading both books on the same day is such a rewarding and wonderful experience. A day after, I am still thinking about the story, the two guys and their ending. There is such a lot of depth and emotions in the story. The plot flows seamlessly and of course the lovely artwork. Both Togame and Yorozu are such well defined and complex characters. I love their slowly developing relationship and when they finally came together in Volume 2 it is just so convincing and beautiful. In the afterword, Narise Konohara mentioned a novel about Togame's high school days and the couple's life together. I wished Digital or Sublime will license it!

Of course I have been looking forward to this one and finished it on the same day it was downloaded. Totally satisfied and happy as I come to the end because it has been such a reading pleasure after a lot of sub standard books in this MM genre. Yet wistful too as it would be another long wait for the next Lanyon's book and the almost listless running through my huge pile of what to read next. But back to Josh's latest. Reviews before me have voiced out pretty much how I feel about this book. The cover and the title from a 1961 released melancholic and nostalgic music piece could not be more fitting for the story. I love the wonderful atmosphere, the at times melancholic tone, the at times dreamy setting, the detailed descriptions that make it so easy to "live" in the story as I follow Griff's journey. I love Griff and Pierce, their bantering,  Griff's reaction to the man that is Pierce, their enemies to lovers romance so well done. I enjoy the pacing of the mystery, the twists and turns as the plot unfolds, the family drama of the almost other worldly rich seamlessly weaved into the story and the final revelation took me by surprise and a bit angry too as justice could not be really served. As with a great story I just wish there is more but really Josh does not need to pen another word. Yet I am greedy for a short on this couple with their families. Definitely a reread for me and as I always say, kudos to you Josh Lanyon and thank you. And finally I have to say I have been playing that soulful clarinet music piece for the past few days..

I thought this young adult fantasy starting in a contemporary setting but ending in the ancient fantasy world of Greek mythology itself is very well written. The plot is action packed, filled with danger and romance, fun, entertaining yet highly relevant with surprising depth. As the narrator of the story, young Jamie's voice is very engaging. He comes across a very credible and likable young hero. Small for his age but handling himself as best as he could, with his doubts as he deals with his personal relationships and showing unexpected courage as he is forced to fulfill a prophecy. Like other reviewers have mentioned I really like that parents and adults play solid and relevant roles in the plot. All the secondary characters are well fleshed out and drive the story as much as Jamie even if this is Jamie's narration. The romance is the usual bully turned lover but this is the type of love story which works. Billy complements Jamie nicely and I enjoy the development of their relationship from "enemies" to friends and to lovers. Females play important supporting roles in this story whether they are mothers, enemy, best friend or even a goddess lending a guiding hand and I like that. And finally what stands out in this story making it memorable for me is the unexpected, touching, amazing yet bittersweet ending. I have to say I shed some tears even if it is not really sad tears. I do not think I will forget this story because of the ending. Such a great read and highly recommended. Definitely will watch out for more from this writer.

I really enjoy this historical suspense novel. The plot is intriguing and suspenseful as our hero searched for his long lost brother after receiving a 1918 dated letter in 1933. The setting of the story is most unusual and such vivid descriptions. Imagine an abandoned hill resort with its cabins linked together by underground tunnels fed by a sulphur spring. Tunnels or canals which men can get lost in or used for their own innocent or nefarious ends. The plot is tightly paced with many thrilling scenes as layers of mysteries are peeled away and I thought the flashbacks are well done and interesting as so much of Aiden's tragic family background is revealed. The focus is on the mystery shrouding the ruins and Aiden's missing brother who is somehow ensnarled in it. There is really not much time given to the romance between Aiden and Sebastian which is rather instant. But the lack of romantic development is more than made up by the very original and suspenseful plot. And I really like the feeling of the Great Depression after WWI and the years before WWII in the story. The writer did make up for the lack of romance in the last few chapters after the climax which had me at the edge of my seat. Speaking of the climax I still feel sad by what happened to two of the secondary characters. I wish the writer could have been kinder. On the other hand it is not something I would forget any time soon. As for Aiden and Sebastian they certainly deserve their lives together. Great read.

Sometimes there is just too much sweetness in the mm romance genre and I am glad a friend brought this one up in the mm romance thread. In the perfect romantic world  of mm romance Ryan and Joseph are improper characters, yet I find myself completely engrossed with their improper behaviour, no small reason due to the absorbing writing. There is just something darkly fascinating with the way Joseph seduced and ensnarled Ryan. Theirs is more like obsession than love even when the writer decided to inject the love word towards the end, which I find rather unfitting and disappointing that the writer feels the necessity to revert to the usual formula. Another little niggle is the revelation of Joseph's past which I thought is unnecessary drama and again the typical formula. But the writing, the flow of the plot just kept me reading from start to finish because I just need to find out what happen next. There is no dull moment in the plot. This is definitely not the last of these characters. However I am fine with the story ending the way it did. Recommended for those of us fed up with the usual corny sweetness and want a break in our favourite genre. And oh yes I will definitely be watching out for more stories from this writer.

Scotts has always worked well as our choice of grass seed and care. We have used their turf builder grass seed many times. This blend is their heat tolerant blue mix and is my least favorite.It come sin 3, 7 or 20 lb bags. Its 99.99% weed free, we had no issues growing weeds with it. It has the water smart plus coating so it absorbs water and protects the seedlings. Like with anything you plant or try to grow, proper care is Always needed. I can't stress that enough. Just because a product has some form of "aid" to help you doesn't mean you do any less for its care- especially while its a seedling and early stages.We used ours to patch an area in full sun light here in CT. It is ticker and at first I thought it wasn't going to blend well but it did.  This blend recovers well from any heat or drought and it spreads to repair wear and tear. We only just had the pleasure of trying this and going into the colder season now but I can say it did grow fast and fill our gaps nicely. I look forward to spring to see how it comes back in and how well it does over the summer here. We also have more patchwork in the spring- I will make an update over the summer of 2016 based on how well this product does then during the real test periods.

These are all natural breath drops for cats and dogs. You basically give them 3 drops a day to help keep that fresh brush - no brushing required. You just add it to their water 3 drops per 16 ounces and that it- the product does the rest. It takes about a week (for our trial 5 days) and we notice better breath. However this should not be a replacement for not brushing. Just like our teeth can have problems if we don't brush dog's teeth are the same. Some pets do have bad breath from past history, adoptions, sickness, etc. One of our rescues has bad teeth, many removed = bad breath too. She was eager to try this for us, no issues with tasting it in the water and you could smell the difference but it did not last the 12 hours either. We estimated it around 8 hours before smelling that bad breathe again. So it works, but not as long as it claimed to for our dog.

Seeds of beauty is a dietary supplement to promote younger looking skin. It aids in preventing those deep wrinkles. One box has 21 pineapple flavor drink mix packets. They are convenient as you can take them with you and add to a water bottle anywhere. They contain pep tan collagen which is something clinically proven to show enhance skin hydration.You need to first like the taste of these which I dislike personally. Yes, its a good supplement, your hair, nails and skin will all thank you. But I think pill form is better specially from the artificial taste. It also has high fructose corn syrup.  They are gluten free, but the corn syrup and taste kill it for me. I'd rather something with out that additive and something that tastes good if I have to drink it. Or - have the vitamin in a pill form instead. They aren't cheap either at nearly 30$ for the box if 21.

This is a 12 mg, 30 count bottle of Jarrow Formulas "Astaxanthin" It promotes a healthy inflammatory response - supporting skin during sun exposure and joint and eye health. I have tried a few of Jarrow Formulas and I either loved them or hated them (they worked great or didn't work at all for us)This was one of the formula's I love. This supports your whole body. It reduced my muscle and joint pain. I had more energy and less fatigue too. I will keep on purchasing this. I've tried other stuff in the past including medication and hated the side affects. If this keeps on working, with no side affects I will be very happy.Abit more on Astaxanthin - It is a natural antioxidant carotenoid derived from the fermentation of the microalgae Haematococcus pluvialis. Clinical studies have demonstrated that Astaxanthin may promote a healthy inflammatory response, supports skin during exposure to a normal amount of sunlight and supports joint and eye health. It has no wheat, no gluten, no soybeans, no dairy, no egg, no fish/shellfish, and no peanuts/tree nuts. It should be stored in a cool, dry place but do not refrigerate.

Being I have a high stress life I thought these may be a good trial to see if they have any affect. They are non gmo and support brain and memory support. They are meant to support a healthy stress response by moderating the release of cortisol, a catabolic stress hormone.They do contain Soy. The capsule consists of gelatin as well. You take 1 capsule 3x a day with meals. 1 bottle has 90 capsules. So you get enough for 1 month for $30- bit pricey. However I think they are worth the try for a month to see if they help you or help your treatment program. If you have adrenal fatigue from prolonged stress or even from a long illness these may help. I have 3 kids, one being special needs and requires alot of 1:1. So my days are beyond stressful. I feel like these helped reduce it but not sure it had positive effects on focus, etc.. I didn't see much change but I do plan to purchase another month to see.

My son tried these for his gas pains and the way his gut works (or doesn't work) after eating. As it is he is mostly dairy free and wheat free. These are suitable for vegetarians/vegans and they have no wheat, no gluten, no soybeans, no dairy, no egg, no fish/shellfish, and no peanuts/tree nuts. So it is a plus finding a vegan supplement. Sometimes with nuts, tofu and others he has issues digesting. He eats a higher protein diet and he said he had some relief mostly when he ate stuff in the bean family. Overall I wasn't completely satisfied as it was a hit / miss over the pass month. Whether they were trying to help or it was a fluke and he just had less that day it's hard to really say. We are going to concentrate more on his diet over supplements for now since we haven't had much luck with them.

Well I tried these out the past 30 days in hopes to support appetite and weight management with my son. He complained about the size and texture of them but got them down. In 30 day's absolutely no change. You take them half hour - 2 hours before a mean which we did but they again had no affect. We tried another in the past that worked alittle but only suppressed it so much so I was hoping to find another that worked better but our search is still on. It seriously was like he didn't take them at all. Would not recommend these.

I have tried this gentle facial cleansing powder a few months ago after seeing it in one of our stores. It's a water activated powder. So it activates when you mix with water and wash your face. It has camellia and ginkgo biloba in it to unclog pores and soften your skin. It exfoliates well but I dislike the powder form. When you open it - it smells good but your sometimes hit with powder that comes out of the top hole. That easily goes into your nose and sometimes eyes and I end up sneezing a bunch. You have to be really careful, and half the times I grab it and open it like a normal bottle and powder goes all over.Besides that, it also made my skin to dry if I used it too often. It would get dry and flaky if I used it every day. I ended up not using it and then didn't want to be bothered by having powder all over. So for me its just OK. I tried it a again this past month but the issues were the same.

If you have a few of those stack-able patio chaise lounges on your patio or deck and are seeking a cover you have just found the right one. If your stacking 2 high, you can choose the 2 high option, or if more you can choose the 6 high stack option for up to 6 lounge's. It will fit the stacks 75" long and 27" wide so you can measure before in case your's are oversize. They fit my stack of 5 great.The cover has a waterproof backing and elastic hem cords. It has reinforced padded handles making removal very easy. It's all double stitched- very durable. We have a fire pit cover too and a few other covers we got a few month's back for our patio furniture and all have been awesome. I love the black color - always my favorite, looks elegant and hides any dirt. This also has the vents to prevent any wind lofting and keep mildew away. It also comes with a 4 year replacement warranty through the manufacturer.

This is a nicely made high security cable lock for dell notebooks and hardware too. It's cut resistant and made of a steel composite cable. This is 6 feet in length - plenty to secure your device. Its a nice design and has a pivoting 90 degree cable connection so its easy to use. The lock head on the lock has a hidden pin technology that protects the lock from being picked - nice and secure for those that need such a lock. You get two keys with this set. Good investment if you need to lock your device to your desk or office furniture, etc.

These are super soft underwear that fit. They stretch to fit 2 sizes - current and one up so if you gain etc, the idea is they will still stretch to fit, yet when you loose they will still be perfect. Perhaps thats why they are big however they feel big. They do move with you but pending what you wear on top of them they are not comfy with so much extra material.They are mid rise briefs but on me come up super high, past my belly button ! They are the size I take so they are accurate in size / my body size however they did not fit well at all. The colors are nice and they washed well (didnt shrink) - in a way I wanted them to so they could fit better ! Maybe order a size down and maybe they will fit better?

If you have the space for this beautiful art table you and your kids or daycare will love it. It measures 58.6 x 30.4 x 4.9 inches and weighs about 60lbs. Alex Toys super art table comes complete with an 18x100 foot paper roll. It also has a child safe paper cutter so kids of age can easily cut their own paper when they finish their projects. My daughter is 5 and has no trouble doing this.  She draws, colors, paints, - anything can go on this paper its heavy duty white bond paper.The table itself has 3 removable storage cups. It also has a storage canvas bin. Their is plenty of room for crayons paper, supplies and more. Instead of chairs, this art table comes with not one but two benches! Everything is solid wood and assembles very easily. I did it myself and had no issues. It even came with the assembly tool. The surface of the table is actually a chalkboard, so your kids can just drawn away on it and then you can wipe it away easily. It's great if your preparing paints and they are waiting (using chalk to draw) as my daughter does.We have a 14 month old too and once she hits 2 1/2 - 3 she will be of age to sit at the bench nicely and use it. For now, we sit with her or bring over her chair.I love the style of the table, its already so colorful so even if you get paint or markers on it- it won't look any different. Most stuff washes off anyhow easily.. but it won't stain it like some tables stain (wooden ones with no color)The paper roll is underneath and easy to change when the time comes. I also like that the paper reaches both sides so you can have a kid or few on each side drawing or such on the same piece of paper - great for sharing and making things together on one sheet. If you need to separate you can use construction paper etc and every kid will have their own sheet. It works out really nicely. A refil roll of paper is about 9$ so not bad at all for all the fun that comes with this art table.If you don't need both benches you can push one under the table - we have part of the table up against the wall, so we are only using one bench until our youngest gets bigger. Great art table. Looks great in the room too.

I just received my Zoe stroller and I am hoping it holds up to my expectations. I am in need of a very lightweight, portable, easily collapsible stroller. So far my expectations have been met. I can't wait to test this out on an upcoming trip- at that point I will update my review further.For now its a 10lb stroller! Very light. It collapses with 1 hand, EASILY. I can't stress that enough, and it close's so it won't keep opening up on you. To open, just unlatch and pop open, it clicks into place and ready for use. I love the adult cup holder and options it comes with for the child. You can have a cup holder, a snack holder or both.. or a bar- ALL are included. The basket underneath is a very good size for such a small stroller. The footrest is smaller then others but it does it's job just as well as the others.Canary is a decent size, in a way I wish it had another flip out but it may just be perfect - I'll know on our trip as were going to be in a sunny location (Florida).The seat straps are nice, they adjust and its a 5 point harness. The wheels lock or swivel pending your terrain. Breaks are easy to do and lock this baby in place. I also noticed its nicely grounded / made. Most lightweight strollers you tap on the back and they start to tilt. Not this one. You really have to "push" to get it to slightly wanna tilt. It's a big difference. I can't wait to use this in just a few more weeks, for now we will uses it out and about and I will again update in a few weeks.

We have a family accountant who is quite familiar with Sage 50 as well as QuickBooks and others. This is the newest version 2016.Sage 50 Premium Accounting 2016 is perfect if your an accountant or even if you have your own business but its not a beginner program. It's more for the experienced or one willing to learn it inside and out. It's fairly easy to use software but just takes time to learn all the in's and out's of it as it does contain many powerful tools.This is a very expensive program as the rate you pay right now is for 1 (yes one) year. After that you have to repay. You do get 3-users on the one we have, and can opt to get just a 1 user or a 5 user per disk or even opt for digital users- so you have a lot of options their. You also get 1 year of support and any upgrades included.The program is vast, you can manage costs, employees, even security and of course accounting, inventory management and even reporting for strategic growth. Their are many budget and analysis tools. You can even compare multiple budges or create custom reports. It really will keep your business on tract.Sage Premium contains more features then their cheaper Pro version. Premium version includes audit trail, change order processing, departmentalized financial statements, inventory and services management center and job costing - phase and cost level features to name a few. If you don't need any of that their Pro version may work better or you.You can export alot right to Excel too, its  a breeze. For some quick books may work good,. but if you can use all the features, Safe 50 may be your best option. It's very well suited for those working and training in accounting. If your in a small firm or such I would say Safe 50 is perfect for you.

VTech Go! Go! toys are Fun! Fun! for little ones. They are rated mostly ages 1-5. My 14 month old loves them. They are bulky pieces so their little  hands can easily grab them and place them. With this set, you can pretend to be the doctor and give healthy checkups. Their are 3 interactive points in this playset. Fun phrases,. lights, and music are activated within those points. Their are over 25 songs, sounds, melodies and phrases. Dr. Doug will even introduce himself if you press his light up button. These sets all work together. This set comes with 5 track pieces's but we have ours attached to our other sets which makes for a nice town my daughter has going on in our playroom. When not in use they come apart easily and we store them in a bin. This set requires 2 AAA batteries. Although it comes with some they are demo ones and won't last long. Great set! Perfect for those motor skills, role playing, colors and more.

This is an adorable little game that you play right from the box! I like games like that as they are compact and the board or parts stay where they belong and don't venture to far away... which can lead to them getting lost. This game is great for motor skills, dexterity and color matching. It's perfect for kids around age 4. Their are small parts, but not super small but still can be a chocking hazard due to their size.Basically you move the apples around the tree, or try to pop the apples out on the first try. If you land it in the basket you get extra points. The apples are different colors. You need to get different color apples and that's where the challenge is. Great game for patience, turn taking and learning how to play well with others and have fun.

These are very nice thick blue nitrile gloves. They are powder free and disposable but more important they fit well, are durable and come in a few sizes - medium and large. One box has 100 gloves- all are latex free which is important for those with a latex allergy and you never know if a patient will have one so its always good to be on the safe size and accomodating.Nitrile gloves provide better elasticity then vinyl gloves. They are more durable too in my experience they are less likely to puncture and they have better abrasion resistance.

These are very nice thick black nitrile gloves. They are powder free and disposable but more important they fit well, are durable and come in a few sizes. One box has 100 gloves- all are latex free which is important for those with a latex allergy and you never know if a patient will have one so its always good to be on the safe size and accomodating.Nitrile gloves provide better elasticity then vinyl gloves. They are more durable too in my experience they are less likely to puncture and they have better abrasion resistance. Standard-length glove is 9.5" long and has a beaded wrist cuff that is 3 mils thick (This is size medium measurements)

These will be on those WWE fan' gift lists this year. This one is superstar John Cena. You can mix and match his gear, body parts and attire to any of the other WWE Superstars. You can create unlimited combinations. Loads of imaginative play. All the battle gear is compatible with other 6 inch figure's. The kids really seem to like creating their own combo, we have a few of these.They do snap together easily, we had one other that kept falling apart but we come to learn it was a fluke and the part itself. If you ever have that issue just email the company they will replace it! Most also come with a tattoo sheet, and of course a few extra's whether its a vest, boots, etc. Great toy!

These will be on those WWE fan' gift lists this year. This one is superstar Bray Wyatt. You can mix and match his gear, body parts and attire to any of the other WWE Superstars. You can create unlimited combinations. Loads of imaginative play. All the battle gear is compatible with other 6 inch figure's. The kids really seem to like creating their own combo, we have a few of these.They do snap together easily, we had one other that kept falling apart but we come to learn it was a fluke and the part itself. If you ever have that issue just email the company they will replace it! Great toy!

These will be on those WWE fan' gift lists this year. This one is superstar Kane Rocker. You can mix and match his gear, body parts and attire to any of the other WWE Superstars. You can create unlimited combinations. Loads of imaginative play. All the battle gear is compatible with other 6 inch figure's. The kids really seem to like creating their own combo, we have a few of these.They do snap together easily, we had one other that kept falling apart but we come to learn it was a fluke and the part itself. If you ever have that issue just email the company they will replace it! Great toy!

This is a solid armor shell case for your Galaxy S6 Edge Plus Only. It will only fit that model. It meets military drop test standards.. and household with pets and kids standards. Its very light weight case yet has such impact resistance. Easy to access all the buttons and ports and I know my phone is safe. Very happy with this case. It's on my son's phone who is autistic, and his device takes a beating... but is well protected in this.

It sort of works. It's suppose to kill fleas, ticks, flea eggs even flea larvae for a month. It's suppose to repel those mosquitoes that may transmit heart worm disease and others. It spreads oils on your dogs skin which then spread throughout their skin.  One box has a 6 month supply.Compared to other products, I find this to be cheaper, but work's less. By less I mean it was "working" started too, but then in about 2 weeks it stopped working. Seems like no sooner does it help, it stops. Won't use again.

Smart idea these Poo-Pourri before you go toilet sprays. Simply gives a spritz before you go, and thats it. Its made of essential oils in a variety of  scents to fight those stinky smells! One bottle will last a LONG time, up to 200 uses in the little 4 ounce bottle. We have a few of these and have one in each of our bathrooms and I honestly have to say they do work. It's getting the men to remember to spritz! But when they remember I can go in right after them- and no not picking men over woman but in my household the men do rule when it comes to the bathroom. So this product has been awesome for our house.

I like New Chapter vitamins and products. I have purchased their regular woman vitamins in the past and they worked well for me. These are their immune take care support immune system. It's non GMO, vegetarian and 100% multi herbal. You take 1 daily.One capsule contains %DV Elderberry (Sambucus nigra) (fruit) 335 mg  (min. 45 mg total anthocyanins) Black Currant (Ribes nigrum) (fruit) 50 mg  (min. 5 mg total anthocyanins)  Daily Value not established Other ingredients: Capsule (polysaccharide [Aureobasidium pullulans], contains 2% or less of: carrageenan and guar gum) and maltodextrin. Naturally gluten free. 100% vegetarian; no artificial flavors or colors.One month's supply is 25$... they are privy, but if you stick with them for months you will see the benefits. I learned that with their other products, you pay for what you get, and they do make a difference. As a mother of 3, one being special needs its important that my immune system is in tack, even when I skip meals and get lack of sleep. These have worked for me in the past and its no different now. Great supplement.

Now I know every baby is so different with teething. Some get fevers, some cranky, some are perfectly fine. I have had 3 children and each were different with their teething. In the past I tried a few other brands and it made no difference. I gave this all natural Hyland's brand a try which temporarily relieves the pain from babies cutting teeth. It helps to reduce the redness and inflammation of the gums. In all honestly I couldn't see any difference. She made alot of strange faces and went back to being cranky.From my experience, just waiting it out has been the best option, you will get a few days here a few days there. But even though I saw no difference, every baby is different so yours may just find this enough to cut the edge off. You don't know til you try and going the all natural way is always best.

For Frozen fans who are going to create a party themed Frozen, this book may be for you. It comes at a price for only 64 pages - or 22 suggestions. It offers great selections from invitations to decorations. It has ideas on games, food, even table settings. The photo's are really amazing, and you can create some awesome things but time, money and effort are all needed as well. The outcome is one big frozen fever party for sure that will be remembered.

This is a cute and new "hot" toy for this year. Its Flipsies by VTech. This house and ocean cruiser is Sandy's house. It's very cute, detailed and interactive. My daughter loves it. She literally will play for hours with it. It totally sparks her imagination.Their are so many options to play, its like a 2 in 1 playhouse. You can transform it from a house to a ocean cruiser! Explore the ocean and go on adventures. Or have a nice beach house and have friends over. Sandy will respond to different phrases as well as to other Flipsies girls. Very cute set, my daughter already requested more from "Santa".

This is a nice WWE figure, The Rock. He is 6 inch size and the gear he comes with is compatible with other 6 inch figures. You can mix and match the gear and body parts with these new create a superstar figures. Their are unlimited combinations, and kids have lots of fun creating "new" characters. We have a few of these and they are always mixed and matched. They are a nice toy, I like the idea but also like the classic ones that can be roughhoused without the parts falling off. But to be creative and spark more imagination, these are an awesome addition.

Unfortunately lice does happen too often these days. My daughters school has had it since September and it keeps going round and round. Quit Nits eliminates head lice and their eggs and works very well. Its a treatment cream and it also helps prevent re-infestation. It's an everyday preventative spray. Two tubes of the cream are included and one of the spray. It's non toxic and 100% natural, all homeopathic. Their is no combing required with this either. It does work well I do feel using the comb though is best. It's a nice kit to have on hand as you never know especially when their are kids in school.

If you or someone you know is expecting a precious baby girl, this is a perfect set by SwaddleMe. It's a girls 3 pack "Pink Whales" made from 100% cotton. It's perfect for when that new addition come home and seeks that womb-like feeling - these keep baby nice and cozy. I love love love the fact that they work with a car seat and sleeper restraints- they have slits in the fabric for the harness. This is great when using in those sleepers at home. The wings have hook and loop attachments so you can easily adjust them and secure for the perfect snugly fit. They wash well, come out super soft and are a perfect thickness. Love them!

If you or someone you know is expecting a precious baby boy, this is a perfect set by SwaddleMe. It's a boys 3 pack "Teak Whales" made from 100% cotton. Its size small so perfect for those new additions when they come home. It provides a womb-like feeling and keeps baby nice and cozy. Its for baby 0-6 months. I love love love the fact that they work with a car seat and sleeper restraints- they have slits in the fabric for the harness. This is great when using in those sleepers at home. The wings have hook and loop attachments so you can easily adjust them and secure for the perfect snugly fit. They wash well, come out super soft and are a perfect thickness. Love them!

These are so cool. They are oragami paper napkins and they come in a nice vibrant variety of colors. Each set includes 12 napkins. The napkins are 8 x 3 inches in a rectangular shape. They are pre-folded. Once you open the napkin it reveals a beautiful star origami design. Opened they are 16 x 24 inches. You can only use them once, but they are totally worth it. Very elegant.

Love this furby! This is your basic furby but Star Wars style! It's Furbacca and its so cute. Furbacca is interactive and reacts to motion and touch just like the standard furby's. If you are able to use the Furbacca app (we can - we use an iphone) you get even more interactive play. You can unlock furby furblings and the kids totally lobe that. You can create adventures and scenes from the movie. And yes the app is free!If you can't use the app, don't worry you and your kids will get total enjoyment out of Furbacca. If you have other furbys it does interact with other ones. Furbacca makes many noises groans, purrs and so much more. My son loves playing with it solo as its "Star Wars" and no need to stay more their. Where as my daughter wants her other furbys to "play along". Either way it will be a huge huge hit!

You pay for what you get.... that's the only way to sum up these awesome soccer cleats. They come with that price tag but are so worth it for a serious soccer player. They are so lightweight. They provide as close as a touch to the ball as you can get. It's Puma's lightest cleat yet. It's super strong and supportive, and so comfortable. It's flexible giving you the perfect cleat for your soccer playing. Puma put speed and precision into these cleats and it shows in their performance.The upper material of the clean it ultra thin textile. The lightweight support has the speedframe in the middle. And for excellent visibility, the form stripe works perfect. Their are conical studs underneath for those quick turns and traction stud for the better ground penetration and stability. With the traction stud you get more forward acceleration.If you are upgraded from a cheaper pair you will completely see the difference in how they feel, how you run and how you kick... and of course how you play. So far they have held up great even with their lightweight thin frame. Great cleat!

This product is suppose to be a 3 day weight loss jump start. It kick starts your weight lost program. It suppose to help with that fat burning and appetite control and giving you that flatter abdomen. Well... depends how you look at it, but its basically an unpleasant laxative so you will be very bathroom friendly for those 3 days (if you choose to do all 3 and torture yourself). So yeah, you are likely to loose some weight from being sick and in the bathroom constantly. It curbs your appetite because of your "runs" and of course you will loose weight because of all the diarrhea and feeling sick and not eating. Not my way to want to loose weight thats for sure. I would pass on this one...

This SoTru protein shake is packed with 18 grams of pure organic plant protein each and every serving. It's chocolate flavored -organic of course, and is dairy, soy, sugar and gluten free. It's vegan and hypoallergenic as well.The plant proteins are from whole-grain brown rice, quinoa, amaranth, and a blend of six species of medicinal mushrooms providing a well-balanced profile of plant based amino acids. All of its is to help support a healthy, active lifestyle. Taste wise I'm mixed. It takes alot of mixing first of all to blend it well otherwise you have that clump taste. I've tried it in water, almond milk, on ice, a few ways. Every way pretty much tasted the same... bleh at first but after some sips of getting use to it - it was more tolerable.. But I never was able to finish the entire glass. I wish it tasted better as I really enjoy everything it has to offer, but the taste.

This is your basic Apple certified lightning to USB cable. It comes in 6ft, 3ft and even 4 inches. It charges and syncs your apple devices- its compatibility with iPhone 6s Plus / 6s / 6 Plus / 6 / 5s / 5c / 5 / iPad Pro / iPad Air / Air 2 / iPad mini / mini 2 / mini 4 / iPad 4th gen / iPod Touch 5th gen / iPod nano 7th gen and Beats Pill+. It works well whether you device is in a case or not- doesn't matter. It seems well made and I like the size ranges. Good cable.

Thames & Kosmos really puts everything into their products. We own a few other sets, ranging from labs, exploring and chemistry and every single one has been great. This master detective toolkit met our expectations. Its packed with everything a detective needs. Your kid can learn about how detectives use forensic science to answer questions, gather evidence, and solve crimes. They can even experiment with the equipment and techniques used by real detectives. They can learn about securing a crime scene and gathering and documenting evidence, including fingerprints, footprints, and tire tracks. Eventually you can learn to solve the mock crime presented in the manual.  The manual is a 48-page, full-color experiment book. It guides your investigations and has step-by-step instructions- easy for the kids and adults to follow. Ages 8 + (through 15 as rated by manufacturer)The kit has a total off 26 experiments and comes with 33 pieces. The pieces include a magnifying glass, invisible ink pen, fingerprint powder, crime scene tape, plaster powder for casting footprints, and plenty more. The kit comes in a handy carrying case so everything can be stored right in the case, nicely organized and ready to go. Great set.

Both myself and my 15 year old son have used Proactiv products in the past and were pleased with the results. This re-texturing toner helps to improve and smooth out your skin texture. It has an alcohol free, fragrance free, paraben free and oil free formula. It's also non-comedogenic, and dermatologist tested. The kit includes a 6 ounce with 90 pads. It's suitable for all skin types, my skin and my son's are totally different but for each of us it worked well smoothing out my skin and improving his. You can apply it twice a day - however we only do it once a day because twice a day makes our skin to tight / dry. We have seen this in past products too so we apply less and have good results. If we apply to much we do get very tight red skin which is not fun- so keep that in mind that perhaps your skin can only tolerate once a day.The pads you go through fast, even at 90 and two people using them.. and sometimes we double up as they are quite thin. But overall the product made our skin feel brighter, nicer texture. I don't know if its "needed" as I feel the other ache / skin cleaning proactiv products work best for my son but this is nice making your face look bright and feel good.

Quinny Zapp has a very nice travel system for anyone expecting a new baby. This is a great system for 1 baby. You can use the car seat until 22 lbs *which is typically around a year old* -  and the stroller part until 50 pounds. The thing that stood out the most was the maneuverability of the stroller system. It's so flexible, so easy to push and turn and move. The stroller folds compactly. You have two choices for the seat too, it can face rear or forward facing. This set is all about options.The stroller is awesome. It fully reclines and you can adjust it to face two ways. You literally can go just about anywhere with it. It folds with the seat on it *unlike the prior model* and its such a small compact fold- one of the best. It is the only buggy around that is compatible with a baby car seat by Maxi -Cosi to use it from birth on up. Speaking of the car seat - your baby can use it up until 22lbs (from 5 - 22lbs, or basically birth to 12 months about / up to 29") It has advance air protect side impact protection. The car seat is very very light. It's the lightest infant car seat on the market (compared to seats as of Jan 2014) It's very light. It has ergonomic handle so its comfortable when holding it alone or with your little turkey- as they turn into those butterballs real fast! A lighter car seat is nice when your growing baby adds up the pounds. The car seat has some nice features. It has self-wicking fabric that actually deodorizes and draws liquids away from the skin to keep baby dry and comfy - in case the seat gets wet / spit on etc. Of course it is still machine washable and dryer safe if you need. The base is very nice, it was easy to install, I got it nice and tight. You can get accessories for this too, a bug net or a weather shield are available separately. The car seat also features infant support for smaller babies and a flip out visor on the canopy for added sun protection.Back to the stroller... it also has a very nice shopping basket below, easy access and holds up to 11lbs of stuff. The seat cover is water repellent... any spills, just wipe clean, its that easy. The foot rest is fully adjustable - great for those growing kids allowing them to relax when napping. The wheels are so nice. Whether your in the city or on rough terrain, you have the option to keep them swivel or lock into straight position for that rougher area. The sun canopy is very nice, open and closes with easy. The handle bars are so comfortable - and the height is perfect.Quinny has many accessories sold separately too for this stroller / seat set. You can get a cup holder, foot-muff, weather-shield, even a parasol. This is a very nice travel system. It arrives in a few parts, but 20 minutes later it was easily put together. I love how smooth the stroller rides and handles. Excellent quality. Everything is comfortable, I even had my 5 year old test out the stroller to see how easy it was to push her in it over her little sister. You would never know the weight difference. Excellent safe investment.

DII Home Essentials has a good variety of sized tablecloths all in 100% polyester. Our table fits the 63" round size. *which seats 4 people*. I love the design. We use it as an overlay for a color below pending on the season or holiday. Could be red.. orange.. etc. It looks great in any color we have tried.. The lace work is very nice especially for any dinner parties or occasions. It has scalloped edges too, the design is very detailed. They didn't skimp out on the workmanship in these.They are also machine washable which nice. We have washed ours a few times this month and it still looks perfect. Would 100% recommend.

Waterproof pads are a must for babys and kids. This is a great multi use protective pad cover that measures 18x27. You can use it to line a pack n play, crib or bed. It folds now nicely so good for traveling with it too. It's sized nice so you can also use it as a changing pad as we have done. It works really well. The back and top are 100% polyester. The middle layer is the waterproof vinyl. It's machine washable with like colors. The polyester side has a teddy bear pattern - cute.It's nice and absorbent too, my daughter did pee on this nicely for us to test out during a diaper change.. and she did alot, and it absorbed very nicely - she was nice and dry and none of it leaked off or threw. Great pad.

These are nice size packets of dried baby food. You add breast milk, formula or even water to prepare it. They are organic, non GMO and kosher. The drying preserves the freshness of the food and flavor. This blend is squash, green kale and bananas. My daughter likes this blend. We have tried the other flavors as well including sweet potatoes, oatmeal and bananas, peas, quiona and apples and the carrots, raisins and sweet potato. I like the fact that there is no added salt, sugar or artificial flavors. You get 8 packages for about 16 $.. they are a little costly at $2 or so each thats the only downside.

I have mixed options about this seat, it's not for everyone yet perfect for some. My tester is a year old, 22 lbs. The seat is very very comfortable. It has so much padding you kid won't want to get out of the seat. Even my 5 year old says its so soft. So technically I have two testers here. The car seat has a removable body pillow you can take in and or out. It's very easy to adjust the harness. I really like the removable storage pockets and cup holder. You can put it on either side of the car seat or not use them at all depending the age of your child or space in your car. The expiration date is 10 years from now - which is nice and long for your child to use until they grow out of it.It is rear-facing 9-40 pounds; forward-facing 22-65 pounds. So if you have a baby who is 5, 6,or 7 lbs.. even 8 lbs, you can't use this to take them home, so you need an infant seat (2nd car seat) for those first month.. or months (1-2) at most. You can always use that infant seat longer and then use this in the future as another option. But if your seeking that all in one car seat start to finish this is shy a few pounds. Not all babies are 9lbs to start. All 3 of my children were small ranging 5lbs 3oz - 5lbs 14oz. I do prefer an infant seat anyhow as it's just easier for parent and baby rather then a car seat like this that stays put.It is convertible meaning that rear facing and forward facing. It has side impact protection. I like that the pad removes with snaps - easy to machine wash as well as dry in the dryer. The infant insert is nice to hold that baby but again 9lbs and up. It does recline, 3 positions. I found it a little harder to tighten the harness compared to my other models Britax and Radon. Overall nice seat, not my favorite, but I do like the comfortableness of the seat, its very well padded.

Read First - You Only Get 1 Pair..... I wanted these for our prop station (selfie station) we had at our party. I didn't fully read like many of us but it does state 1 per package.  The picture is misleading and shows three.. It should show one and then have a second picture of color choices to make it less confusing for customers.For the 6$ they are good quality though, they fit kids and adults (my daughter is 5) and we got some great pictures.

If you have the ipad, iphone (or ipod) and the iwatch this docking stand is 100% for you. I own all three and prior to receiving this stand for free for my honest unbiased review I had each device separate sitting on my desk or my nightstand. Wires were scattered, and each had to connect and lay flat taking up more space.Now... its honestly perfect. The docking stands holds each device. I have the bamboo wood one and its a great natural color stand- would go with any decor. It does come in rose wood as well for other color choices which is also a nice color by the looks of it. It holds all the cords out of the way and discreetly. You can charge each device, all on the one stand. I love it, very convenient and holds everything nicely. I wish they made better Inside Out Playsets. I have yet to find one that we like. This is suppose to be the headquarters. It comes with 3 memory spheres and a Joy figure. It also has the projector and furniture pieces.Your suppose to watch the memory spheres roll down the path of the short term memory. You place the spheres in the projector to watch them on the screen of the consciousness. This is an awesome idea for one awesome movie....However, sadly its poorly constructed and poorly works. In order to see the memory spheres on the screen you need a dark dark room.... IF you get that far. They are so tricky to sit in the unit. Very very frustrating if you don't get them in correctly, they won't work. The projector for us didnt snap right, the whole toy just isn't stable. It's so... junky for lack of words. My daughter LOVES Inside Out and she took the figure and that was it... she too hated the set and was unhappy with it saying it needed to be recalled because it didn't work right! Hopefully they fix the issues going on, avoid for now...

Stephen Hawking wrote a very...interesting book when he wrote "A Brief History of Time." While I am not sure I believe all the hype about atoms and the big bang and gravitational pull and what not, I will say Hawking brings up many good points, at least from what I can tell from this brief summary of his full book.Some of the key take aways that I found most interesting include...* The universe began with an explosion know as the big bang* Scientists are searching for a unified theory on how the universe works.* There are 3 arrows of time in the universe that flow in the same direction.I am a firm believer the universe did not begin with the big bang or explosion, instead it was created by God's own hand, however, this is a debate that has been going on for centuries and will continue long after we have left this Earth. The main point is this book seems to be well written and semi-researched, neither of the "issues" I have with this book belong being labeled as Instaread issues but instead the author himself is the one I blame. Instareads did a wonderful job putting this summary together and I am thankful they did so that I did not waste my money purchasing the full version of this book. Wonderful job on the 15 minute summary Instareads as always.*Disclaimer: I received this product at no cost to me in order to facilitate this honest review*

This is super cute and colorful. I love the silicone beads that can help with teething as chewing on them helps sooth the gums. The star that acts as the clip opener and closing mechanism is a big large and heavy. While this is great for older kids I think you would want to hold off using this particular binkie clip on a younger baby.#2. My open and close mechanism seemed to be a bit too loose, it would open easily which is nice because some of those clips can be a royal pain, but it also made it easier for my 18 month old to not only pull the clip off his shirt but also open the clip.Overall, I am very happy with this product and my 18 month old loves it as well, the two issues I had aren't really anything major but I wanted to share for anyone thinking about this product. The one other thing I really liked about this, typical binkie clips have the elastic or ribbon binkie ribbon, and you have to loop it around and secure the binkie, but with this you have a lovely satin ribbon that can be opened and closed with a high quality KAM snap and let me say the snap itself is sturdy, it took me a minute to even open it, so you know that binkie is safe on this clip.Overall, this binkie leash comes highly recommended for style, durability, and functionality.*Disclaimer: I received this product at no cost to me in order to facilitate this honest review.*

When I was growing up the "ultimate love story" was Romeo and Juliet, you know the forbidden love of two families that are fighting, and ends in the tragic death of a very young couple. For the average Joe just looking to learn the basics of html coding then this is a fantastic starting point, for someone wanting to make a career out of html coding then I would probably suggest another option. For me personally, I knew some of the things that were found in this book already just by researching and educating myself but the way the author lays out the information makes this a very easy book to follow and learn from. I'd highly recommend it for a beginner.*Disclaimer: I received this product at no cost to me in order to facilitate this honest review.*

Between Rainbow Light and Garden of Life these two brands are the only ones I will purchase. I refuse to buy vitamins and supplements that are filled with additives and garbage ingredients. Garden of Life is a bit more expensive, so that is why I have decided to give this brand a try. High quality supplements, affordable prices you can't beat it. I am very happy with this purchase and would recommend this company to anyone looking for high quality and natural supplements.
Adorable movie, my 3 year old loves it and it is very colorful.

A word of caution.  Be sure the one you order is for your Kindle.  I made mistake of ordering the one for the 2013 model and had to reorder the 2012 model.  Case seems very well constructed.  Does not have instructions so took a minute or two to figure out that the recessed area on back is to pull the flap and insert the cover to make a stand for the device to sit horizontally.  This does not have a feature that lets you do the same in the vertical (book reading) mode.  It does have a place for pen, pencil or stylus which is nice feature.  The wake/autosleep feature works well.  I bought the Kindle Fire HD to go with my earlier Kindle Fire and I Pad.  Wanted a device mostly for book reading and found my I Pad just too heavy with its cover to read in bed.  The Kindle Fire HD with case is still light weight and easy to use for reading.  Overall this is a great case for a good price.  Easy to recommend.

A further update.  After about six weeks weeks using the program I find it is highly successful for me.  I am now into correcting a muscle imbalance in one of the three categories they describe and already notice some positive change.  For me the exercises are relatively simple and the pain exercises took me about five minutes twice a day and the corrective exercises about 10 minutes once a day.  Have made list so do not have to listen to the instructions which shortens the time period.  I will probably not post further updates unless I find that there is something significant to share.  I have no idea whether the program would work for a large population of those of us with back issues but it certainly has worked for me so far.This is an update of my earlier review.  I have now been using the system for three weeks.  The first two weeks I used the pain relief program and it did help considerably in easing what remained of the pain I was having.  I decided to try this based on a review where the reviewer could not stand for any period or walk any distance without having to sit down.  That was my case for six weeks.  While the pain was finally easing I do think these exercises helped to eliminate it.  I have now gone to the third disc to address a hip imbalance. Of the three muscle imbalances the discs identify this was only one I appeared to have.  Have just started the series of exercises to address this  and will come back and update further.Here is my earlier review:First, I have no relationship to these folks and have numerous Amazon reviews of products.  With something like this I am always uneasy when I do not know who or what is behind a product. And it is not inexpensive.  But if it works!  Their lifetime return guarantee helped me decide to give it a try or at least pay shipping both ways to see if it might be useful.I am just getting started with it and will be back to revise this after using it for a few weeks and can give more details.  For now I have had a sharp pain in rear and down one leg to ankle with some effects in other leg after taking a fall on ice this winter. Started before but aggravated by the fall.  Has gone on for some 6 weeks and while it is now easing for most of that time  could not stand at kitchen counter or walk my dog usual half mile without sitting down.  Even moved chair into kitchen and bought cane chair to take when walking more than 100 feet.  When sitting or lying down no issue.  Going through the first disc it seems likely my problem is piriformis syndrome.  Have done the exercises for this and also the universal exercises  found a couple of exercises clearly  did affect the muscle that is likely my main problem.  My primary care doctor basically has me on NSAIDs which while helping were not nearly this helpful.  X ray showed no hip issue and various tests run showed no other issues involved. Exercises seemed to make the most sense to try and resolve my issues.I have not gotten to disc 3 for the maintenance program but will look it over here shortly.  For now while first time through certainly did not give me complete relief it was encouraging enough to keep at it and see.  I have had too many friends going the invasive route of either injections or surgery to go that route without trying all other techniques first.When I started watching the presenter is sitting in a chair against blank wall and since there was no information on the background of those involved in the Sciatica Institute will say I had my doubts.  But the more I listened and looked at the workbook and based on research I have done through University of Maryland, Mayo etc. the advice seems both consistent and sound.  As do the exercises.  Since my pain had eased considerably before doing the exercises I cannot tell how they would have felt were I in the thros of a major back issue but for now they seem sensible.I will return and add to this review once I have been doing the exercises on regular basis.  If before then I run into any particular problems will return sooner.  All of us who suffer from these problems are looking for solutions and while I hesitate to do a review before using product for some time thought it might be useful to give my first impressions especially for those who might be considering but, as I was, are uneasy not knowing the credentials behind the product.

A few years back I ordered a bath mat which sheds terribly.  Great mat otherwise.  But the strands that stick to feet getting into the shower have over time clogged the cover to the drain.  Had to unscrew this to clean periodically.  This item solves my problem as it just fits over the existing drain cover and has silicone rim that keeps it from slipping.  No more problems!  Alas I do not have much hair left to cause that problem but for someone where hair affecting their shower drain this would be terrific item.  Sure beats having a plumber out to snake the drain!  Or water build up in the shower from slow drain.

Bought two of these for birthday gifts for my adult children who are golfers.  Think they will get a lot out of it.  Tested it on arrival as birthdays a few weeks off.  Now not sure they will get both of them!  As with most electronic gadgets this has a few things to learn and while they do not have a toll free (or paid ) phone to talk to them they are very very prompt and responsive to e mails.  Turned out had a problem with one as the strap was loose on the back and they are replacing.  Their user guide on line is ok and their support very helpful.  Asked lot of questions and in the end feel very comfortable now with the device.  One thing I am going to suggest to my children is that they dedicate a golf glove to this device so they do not have to keep putting on and taking off the device on the glove.  Also suggested to company things to add to their user guide to help people get best use of device.  Took me a while for example to find how I could compare my swing to other swings and a pro.  Turns out you go to history then bring up a past swing and then at bottom are three dots which you touch to get the drop down to get to these items.  User guide not clear on that.  Likewise setting up multiple accounts, something I am sure a golf pro will want but also families with more than one golfer, says to touch the arrow but found touching the name brings up that screen. Also the device is only a transmitter and does not save any information, that is saved on the I Phone or I Pad application.  Little things but annoying until you find out how best to work with this.  But once you do it works great.  Have only tried it out in the back yard so far but itching to get to the range and give it a real work out.  Well may be one of those kids will not get this one after all!

Bought this as I have a sciatic nerve issue I am dealing with and when I walk any distance get pain from spine down my right leg.  Painful enough I need to sit down if shopping or walking my dog.  I am just under 6 feel and 195 lbs and this works just great for me.  As with any three legged stool have to be careful not to tip over and the seat is somewhat small but works just fine.  You sit facing the handle.  It is not light, however, at 3 lbs but I would trade the weight for its solid steel construction.  Only thing I wish it had was a strap so I could carry it on my shoulder.  Will try to find one that will work with it.  I don't need it as a cane but do need it handy to quickly set up and sit for a minute or two after which I am good to go.  Know this will be handy for all kinds of uses in the future and for now with medical issue it fits the bill!

Live in area where we get ice frequently in winter.  In last several years have gone down three times while walking my dog.  Fortunately did not break anything but only by luck I did not.  Never good to fall!  These cleats are strong and best I have seen.  Size matters as they say they fit 5-10 US size shoe.  I wear 9.5 and have a boot I use in winter.  It fit but was was struggle to get on.  No instructions with them but they are marked (somewhat faintly) with "front".  Took a bit to figure out how to get them on and hoping that with use they will stretch.  Probably could have used something like a crowbar to get them on if needed to.  Anyone older with bit of arthritis might find this even more a struggle.  But worth having something that will prevent falls on ice.  Have not actually used these on ice yet but if do and find any issues will come back and add to this review.  Meanwhile happy to have these for next storm.Update on above review.  Thought I bought these too late in season to try them....but I was wrong!  Another ice storm so had chance to try them the last two days.  A couple of comments.  First these are not all that easy to install but once on the shoe they are great.  I decided to put them on an older pair of buckskin shoes from LL Bean and the rubber was so stiff that it curled the toes of the shoes.  So I put in a pair of shoe trees and that worked great.  My plan is to just leave them on these shoes with shoe trees in place and change from non cleated to cleated pair of shoes as needed. It would be a real pain to have to put on and take off the cleats.  I wondered how these would be when walked on dry area and did not notice any problem.  Of course would not want to do that much as could wear down the spikes.  Overall these were great cleats for icy conditions and felt confident on even black ice conditions. Give them very high marks.

This is not a book about Keynes the economist although it does discuss his work as an economist.  It is rather about his life as an investor.  There is much to be learned from his history as an investor, both what worked for him and the lessons he learned from mistakes.  As we face another difficult period in our economic history it is useful to see how he handled both the Great Depression and World War II.  As for Forward by John Bogle points out much of Keynes experience translates to the world today.  There are significant insights in this book that even after 50 years of successful investing myself I found worthwhile.  For example, the fact that using opposed risks (stocks, bonds, commodities, etc.) while working well in general fails miserably in conditions like 1929 or 2008.  What does seem to work well is focus on high quality dividend stocks with a mix of bonds for periods when stocks nosedive.  And buying and holding during bad times as well as good.  Something I have tried to instill in my adult children as they save and invest.  While much of this book covers things as investors we already know it never hurts to repeat good advice!  This is a short book and a quick read but a nice addition to my investing library and hopefully yours.

I belong to a sailing club and wanted a tent for overnight use with my dog (who is not a great sleeper on boats).  We have full kitchen and restroom facilities so just need place to sleep for night.  Wanted an inexpensive tent and this seems to fit the bill.  Comes in nice carrying case and while I have not set up or used yet seems to be what I wanted.  Instructions are obviously written by someone in China as they are nearly incomprehensible with lots of misuse of words.  But this is pretty simple item that really should not need instructions.  If I find that this tent does not work well in actual use will come back and revise this review.

Was not sure about this as wanted to use as glove liner.  Also only in large size but turned out to fit just fine.  I usually wear a medium men's glove.  Early this season I bought a pair of Smith work thermal underwear in poly and found them thin, lightweight and much more comfortable than the cotton I used to wear.  Use them when sailing in winter and those have worked great.  But found that while I have good gloves that my hand get cold when walking my dog at temperatures under 20 so wanted glove liner that was think and light. These do the trick.  Fit inside my leather gloves nicely and give me that extra warmth.  Would not have thought that poly would work well as thermal layer but seems to work extremely well.  Have friend who grew up on NE farm and tells me he always wears double layers of gloves like he did as a kid and it helps with the cold.  So if you have need for this can recommend you give these a try.  Could not find these locally so glad could find them on Amazon.

Goes well beyond children's coloring book.  Picked this up as Christmas present for my granddaughter but decided she is too young for it even with her Mom's help.  Decided to put it back for a few years and let her try it when she is maybe 8 or 9 when her finger dexterity is good enough to let her color this and have as a nice colored book when she is finished.  Should make for hours of fun for her and her parents working with her.

This is a subject that not many know about and on which there is not a lot of literature.  Dr. Tsappa makes a significant contribution in her elucidation of the concept of hidden meanings in early Christian iconography, in particular Greek Orthodox iconography.  For those interested in this period of history and not versed in Greek Orthodox traditions or in the concept of blessings and iconography I recommend this book.
