These herb scissors are cool.  I have been wanting a pair of them for a long time.  They make quick work of chopping herbs and other greens.  I'm used to chopping with a knife and sometimes the particular herb you are trying to cut has such a high moisture content that the knife kind of squash it and makes a wet mush.  And maybe I'm not ready for all the herby goodness to be extracted yet.  These scissors seems to solve that problem, by applying blades from both sides it makes a cleaner cut on delicate herbs and greens.  I say greens because it also does a good job making chopped spinach, kale, turnips, collards, cabbage for coleslaw, shredded lettuce, etc. The scissors come with a cleaning comb.  I also appreciated the bonus mini scissors with guard that was included. Perfect for loose strings and sewing kit.  I purchased my scissors at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I love to read true crime stories and this short book is no exception.  It is well written and fast paced.  It give a short basic overview explaining some of the signs characteristics of how a serial killer is defined.  Then it jumps into six separate short stories of six different serial killers.  The writer does a good job of keeping the reader entertained and drawn into the story moving along at a good pace.  I look forward to more.  I received this book at no cost in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is not an in depth book with amazing detailed stories of survivors.  It's more like an overview you would read on wikipedia or a student's essay or book report.  It's fine if you know nothing about Auschwitz and the terrible crimes committed there during one of the darkest times during human history.  It will make you want to read and research more to learn about the history.  It has a few anecdotes that are interesting but the author is detached and seems to just be reciting and stating facts or information he appears to have read himself elsewhere.  It just seems to skim the surface without ever delving deeper into the human emotion and experiences of the time.  The grammar is basic and a lot of times redundant as if the author is just look for phrases to fill space and increase word count.  It seems disrespectful to write a "book" on such a subject as devastating as the holocaust just for the sake of writing a book to capitalize off such a tragedy and making profit.  The subject and people that died, the survivors, and their families deserve more attention and emotion than that.  I received this book at no cost in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I got Tender Sprouts organic zinc oxide sunscreen not just for the kids but for the adults also.  I prefer to use organic and chemical free products and this sunscreen is just that.  It only has six ingredients, zinc oxide 25% (non-nano), eldorado springs artesian spring water, certified organic extra virgin olive oil, cerified organic beeswax, vegetable vitamin e (non-gmo from sunflower),and cholecalciferol (vitamin d3).  It has a thick creamy consistency that is white in color.  Apparently, and I just learned this myself, you should not rub zinc oxide sunscreen into the skin to the point that the "white" is gone because then you have rubbed off all the protection.  It's supposed to still look somewhat white.  This sunscreen has an spf of 35 and it has some pretty good staying power on the skin, however as with any sunscreen it should be reapplied after swimming, excess sweating, after any excessive rubbing, and at least every two hours.  We really like this sunscreen and how well it protects and especially how safe it is for us.  I purchased this sunscreen at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

I really like this pilates mini exercise ball. I like the material it is made of, a durable and strong pvc material that has a soft grippy texture.  The grippy texture helps you have control of the ball.  It's easy to control with contact with body contact because it's not slippery.  Because it's not stable it forces you to use your core muscles to stay steady in turn strengthening your muscles and improving your balance.  It does take some finesse to blow up using a straw and plug.  I placed the plug tip right at the edge of the hole and did a quick fluid transfer of straw to plug.  It took a few tries to get my technique down but I finally got it plugged at the inflation level I wanted.  The reason for the plug instead of a valve is it can handle the pressure and weight put on it through exercise and our bodies.  I use different size and type balls in exercise and in past and ongoing physical therapy for my knee and other prior injuries.  I purchased my mini exercise ball at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I love this yoga mat by Simply Color.  It's made out of one hundred percent organic cotton and has a very zen earthy feel and look to it.  It is very roomy at twenty five inches long and six inches in diameter.  It is roomy enough to accommodate a variety of sizes of yoga, pilates, or fitness mats.  And there is enough room left over to fit a towel and or change of clothes.  There is a inner pocket large enough for my phone and keys with room to spare.  It's very well constructed out of quality materials and should last a long time.  It feels very durable.  I like the solid black color with the complimentary blue and white leaf print on the ends.  It's a very attractive bag and has a designer look making it appear more expensive than it is.  The strap is wide and comfortable to sling across your shoulder or cross body.  I purchased my yoga mat bat at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This is a good value for reusable bento style meal prep containers.  Each container has three compartments, two 8 ounce and one sixteen ounce size compartments.  This is great for portion control if you are dieting or just trying to eat healthy. The lid fits on the bottom in a way that totally separates each compartment from each other so your food doesn't cross mix or contaminate.  The plastic is BPA free and is safe for the microwave, dishwasher, and freezer.  The only thing I would be careful about putting in it and carrying would be heavy, soup, or foods without at lot of liquid because it has some bend to it and doesn't seal tight enough to keep it from leaking if it gets tipped in transfer or travel.  Other than that it's great for the cost and purpose intended.  And you get seven of them, enough for lunch for a week.And they stack taking up little shelf space. I purchased my set at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

This vitamin requires taking two a day to get the suggested daily dosage so it will last about six weeks. The plump square is easy to chew and has a orangish flavor. I could do without the sugar crystal coating. Off red in color. No stomach upset and provides a broad spectrum of vitamins for a woman without worry you will get to much.

We already own a plastic child rock tumbler and this is a nice upgrade for the rock hound in the family. The body is metal with digital controls. You have a power button, day setter and speed. Up to five days and three speeds. Comes with starter rock set and grits. Motor itself is quiet and thanks to the thick rubber barrel the sound of the rocks tumbling is muffled. Instruction guide and jewelry kit for fun and a small strainer. Comes with one extra belt, looks like an O ring, probably be able to find this size in a hardware store. If you end up liking it you will need to purchase more grit and gather or buy more rocks after the initial load. We love it.

I can wear these for hours at a time have even worn them over night. I tried the medium size and I wear a medium glove. They are snug without cutting off circulation, seam leaves indention around wrist and fingers but not uncomfortable. I like the grippy dots and the fingerless tips so I can do normal daily things while wearing them. The seam around the thumb pad is nice, thumb pouch is sewn in separate, feels good not sneezed like a tube. I like how they keep my hands warmer than normal yet they breath. I wear gloves like this under my outdoor gloves during winter. These will get a lot of use. Packing says 100% copper infused material, I saw another brand that said 88% at a local store. I can not say if the copper is doing anything but we have used copper socks in the past that help with foot odor so at least these shouldn't get stinky between washes. The best part I think is they keep my hands warmer than bare skin so my joints don't get chilled and ache. I like them.

Although they seem small at first compared to my usual brand, they are standard 2 1/2" cups.They slip fully in a standard muffin tin. Your getting the best of both worlds here with the non stick aluminum to peel back from your muffins and cupcakes yet get a pretty color pattern on the outside for show. This set came with three different patterns. No need to spray your pans and clean up is a breeze unless you spilled some batter on the tin itself. These are good looking for the holidays or other social events like birthdays and parties.

I picked these pans up mainly for the fact they have lids. Bonus that they require no spray since they are now non stick. Perfect to make cake in. I like to wash them out a few times and reuse. Good for taking to a party because you don't need to ask for your dish back. I also like that they are recyclable. Nice sturdy walls, the bottom is a bit flexible. I plan to use one for turkey in a few weeks, but will put a cookie sheet under it. The outside is blue, looks a bit better than plain old aluminum, not sure if they come in multiple colors.

Thick heavy duty paper that is 15" wide by how ever long you need it. Perfect for baking as you do not need to oil and flour your pans. They come out clean. Cakes are easy to frost without crumbles, cookies slide off, I roll pie dough between two sheets and roll up for later baking. Oven safe to 420 degree.

This are 100% cotton and I prefer these long towels for the kitchen. They have a hang loop on the back of one corner so you can hang on a hook or a cabinet knob. I like to have them near my work area for quick hand wiping while cooking and baking. The make good drapes while canning to keep drafts off your goods while they cool. I have other towels like this that have their pattern on both sides, this brand is only on one side similar to a table cloth. I have it in the white/gray and the pattern is not to busy in that shade.

100% cotton with raised loops for cleaning and liquid absorption. I really would just prefer them in white. The colors are bold like kids crayons. I worry about them getting mixed in with the wrong laundry load and coloring everything. Basic low cost kitchen towel, I would prefer in white.

If I had seen these in the store I probably would not of gotten them. They seem thin at first but after washing they do fluff up. If you hold them up to the light you can see through the lines around the window panes. After washing the windows bump up and act as a soft scrubber.They absorb well, made from 100% cotton. Recommended cold wash with gentle cycle which gives me doubts on how long they will last since using them for cleaning in the kitchen will require bleaching and at least warm water wash. A low cost cute hand towel.

This is oil based and gives the skin an instant protective layer and adds soft silky feeling. It smells like mineral oil to me. Comes in a yellowish clear bottle that says keep out of direct sunlight. They might want to sell it in a brown bottle if they want to protect it from light. It has a push top dropper, you only need a small amount. After using it a few weeks I can say I have had no skin break outs or irrational from it. Will continue using through the dry winter months, might be to oily in warmer weather. I use other face products and haven't noticed any changes besides the soft skin. I do like that it keeps the skin from getting dry and itchy.

I like that this model will hold a full bowl of water as well as a large 100oz reservoir. The tank comes off easily for cleaning and filling and had a no spill cap that is spring loaded. The tank is easy to see through to know if your pet will need fresh water fill. You have the option of turning the fountain feature off, which allows quiet water circulation and less splash drops outside the dish. The dish is large enough for a good sized dog to drink from if needed. The cord can be disconnected from outlet transformer making it easier to take to the sink for cleaning between fills. Has a small filter compartment. You can save money by buying fish filter in bulk and cutting your own. I am still looking to get a model with a stainless steel bowl but this one is doing a good job.

I own the Vornado model TVH500, it has all metal body and digital controls. This model VH100 has manual controls  as well as manual tip over shut off on the base along with a nice Cord wrap under there also. I can smell the plastic of the body but hopefully that fades I do prefer the metal body of the TVH500, but of course that cost more to manufacture, raising the price.You still get good even heating out of the VH100. I do you like the manual controls they last longer than electric control panels most of the time. Put the same heater with cord wrap, manual controls, and quiet fan in the metal body of the THB 500 and I would love it. Both have cool to the touch bodies, good if you have pets or children. The nice thing about Vornado heaters is that they have quiet fans that push out heat evenly. No hotspots burning you if you are to close to them, they are quiet and warm.

Very easy liquid to take, more like a water than a syrup. Barely any taste to it, not good or bad. Does seem to help with mild sore throat issues with itchy feeling. Also helps clear the nose for easy breathing. Can't say yet on the claims for cough or sneezing. Like the mild formula and made in U.S.A.

I have been using these are cleaning. They are X-large and breath enough my hands don't get sweaty. They are powder free so your hands come out of them clean. No tears, no leaks, easy to grip stuff while wearing, can pick a tooth pick up off the floor. I like them.

Really like these bags for freezing, I bag my ice to keep it clean and not to absorb odors from the freezer, also holds fresh produce like lettuce in fridge, they are spacious. The plastic used is thicker than a standard sandwich bag. Even though the bottom is not flat it is a continue piece of plastic, seamed at sides. The click is after you come to the edge of your zip and pull it just past closed. You can turn the bag upside down with no leaking.  I like them.

These are just like dish washing or laundry pods. They dissolve in water. Nice that they are pre measured be cone in a resealable tub. To use in laundry you throw it directly in with the clothes, best after 5 minutes of washing. I only tried this with towels, I can't see me using these for laundry with any color in it. I am use to putting a small amount in the soap compartment when needed so it pre diluted before it hits my clothes. Nice for sanitizing empty washer though. I can see using these for travel and for people that still go to the laundry mat, no liquids to spill. One pack to one gallon water for mopping and cleaning. I will probably continue using liquid bleach, but these do have their uses.

We are using these breath drops on a 17 year old lapdog with bad teeth. He needs them removed but vet said might be dangerous putting him under with his issues. We had to start out at just one drop at first because he would sniff the water and walk away. He had since either gotten use to it or doesn't care anymore, and we can do the three drops per bottle of water. Even though it can't fix his issue, it has made a difference with his mouth odor. When he pants you can get a whiff of the minty cover. Didn't cause any digestive issues. If you have a dog with mild mouth issues this would probably work wonders, even with our issue with old dog it helps.

This is the small compact cat tree, yet is is pretty heavy and has a stable base. Having just built my own I was curious what a mass market tree would be made of. It comes in a box and you assemble at home. Just go over the one page instruction sheet, it's very easy and only takes minutes with the included Allen wrench. There is no off gas odors on the materials and the bolts are better than most, like lag bolts. I was expecting carpeted areas but they are more like a stuffed animal fabric, soft like a teddy bear. The rope smells like sisal rope, I do wish it was the beefier kind, just a bit thicker but it is ok. I used 1/2 inch on my home made one. I also wish it ran the full length of the legs, and that the base legs were taller. The hiding home is perfect, I wish the top tunnel was larger, not a lot a room to lay in it for napping without something hanging over. I do like the solid build, how easy it was to put together, just as easy to take apart if you need to move it or store it. I like that it doesn't stink of chemicals. The carpet I bought at hardware store for my home made one stunk for weeks. I would use this company again, I would also get it taller as I have the room and my cat loves to climb. The surface area is basically for napping not play on this model.

No odor hand lotion that is nice and thick, no dripping. Goes on with a slick feeling. Stays on skin for 5-10 minutes before absorbing. I find myself reapplying often but I have been using during the day even though it is listed for over night use. I like that is doesn't smell and protects the skin, yet I can't say it works better than other thick hand lotions I use but it is better than watery scented lotions that get absorbed into the hands and disappear. Would use again.

This cat food is made into tiny pebbles size food. Cat prefers small crunchy pebbles or flat pebbles, tends to avoid semi moist or large pebble. I like the ingredients are healthier than a lot of cat foods. Not his favorite choice yet when given choice from different brands but is willing to eat it. Large bag, hope they come up with a zip close bag. Would get again do to ingredients.

Excellent food handling gloves . I used these while cutting up this years hot pepper supply from garden for freezing and canning. Fits well and no powder inside gloves. Did not have them needing adjustment or slipping off. Kept the hot peppers juice off my hands. Last time I had pepper juice under my nails and no amount of washing could get it off, like it sunk into the nails. Can see using these for handling meat or pie crusts this holiday season. Happy with product.

Used these gloves for cleaning with bleach. Hands stayed dry inside the glove, no breaks in glove or leaking. Wore them for hours of scrubbing. Hands themselves are very dry after, needed extra lotion.
We just don't seem to have any luck with the natural teething products. No notice improvement with this gel. Have to stick with the numbing kind.

This is a compact heater that looks like a car battery in shape with a handle in top. No frills heating. Two knobs for control, one for your settings off, fan, low, and high. The other is temperature setting. Turn this up till your warm enough, then turn down till it stops, at this point heater will kick on when temperature drops below this setting. Needs 3 feet of clearance all around for safety. Not for outdoors or wet environments like the bathroom. Fan noise is noticeable, you will know when it's running and depending on room noise you will hear it kick on and off. Does have safety button in bottom that if it gets knocked over will make it stop running. It does come with a small filter (electrostatic) for the back, it is thin cheap and won't hold shape on its own. Directions don't say if the four screws under the rim where it goes are meant to be pushed through it for hold. They should have given it a frame and a drop in metal surround.This type of filter is good at trapping dust, cleaning your air. You need to remember to clean it or replace it when it looks dirty, same mainlanders as your furnace/ac unit filters. Nice thick grounded power cord. Body of heater stays cool to touch till nearing front of unit. I saw this heater listed under fifteen bucks by a third party seller. Nice compact heater that warms quickly.Even with noisy fan and cheap filter it works well and puts out quick heat.

I like Viva supplements, I have used their products before. This vitamin D3 is perfect one a day 5000IU in a tiny easy to swallow softgel filled with extra virgin olive oil carrier. Would get again.Bottle is double sealed for safety.

Snap seal top, easy dispense like pulling tissues from a tissue box, one at a time. Soft white material that has little to no scent. Material has raised square bumps like a quilt, good cleaning. I could find nothing on the ingredient list above a four on the hazard list of a web site I use to check products I buy. Even a four is fair. Using as diaper wipes not face. Skin dries quickly with a tacky feel at first but then dry skin.

Fast dissolving tablet you place under the tongue, dissolves almost instant with no noticeable flavor. Unfortunate for us, no noticeable change in teething discomfort. Just can not tell if it makes a difference.

It's like a fast moving Brillo pad for your tongue. The spray tastes much like scope. It does do a good job of cleaning the tongue and leaves a very minty scent behind. I wish they had not chosen to dye it blue. I drink coffee and usually just use baking soda to clean my tongue and follow with a mouth wash. It's a bit rough, but I might get use to it, as it does a good job.

Very easy liquid to take, more like a water than a syrup. Barely any taste to it, not good or bad. Does seem to help with mild sore throat issues with itchy feeling. Also helps clear the nose for easy breathing. Can't say yet on the claims for cough or sneezing. Like the mild formula and made in U.S.A.

Great read just before Halloween. Liked how the book included some known history. The cast is large yet you get background on them all. Lots of intrigue, yet almost became if you seen one seance you have seen them all. The ghosts can only do a few things over and over so it gets old quick. I was hoping for more explanation on the uncovering fraud aspect. How the people did their tricks, either way was a fun read, I felt I learned all I need to know about the best days of spiritualism. I liked the author writing style and would read from him again.Nice touch when I turned off my light after reading in bed the cover glows.

This is very similarities to the Aerogarden 3SL which I own with the CFL(compact fluorescent light) bulb instead of the LED lighting. I have the 3SL in white which reflects light well and this in black which inhibits algae growth. The new Sprout LED does not heat up as much and uses less energy. the LED has a blue tone to its lighting and the CFL is more yellow. Hopefully you can see it in my photograph. Other changes is they improved the bubbler with more air holes and a different water/nutrient lid. They sound like a fish tank running. Set up only takes a few minutes, plants begin growing in a few days. I like the fact they are compact and I can move them around the house, they are currently in their third area of the house as I try to find them a ideal spot that I can add to and put up reflective material for the spilled lighting. I like the fact they require little care. I used a Rapitest light meter and found both to be about a 5 on the 1-10 scale. Almost a 6 right next to LED, so when the plant grow it will get more lighting. Stays on 16 hours a day but you can set when it starts up. Comes with starter pods and plant food with measuring cup. I really like these and am thinking of getting a larger one for vegetables. This kit comes with herbs dill, parsley and basil.One last comment on the lighting, while it takes along time for LEDs to burn out, they are typically not replaceable, CFL lights are a removable and replaceable lighting source .

This is a review of the Toshiba Satellite L55t-C5388, there are other models with different specs with similar numbers and some times the reviews get bunched together under different laptops yet same brand. We have tablets, desktops, smartphones, and two other older laptops in our house. First thing I noticed is slower start up as tablets are instant and our other laptop has a SSD drive in it. Not super long but there is a waiting period. Comes preloaded with quite a bit of software and apps, you need to sign in and sign up to use most of them, and pay for a lot of them separately. I chose to uninstall many. Be aware if you accept the standard sign ins you are allowing them to track your internet browsing and other data. I miss the days of free roaming the Internet without being tracked to be marketed to. To use Cortana, you must let Microsoft collect and use info about your location, history, contacts and etc. Be sure to update the windows and chose your security program.The display is ok to me, I have other budget screens in the house that are comparable. The screen tends to look slightly washed out and words have fuzzy edges. There is a control in advanced settings for clear type text, you can set it for your individual eyes.It does have a standard CD/DVD drive, a web camera built in, 2 USB 3 ports, HDMI, as well as a card reader. Head phone jack, Ethernet port, standard USB and power port.Keyboard is flat spaced chiclet keys set in a plastic base, large wrist rests with responsive trackpad, as well as dedicated number keys.We have a couple computers that run Windows 8, never liked it much, while Windows 10 still has some annoying features it seems to be easier to work around and they gave back normal desktop start up screen.The graphics are Intel HD graphics 520, played War of Thunder without graphic issues at the highest setting allowed.This is my first touch screen laptop, I do like this feature, while using the laptop in kitchen and needing to scroll down a recipe I was able to stick out my pinkie finger and scroll.The battery doesn't have a quick release, but it is replaceable by removing two small screws.Base comes off with removing ten screws. Has 2 Kingston 4GB Ram cards. The body on this is thin plastic, care will have to be used handling this laptop.The speakers are spread across the front of keyboard. While voice clarity is great, bass is barely there, and I am not one to want a lot of base.It's fan is basically quiet, stays pretty cool to touch. Good value based general use laptop.Lots of storage space and pretty good ram with wide touch screen.Middle of the road graphics and sound, fine for average web surfing, email, and casual gaming or movies.Wish is had the NVIDIA GeForce GTX 950M graphics card the Toshiba Satellite S55-C5364 comes with. I would like the aluminum body and back lit keys and SSD drive. But of course that is a higher price point.Will include picture of insides for those that may want to upgrade components.

It's your standard recyclable number 6 plastic hefty cup. Nice to be able to get your favorite team on them. We have been able to reuse them, cleaning them in the dishwasher with dry cycle off. I would say they have been through the dishwasher 6 to 9 times before I noticed some of the team logo detail deteriorating. Good for party or picnic.

Just what you expect out of a Ace bandage wrap. Good quality with stretch and if you ever owned one you know they last a long time. I like the black color, more sporty looking than pale beige that has been used for years. Black shows less soiling. This has a new clip on the end instead of the small metal clips with teeth. I finally figured out how to use it. At first I wished it just came with metal clips as back ups. But it does have all day hold. We used it for a twisted knee, supportive and the Velcro end held on for all day wear. I do have concern over the longevity of the wrap with the reapplying of Velcro over and over. I has wrist guards with Velcro and that action pills up the material requiring replacement. Only time will tell on this new clip device. It holds and blends in without getting caught on chairs or clothing. I like it, the bandage wrap itself is good, I may still look to get some old fashion metal clips for back up.

Stakes are basically smooth sided, no splitters while handling. My box came with one split stake, it still was easy to pound into the ground with a hammer. They are only about three feet tall and after hammering 12" into ground they will be tall enough for a yard sign, decorations for the holidays or in my case plant markings for where I moved my Hostas as these plants die back during winter and I don't want to forget where I put them after transplanting.

This tea comes in a box with all the bags together so once you open you will need to put them in  your own tea tin or ziploc to keep them from absorbing moisture from the air in your kitchen.Large bag allows tea to move freely when hot water is poured over it. Brews up into a very mild tea. I think it tastes much like Stash organic breakfast blend. Wish the bags were individually wrapped for freshness.

I have pale skin and this shade set number 10 translucent is natural looking light coverage. I currently wear it over my sun block to absorb the shine that sunblock has as a physical barrier against UV.  This is a nice matte that blends in well with only a few swipes. It does not come with an applicator but you can use clean fingers. I use a flat sponge. It is not full coverage, I can still see my skin spots and freckles but it does even out skin tone. Looks pretty natural which is the look I  want. Controls shine, I like it.

I use regular Reynolds wrap, and heavy duty Reynolds wrap in the long rolls. These new packets are made from thick aluminum , sides are pre sealed for you, load it up like a sack if you want, I did a stew. Fold the open end over to seal. They are very convenient yet you only get 4 in a box, I can get a full roll at that price. I do like them but will probably continue to make my own pouches.New tip listed on package. Put one tablespoon flour in bag to protect against bursting. I always just poke a fork in the top for steam release my old way, might be needed with these factory sealed on three edges.

Nice flip top can, no can opener needed. Food slips right out, no waste no scraping the can.The salmon and tuna cans smell as expected, they smell like fresh fish. We try not to feed to much fish to the cats because it's been linked to thyroid problems. Nice treat food. One cat would not touch the turkey can, turned and tried to cover it like in litter box. We have used this brand for dogs and cats, their dry foods are favored. I probably would not get this variety pack again just because of the two fish flavors and we don't use fish based foods that much and the fact that one cat doesn't want to touch the turkey.

This is the second product I have tried from this company. This one tastes the way dried bananas smell. Easy mixing, turns out smooth even in just plain water. Nice packets no guessing on how much to mix. We like it.

Silicone topped oven mitts work well pulling hot food out of oven. The sizing of these unfortunately are made with people with tiny thumbs. I wear a medium sized female glove and these thumb are super tight. If you have big hands or a man you might want to try in store first.

It does allow you to see a tiny part of something close up, about the size of four numbers on a penny fit in scene. It is a clear picture with no fringing, just small. The booklet is full color and informative. The magnifier is plastic and difficult to fit over phone. Not helpful trying to look at rock collections. Unfortunately it will get limited use here.

This kit comes with needed assembly tools. The instructions are colored drawings with little to no written instructions till it is built and you move on to connecting and play stage. Nice that pictures for which screws to use are pictures with 1:1 ratio, simply lay the screws down on top of drawing for size. When attaching your plates they do have a front and a back, look closely at drawings for placement. Same with the screws, you use so many S3 that you might over look when it changes to S2 and a regular nut turns into a nylon nut. Took us days to build and we made a few mistakes and had to fix, put things on backward or upside down. I say this in a good way, it teaches problem solving and patience. The build alone is days worth of work, exciting to see it come together. The robot is sturdy on its feet when done, although we did manage to get it rocking trying to turn and it started to fall over. That was a a thick wool rug.We found set up pretty straight forward but you need to keep the book handy to do the command prompts. The pre recorded Voice commands are neat at first but then you really want to move on to making it do what you want. We tied a string to its hand to play with the cat. The hands themselves are just hanging there, they have no options for control. I would like to take away the head movements and add even one hand control. Maybe in the future. The arms move in surprisingly fast wide motions. The app is fast set up, no sign in. Controlling through the app is much easier and fun. Scan, touch the Meccanoid name at top of screen then again connect in the scan area. Shows battery power left. Not all smart phones will fit in pocket on front of robot, phone does not have to be on robot, I even used an iPad. It's fun playing around with it, enjoyed building it. Would like to try a different build. Parts are solid, should last with care. Looked at the Meccanoid G15 that currently sits under two hundred bucks with less of a height issue. Also hope in future model for charge cable to plug in like cell phone, the current one is hard to get in and out for charging. I fear kids tugging it out.

This is a good variety of Mountain House foods. We use these for camping and back packing yet they have such a long shelf life they are also good for emergency food supplies as long as you have potable water to mix them with. This box contains packages for more than one serving at a time although they do sell individual meals. This means if your a single person you will probably waste such large packs like the chicken and rice, that is three servings. They do have high sodium content so they are not an everyday food but when your hiking and losing salts throughout the day it's ok. They do taste good, most tend to look good to the eye as well. I prefer the chicken meals over the beef. Chicken teriyaki is one of my favorites. If you bring along some flat bread like pita or flour taco shells they really go along way. Also recommend small packets of salsa. The eggs taste like eggs, give them a little longer to sit so they can draw up as much moisture as possible. While I don't use salsa on eggs normally, on the trail it makes them taste amazing. This Mountain House brand does a good job on flavor and the foods look appetizing to the eye. Current box shipping with use by date of 2027, sealed long storage life.

We have and still use an old Philips Norelco epilator, it also came with a removable shaver head, single line of blades. This new Panasonic is a huge improvement. You can use it wet or dry. The head pivots, allowing better coverage over curves and dips. The two heads of tweezers cut down the amount of time you are in pain. If you have ever used one of these you know it can hurt like mad yet it's worth it to have smooth skin for weeks, I use for under the arm and you have no red from pokey hairs irritating your skin and no under arm five o'clock shadow. This Panasonic ES-ED50 pulls most of the hair in just a couple passes, so much quicker for me than the Norelco, less passes less damage. I use those little blue bottles of oil that come in wax strip boxes. Instant relief, if you don't have that place a cold wash cloth under your arm for a few minutes. I used this for a mans back also, done quickly and LED light really does highlight the remaining hairs. The razor is ok, not smooth but enough to be able to wear shorts. The clear bikini trimmer cap is a nice touch, shaver has the pop up trimmer. Also has a brush and cover. Head pops off after pushing a button at the back. Power switch is on the front, two speeds. Little white bag to keep it all together. Easy to pop off gold colored cap to rinse out hair. My only complaint is the fact the gave it a pretty long power cord considering it won't work plugged in. It's just for charging. My old one works plugged it, so as this gets older and battery life diminishes it might not be ready to use when you need it. Currently has 30 minute use, plenty of time for now as it works faster than my old one.

Here is what we like about the Recon 50p, blue gaming head set. It can be used across multiple gaming systems. Mic can be removed, end is just like a headphone jack. Mute and volume located chest level, it's a small box, barely any weight or in the way at all. It's over the ears and does a excellent job blocking room noise. Headset is light weight.Here so far what we don't like, the head band is super tight, feels like it was made for a child's head, hopefully this loosens up with time. The cable is short, (3feet) when using this with a PC set on the floor there is no room for moving around.  Chat volume and game is not separate controls.Over all not bad for a low cost headset. They will get used. Yet I have to say after a few days use we are right back to our old Turtle beach P11s, we have three of those in this house, they are comfortable, super long cable (about 12 feet) to move around and comfortable after hours of use and can still be bought new at a comparable price.

Easy to prepare, 2 tablespoons of mix, 4 tablespoons of liquid, even plain water works fine. Stir it a short time. Mixes very well. Readily eaten and for reviewing proposes tried by adult. It has a nice apple flavor to it but not overly sweet. Small bag seals back up for storage like a ziploc. Made in U.S.A. Would get this again.

Powder in a vegetarian capsule, almost an inch long yet skinny. No stomach upset for me, I take with food. I tried a pill with MSM in it before that caused me issues, not with these. I have used this company before, so far I like them. Note Glucosamine in this formula comes from shrimp, if you have a seafood allergy you might want to consult your doctor first. I like them.

Suave Firm Control gel is easy to dispense from squeeze bottle, cap at bottom allows product to  be ready to use, even near the end of product use. The gel is clear, no added colors. It has very little to no odor, another plus for me. It is not sticky, you rub it between your hands before applying, it washes from hands without needing soap.  Dries in hair quickly, controls my frizzy prone wavy/curly hair in a held together yet still able to move naturally way. I can run my hands in hair without getting caught up in product. This is a good product for me, as I like natural looking hair. I didn't really get a shine bump from it, I wouldn't really call it a strong holding gel either. It is listed as number 4 in firm control. You can add more product after your hair dries. I didn't get any product flaking. I like it.

Serum has the look and feel of yogurt. Very unique odor to it. Dries to a tacky feel with shine. Keeps skin moist, good to put on under foundation. I will say it helps keep skin moisturized yet I don't see any lift, bottle says it can take up to 8 weeks for results. Not sure if one bottle will last a full 8 weeks at 1.1fl oz. says to follow with firming day lotion or night cream, which I don't have. Wish it came in a glass bottle. Did not cause any skin out breaks.

I own four other Bose speakers, I really like their clarity. I love the small size of this radio with its booming sound. This is the first one I have had with the ability to pull in radio over the air. I like not having to grab a tablet or a phone to pull up an app to find quick tunes or news. It's a quick set up, plug in it, the straighter the power cord the better the FM reception as it doubles as the antenna. There is a place to attach a real antenna if this is not enough for your location. Set up the time, just push the + or - till you reach the current time. I do not like the placement of the time buttons on the remote, they look like volume buttons and they are right where your thumb rests. They would have been better to put that up by the power button or made them smaller. After that you can run through the search of FM stations and preset up to six channels just by holding down the button for a second, you hear a beep, it's done. Each station displays on the front of speaker under the time, lists song and artist. Change over to AM and set up six more. AM can be picked up better by the way your system faces. Alarm set is in bottom corner, you can set two alarms, each with its own button to the left of the alarm setup button. Buzzer is default but you can set up for music. You can adjust the alarm volume. The buzzer steadily gets louder, I like this as it doesn't have to jolt you out of sleep. Place on back for headphone jack, aux, and antenna as well as a Bose link port. You can adjust display brightness also. Besides the remote you can turn the system on and off by touching the top of the speaker, this feature can be disabled, say if you have a cat you don't want walking on the radio and blaring music while your sleeping or not at home. Does hold the time when power is cut. This sounds really full and clear, at first I thought it was having issues while testing how loud I could get it but it turned out that it was radio static. Sadly it does not have Bluetooth, all my other Bose have this feature, it's surprising in this age of music electronics and this price range. After looking online I see there is a Bluetooth adapter that works with older models, doesn't list if it would work with current machine. It lists at a hundred bucks currently, that seems like something that should be included in the box.

This is a revised addition, I love it when they update good books. The writing is clear and easy to follow. Nice color photographs through out. Get a good understanding of how electrical items work as well as electricity itself. A lot of this will seem over simplified to anyone who has done some electrical work yet it makes a good refresher and it's a fast read. I enjoyed the preparing your lab chapter 13 the most as I learned a few things I didn't know and added a few things to my wish list to make my projects easier to work. I like how the author reminds you about safety with examples without boring you, it's peppered throughout and good advice. Coverage of basic tool use and a few projects to get you going. As a hobbyist I enjoyed this book and find it a nice reference.

I really liked this book, the author was able to take me down memory lane and brought to life things I never experienced before but I felt connected to by his style of writing. I didn't know much about Tom Petty except that I liked some of his music in the past. I listened to his albums while reading this book and felt that by reading the book I found more meaning in the lyrics.I came away with respect and like a line towards the back of the book, "You just can't find a Petty song that is not worth singing."

I take a few different Jarrow formulas and so far have found them to be a good company.I take their 12 milligram Astaxanthin regularly. I take it for my eyes and skin protection, I started taking it last summer as I was getting more sun exposure than normal. Astaxanthin is in other supplements like krill oil, so if you take other supplements you might want the smaller dose, Jarrow has a 5 milligram also. I like it.

I just made scones earlier this week with the same brand gluten free flour. It bakes up light and textured. This muffin mix requires additions of egg, oil and milk. There are not blue berries in the mix like pictured on the bag, you add your own. I used gingered pears in mine. You can substitute to make it dairy free or vegan, they list how to do that on the bag also. One full bag makes 12 muffins. I was surprised at this because currently that is over six bucks per set of muffins. That would be a factor in my choice to make this again, but not factored into my rating. They cook up in 15-20 minutes, 20 for the added wet fruit. Easy to make as it is a ready mix. They bake up fluffy but you will have to add the flavor, even with my gingered pears I will need to add more if I do it again.

These smell much better than any of the Febreze scents. Nice real Apple scent. Standard 13 gallon bag with ties built in. Fits a standard 13g trash can. Work just fine but I do like the flex type bags better, I hope they offer this scent in those type also.

This is a fine powdered flour similar to many gluten free flours. It gives an airy texture to baked goods. Comes in resealable bag. Good replacement in scone recipes and pancakes. When cooking like this it usually requires having on hand things like xanthan gum yet once you have that in your cupboard, it just becomes natural to mix it up. If that seems to difficult to start out, they do make premixed flours for things like scones, pancakes, muffins, and cookies.I find this product similar to other gluten free flours, I like it.

Interestingly enough this book is so much more than just about chess pieces. I love this type of book where the author wraps many layers of human history around simple objects. By doing this it brings history to life for me to enjoy. I feel I learned much on Viking history and the mystery remains who really made the pieces but the author does a fine entertaining job of presenting her view.

Similar to other types of T.P. Including other Charmin yet larger condensed roll for less frequent changing. Unscented, very little dusting when pieces torn off, doesn't break through while wipingGood absorbency, says it is ok for Septic systems.

Same amount of T.P., Northern is soft regular sized roll. Tubeless, so no cardboard waste to recycle or throw out. I like the idea because it also means no manufacturing of the tube. If this can cut cost that they will pass on to consumer, fantastic. If you have T.P. Wasters in your home that take streams and streams off the roll, this will slow them down. It does not spin because the tube is gone. Frustrating for some but a money saver in the long run. Gets a little easier as the roll gets smaller. We have a standard in wall T.P. holder, if you have a slip on bar you may have different results. This product if fine for us.

You get a nice large bottle of 180 pills to take twice a day. These are large dry caplets, if you have trouble swallowing large pills these may be an issue. These have crab, lobster, crayfish, and shrimp so if you have seafood allergies this might be an issue. They do make other kinds. These don't have sugar, wheat or lactose among other things. I like taking glucosamine, I feel it helps with my wrists and old knee injury, but this is just a dietary supplement not a medicine. Do your home work and if you have other health issues and on medicines talk to your doctor. I can take these with no stomach upset. The size of the pill really is the only down side, as it needs taken daily, twice a day for effect. This is the highest recommended limit of 1500mg.

Lovely set of manicure tools, sharp clippers, tweezer blades come together evenly. Curved nail scissors with sharp even blades. Long doubled sided file. Double ended cuticle tool. The stand is smaller than what I pictured, which is a good thing to take up less space in cabinet. The rim is same material as tools, covering a small block of wood nicely stained with anti slip feet. This would make a nice gift as well. Note to the manufacture, although black packing looks very nice, I think it could use a shrink wrap for storage and shipping as mine came with scuffs. This would only matter for gifting purposes.

Scale looks good, sleek black glass with large foot area and clear large digital read out.Set up was easy, downloaded the free app from the Apple Store, put in some information, set up an account and email address, stepped on scale and done. App have other functions in it to use with other devices like a sleep tracker and activity monitor. Scale itself seems to be 2.5 lbs high compared to our regular scale and recent doctor visit measurement. That will be acceptable if it's consistent. Always you to set your goal weight and keeps track. So far so good.

I already own the 2011 version of this book, it's an informative book that is easy to follow and use. Some stuff seems so simple you wonder why they included it, but you have to remember everyone needing this book starts at a different level of knowledge. The new book covers much of the same material, although freshened up and rearranged or just tweaked. There is some new material in the current version and he has made an effort to include some things that were not there before as technology changes. Either book would be a good start for anyone but the new one is of course better because of the new additions. The glossary has grown also. Both have black and white photographs of internal parts. Many photos are the same in both books, there are diagrams also.

The basic ingredients in this potting soil is composted bark, sphagnum peat moss and pasteurized chicken litter. It's listed as organic, I wonder if that means it comes from organically fed chickens. Has a good clean soil scent, but still want to wear gloves handling it. I used it torepot plants to come back in from their summer growth in the greenhouse to there winter home inside. Feeds for two months. Perfect for fall as then feeding slows down for over winter. Nice and fluffy, easy to work with, I like it.

I liked how the author weaved real life issues people had with each set of advice she gives.Shows you what can go wrong and what you can do to stay on top of it. Really gives some eye opening advice. There are things I never would have thought about as I have never been really sick, it's frighting to think what people go through with a serious illness, like cancer. Or something simple but blown up by your doctor guessing or out to make money.I have already gained some helpful insight for helping a family member that has just been through spine surgery, complicated by a neck issue from said surgery. I am already changing the way I approach going for medical care.

I have been using Quilted Northern double roll 3 ply, this Charmin is double roll 2 ply. The northern is thicker on the tube but I think that's due to its loose rolling. the Charmin has a thicker feel to the actual paper with more texture for cleaning. Both appear to have the same tearing rate wet and dry. The Northern lists that it is septic safe but I can't find that on the Charmin. Unscented, very little dusting when pieces torn off, doesn't break through while wiping. If you like a soft touch I would go with the Northern, if you like a textured clean go with the Charmin. I live in the country on a septic tank, I would like to know if Charmin is considered septic safe.

These fit a 6' tall muscular thighed man comfortably. Not as much room as the carpenter pants but still nice. These are worn for a factory job and at 30" they just touch the top of his work boots. If we were to get again we would go with the longer 32" for his 6' height allowing a bit of a fold of fabric at his boots.

Nice thick denim, good straight stitching and metal zipper. Using these for a muscular thighed man for factory job. Lots of space in legs and rear. He can wear a 34 but prefers the room in a 36 for movement and comfort. He is 6' and these leave a nice fold of fabric over his work boots at the 32 length. Got a couple different sizes and styles to try. He liked these the best.

I am not sure about the tint, still pretty close to white although a shade darker than Olay regenerist luminous. I picked this LOreal skin illuminati because I was using the Olay at SPF 15 and the LOreal is 20 SPF. They have similar ingredient lists, in varying amounts. The LOreal seems to absorb better and less greasy. Has a perfume scent to it, I would like it better unscented for my sensitive face skin but it hasn't caused any irritation, I like it.
Great way to get natural calcium plant based supplement that is more easily absorbed into the body.  Would recommend this product.

About a year or so ago, I came across videos Jason Hanson had made and put together in a package deal regarding many of the same things he has written in his book.  Our family enjoys various self-defense training, and I was very impressed with these videos.  I shared them with members of my family.  They were impressed too.  They were short and fun to watch.  However, we enjoyed them so much we watched them all within a 3 day period of time, before going back over them individually to really learn and practice the techniques he shared to keep us from harms way.I've been subscribed to his newsletters, and enjoy the tidbits of information he offers with each one. Through these, I found out about his new book, Spy Secrets That Can Save Your Life.  Of course, I purchased this and read it within 3 hours.  (I'm a fast reader, but this was also a fast reading book.) I'm sure others could read it faster, but to glean the information from it that it was intended for, don't speed read.  I'm in the process of reading it again along with my husband.  We read and practice and repeat.A lot of the information covered in the book, I already had watched on the videos.  So, if you have purchased the video collection, would you still want to purchase the book? Yes!  The book contains additional information not found in the videos.  For instance, one of my favorite chapters was near the end, "The Art of Survival Driving."  Jason offers a course that teaches this, which I would love to enroll my husband in.  He's pretty stoked about taking this class some day.  In the meantime, we have the basic information taught in this book.I love all the true-life stories he tells regarding each of the topics he covers in the book.  One gets a real life perspective that these bad things do happen to people, and by reading and practicing his suggestions (yes practicing each day and Jason shares his training schedule) we can each avoid many of these situations, or know what to do to save ourselves.  He also provides many websites he has created regarding these particular topics.  The websites share videos and other valuable information.This book should be in everyone's home and not to just sit on a bookshelf.  Read it, and read it again. Practice, and practice daily.  Be ready to protect you and your family with simple steps such as just getting off the X.  (Mentioned throughout the book how important it is to move and not freeze.)I was very impressed by this book and all of the additional information that did not come with the videos I purchased a year earlier.  Glad to have this knowledge.  This book will be a source of valuable information for a long time. I strongly recommend this book.

Living in a very humid climate, everything that has something cold inside condenses quickly and a lot making a very wet mess all over my table or breakfast bar.  From condiment jars, to bottled water, to milk jugs, to just about everything.  Coasters go only so far.Thanks to Ozeri and their new innovation of the Serafino double layer drinking glasses, I no longer have to deal with the condensation from these particular glasses.  That's Awesome!  They are so pretty and clear, unlike my other drinking glasses that were ruined with our hard water and dishwasher.  These glasses are dishwasher safe, but not recommended.  I hand wash all of my new glassware now.Not only are these great to keep condensation away, and good looking, they are also microwaveable. The really awesome part about this is that you can heat up your milk for hot chocolate in the microwave add your chocolate mix, and the glass is Never hot to the touch. In fact, it is room temperature, not even warm.  Any other glass I own, first off is not microwaveable, but any mug I place in the microwave is Hot after heating up milk or water etc.Serafino glassware is made from glass similar to Pyrex.  So although they are more breakable resistant, they are less likely to break than a normal drinking glass.  That translates into, if you have older kids you trust to drink from a "glass" glass, you will absolutely love these.  I wouldn't trust toddlers still learning to hold onto a cup.Do yourself and your family a favorite, and be sure to order a set of these 12 ounce drinking glasses, along with the 8 ounce ones.  These make awesome Christmas gifts, house warming gifts, or any other reason you choose.  Make your table setting prettier with these great glasses today.Love the No condensation, the fact they are microwaveable and freezer safe.  They look awesome with any place setting, and love the suspended beverage look.  The contour on the glass makes it easy to hold.  They are awesome glasses.  I highly recommend these glasses even though I received them free in exchange for my honest opinion.

Ozeri has come up with an awesome product the Moderna Artisan Series Double Wall Beverage Glasses.  These are 8 ounce glasses, and come in a set of 4 on sale right now at Amazon for $20.  These are made from borosilicate glass which is a mixture of silica and boron trioxide making them more resistant to thermal shock than any other glass.  Think Pyrex.It is way past time to update my drinking glasses.  The hard water where I live, plus the fact that most of my glasses are over 35 years old, have really taken a toll these last 3 years.  My dishwasher, no matter which detergent I use, and I've tried them all, plus hand washing, just don't make these very appealing to drink from any more.  Time to dispose of them and get something new.  So I've been looking for awhile, and when Ozeri presented these new awesome glasses, there was no way I wasn't going to try them.  It was love at first sight.The fact that each of these glasses are hand made, or rather mouth-blown using a glass that Pyrex used to use, I knew these had to be great.  I love the double-walled design with the little dimples that fit fingers perfectly when holding them.  They're adorable.I was very surprised when I heated up a glass of water for my morning lemon, cayenne and honey drink.  I heated the water for 1 minute in the microwave.  30 seconds longer than I normally do.  The glass felt as if it were room temperature.  I let the glass sit on the counter for 5 minutes, and no condensation whatsoever, and the double-walled glass kept my drink warmer than in a normal mug.  I nearly burned my mouth with the drink, but the glass remained almost cool to the touch.Next, I placed cold water in my everyday drinking glass, and the Ozeri Moderna Artisan Series Double Wall Beverage Glass.  No condensation after leaving out on counter for 15 minutes.  Next, I placed both glasses in the fridge for about 30 minutes, pulled them out and placed on counter again for about 10 minutes.  Still no condensation on the Ozeri glasses just my glass.  That's impressive.  I live in such a humid climate that every glass, water bottle, etc., gets condensation on it, despite hot or cold beverage inside.Needless to say these glasses are winners with me.  They may break, but they are less likely to do so than regular glasses.  They are less likely to shatter if they do break.  They are completely resistant to acids (yeah for my lemon drink each morning) and these will never lose their original sheen.  No more ugly glasses.They are oven and microwave safe, as well as freezer safe.  They can also be placed in the dishwasher, but not recommended.  Use caution when placing ice in the glass or when using stirrers such as metal spoons.These are such fun and awesome glasses.  I love the double-wall design along with the little "dimples" for the fingers.  No matter how hot or cold the beverage, the glasses feel room temperature, so be careful when drinking hot drinks.  Love the fact they will never lose their original sheen.  Even though I received these free for my honest opinion, I have now found my new set of drinking glasses.

Love how my skin and hair feel after using Foxbrim 100% Pure Jojoba Oil. No more frizzies, and hair shines and feels hydrated, not dry, especially since I dye it regularly.  Blends well with other ingredients, but great just by itself.  I use as a make-up remover and moisturizer night and morning.  It is absorbed into skin quickly without leaving it greasy.  I know, because my phone screen does not leave any fingerprints on it after applying Jojoba oil.  Fine lines around eyes are diminishing quickly, like just a couple of days of use I've seen improvement.  Skin is more soft and supple.  Love Love Love the big 4 ounce bottle of Jojoba Oil by Foxbrim.  Did receive product for free in exchange for my honest opinion.  However, if I didn't like the oil to begin with, I wouldn't have asked to review it.  Most pleasant surprise was the huge 4 ounce size.  I certainly recommend this product to all.  So versatile and nourishing.

I've never experienced using a professional lemon squeezer such as this.  I just have the old fashioned kind.  My first impression when I opened up the box was this thing is huge.  I can squeeze my oranges too, not just lemons and limes.I've learned over the years that to get the most juice from your citrus when squeezing, there are certain things to do first.  You can either roll the fruits on a counter or cutting board using the palm of your hand to soften the membranes of the fruit.  You can heat up the fruit in a microwave for about 30 seconds.  You can run the fruit under hot water for a few minutes.  Then when you are ready to squeeze, slice your fruit lengthwise (which is the opposite of what you would normally tend to do.)Well after I washed the fruit using a mixture of vinegar, water, and lemon essential oil, I placed the lime and orange in the microwave for 30 seconds, then slightly rolled them in the palm of my hand to completely soften and break down the hard membranes so I could maximize the juice quantity.  Then I sliced my oranges the normal way, and the lime lengthwise.  Now my oranges are small.  In fact, the lime was larger than my oranges.  But my small oranges are very tasty.When you place the fruit into the squeezer, it almost seems natural to place it in upside down.  Don't do that or you will have juice going where you don't want it.  When place properly, the juice will flow out the holes in the bottom into your container. Needless to say, when I saw all the pulp left on the peels, I thought that a lot of juice was still left untouched.  Not so.  I was pleasantly surprised that the pulp was extremely dry.  So, if you want the pulp in your juice, this lemon squeezer won't provide it.  You will have to manually extract the pulp from the peel.After trying the oranges, I decided to test this professional citrus squeezer against my old fashioned kind.  I did this with the lime.  I sliced my lime lengthwise to maximize juice production.  I again was pleasantly surprised that each yielded the same amount of juice.  However, the old fashioned juicer gave me all the pulp, the professional squeezer left the pulp in the peel.  I'll tell you this, the professional squeezer has my vote.  It is faster, easier and more fun to use.  Clean up is fast and easy and there was less mess all together with Kitchen Frontier's Professional Lemon Squeezer.

Lately I've experienced some pain in my upper arm. Have had this off and on over the last 9 months or so.  So, I just applied two drops of peppermint oil to my arm.  It hasn't been 2 minutes and I can feel the warmth seeping down into my muscles relieving the pain in my arm.  My husband, sitting 5 feet away at his desk working, said his nose cleared up and he can breathe better than he could just moments ago.  45 minutes later and my arm is still pain free.Peppermint Oil helps relieve migraine headaches. Apply a drop to each temple, and rub some on the back of your neck and you should receive instant relief.I have tried the peppermint oil to ward off spiders.  This stuff really works.  Believe me.  I've tried just about every product on the market found in the Bug Killer section at my local Lowe's.  Nothing has worked like the peppermint oil to keep spiders away.  And with all the Black Widows I have around my place, I don't need spiders hanging out with me.I make my own re-mineralization toothpaste.  I've had two cavities I've been working real hard to get rid of since January of this year.  One is completely gone, and the other is almost gone.  I believe that the Peppermint Oil in my DIY Toothpaste is a big part of why the cavities are disappearing.This is such a great product,  I firmly believe every home should have 100% Pure Peppermint Oil.  It is a great panacea for our health.  Peppermint Oil is the world's most widely used essential oil.Amazing product that works for many different things.  Very versatile.  Therapeutic Grade A. Large 4 oz. amber colored bottle with glass dropper.

This garden hand tool set are new play toys for me.  New play toys for me.  My kids have all come to understand that when Mom wants to "play", she is out working in the garden/yard or painting walls.  I've even begged my son to fly me out to his new home so I could "play" with him as he painted walls.  Oh well.  These new "play" tools came at the right time.I was only going to go out for a few minutes and pull up some obnoxious weeds with my new toys. An hour and a half later, and because it started to rain, I finally came in.  I did not have any blisters on my hands.  These tools fit so comfy in the palms of my hands my arms were not tired one bit, even the next day.  Can't wait to go "play" some more later today.The hand trowel is perfect for digging up weeds as well as useful for planting.  However, the transplanting trowel, with it's graduated numbers showing depth in inches and centimeters, is the perfect tool for planting seedlings and other plants that come in the starter packs.  It also does a great job digging up dandelions.  Which is the one tool I use the most - a dandelion digger, and not included in this set.  Not that I have a lot of dandelions, but I have quite an accumulation of weeds from the community lawn mowers.The hand cultivator or "rake" does not have pointed tips.  Be it good or bad, you'll need to decide. I've only ever used those with the pointed tips, so was pleasantly surprised at how well this hand cultivator with the squared off tips actually performed better than I anticipated.  I especially like to use this tool for fluffing up my pine needles around my plants, especially after the hard rains we get. This tool is also used to remove shallow rooted weeds and loosen surface soil.  Personally, I didn't think it did a great job with the surface or shallow rooted weeds.  It did well with loosening the soil however.These hand tools are brightly colored lime green.  I didn't believe they would be easy to spot, but sure enough, I laid them down, took one of the tools with me around the yard, and didn't have to search long before I found where I placed the others.  The lime green really did stand out.LifeWell Hand Tools are great little tools for every gardener.  I like my new set of toys.

When I first received the package of the Sample Set of Handmade soap by Keomi, I could smell the wonderfulness of them.  Each bar is extremely aromatic.  My husband keeps asking me where  the new diffuser is because they smell so strong, in a good way.The Sample Set contains 4 different scents.Sea Breeze. Refresh your skin with this bar of soap. It contains Pure Olive Oil, Palm Kernel Oil, Avocado, Grape Seed, and Coconut Oil, as well as Cocoa Butter, Dead Sea Salt and Dead Sea Clay, Seaweed.  It is scented with a blend of Lavender, Oakmoss and Fir.Golden Crown is considered Keomi's Most Luxurious Soap.  It is made with Pure Olive Oil, Avocado Oil, Safflower Oil, Coconut Oil, Palm Kernel Oil, Grape Seed Oil, Apricot and Rice Bran.  Infused with Calendula Flowers, Oils of Orange, Fir and Frankincense.Luscious Lavender.  Relax and unwind with Lavender.  Made with Pure Olive Oil, Palm Oil, Sunflower Oil, Avocado Oil, Apricot Oil, Coconut Oil, Grape See Oil, Safflower Oil, Rice Bran and Cocoa Butter.  Scented with a blend of 3 Lavenders.Green Tea Goddess.  Help your skin stay young looking.  Made with Olive Oil, Grape Seed Oil, Coconut Oil, Palm Oil, Avocado Oil and Cocoa Butter, Organic Green Tea, Nettle, Shavegrass and Comfrey Root. Scented with Clary Sage, Orange and Clove.My personal favorite is the Golden Crown.  It smells so enchanting. The blend of the scents are truly heavenly.  The sample set is a great way to choose which scent you like best.  Currently Keomi is offering a 2 and 4 bar sample set for FREE.  You just have to pay shipping and handling charges.It is strongly recommended that when using Keomi's soaps, that you store them in a dry place away from a stream of water or under a counter with metal pipes.  Keep them in a soap dish that drains, not pools.  And when using the soaps, don't rub directly on body, but use a washcloth, hands or other material.  This will help the soap last longer, and help prevent it from becoming a liquid soap.Your skin will feel soft, smooth and silky after using this soap.  It is not drying at all.  The fragrance will linger on for awhile, so keep that in mind if you plan to use perfume afterwards.  You will smell clean and fresh after using their bars of soap.Pros:  Very strongly scented, which lingers after using.  Skin feels awesome afterwards.  Very moisturizing.  Don't be tempted to just stash them away in your dresser drawers or closets, unless you purchase extras to do so.  Let your skin become silky soft by using these.
