I love love love the Ozeri Green Earth Pans.  I use them for just about everything I cook on the stove.  I like to make skillet dinners and these are perfect for those.  Cooking omlets and frying eggs are a snap.  Because of the textured bottoms, my eggs are evenly cooked on the bottom.  I'll cook up chopped onions and other veggies and I've been impressed every time.  In fact, I very seldom use my other waterless cookware as I've come to rely on the Ozeri Green Earth Pans.Another feature I especially like about the textured bottomed pans is actually the diamter of the pans. The 12 inch fry pan does indeed measure 12 inches across the top edge.  The bottom edge measures 11 inches.  It doesn't slope upward so the entire bottom of the pan is still 11 inches.  This makes it easier for me when I cook, as I don't feel like the food is having to cook up the side of the fry pan like with other pans.The silicone handle is wonderful.  I recently cooked pancakes in a non-Green Earth Pan.  I automatically grabbed onto the handle as I was flipping the pancake over and burned my hand.  I'm so used to never needing to use hot pads with the silicone handles, it was quite a shock when I touched this very hot handle.  I never have to worry about that with the silicone handles on the Green Earth Pan's.I remember years ago about someone commenting about how they always seemed to burn cheese in their fry pans and it would stick real bad and made cleaning difficult.  I always thought she used fake cheese to make it burn in the first place, but I do not have to use very much oil in my cooking at all with this fry pan, and I've never had anything stick or burn.  You can actually use lower temperatures with this fry pan as it heats so evenly.  My suggestion would be to heat the pan up first on the stove before starting to cook.  That way, you will feel like it will actually cook faster at lower temperatures, as well as cooking more evenly.This pan comes with a heavy duty felt pad to help protect your pan from being scratched when storing.

I typically do not use sugar substitutes.  I use honey or regular good old fashioned sugar.  Sugar substitutes have a bad wrap.  They're either not healthy, very dangerous, or have awful bitter after tastes.  Well, you can now give up those unhealthy bad tasting "sugars" and get Kiva Organic Stevia instead.  It has a pleasant taste, no bitter after taste.  Not only that but it mixes and dissolves well. There are "0" calories, and because of the low glycemic index, makes it great for anyone concerned about managing their blood sugar.This container holds 8 ounces so this will last you a long time.

This bathroom scale is by far the most unique I have ever used.  I was amazed at how many functions it measures just by stepping onto the scale.  You do need to be barefoot, and right after a shower is best when feet are slightly moist.  Otherwise, slightly moisten feet before stepping onto scale.  The 4G sensors that your feet step on help to provide a precise body weight measurement, by sending a small electrical current that honestly cannot be felt.Each item it tracks has its own little symbol and lights up while the large numbers on the large blue backlight LCD screen indicate what those measurements are.Customer Service is great.  I had a question about the kcal measurement (Last Symbol on Scale.) They responded very quickly.This scale is smaller than most I've used, but I don't bump into it either.  It fits better in my bathroom. I have also noticed that it shows me weighing about 1/2 pound higher than other scales I have used. If you want to see the other body measurements, not just your body weight, you need to stay on the scale a little longer for the calculations and display to show up.The only other thing that would have made this scale a 5 star was the ability for it to track either up or down, or percentages or some other way each individual category it calculates so I didn't have to write it down and keep track of it myself.

There are so many reasons to use kitchen scales.  Lately for me it has been to weigh my postal mail to determine if I need another stamp or not.  I know that usually 2 stamps are more than the letter needs, but when I consider the drive time, gas, etc., I'm better off with 2 stamps on the letter.  And that is certainly better than having the letter come back with insuffienct postage stamped on it.The Pro Pocket Scale by Smart Weigh has several cool features.  I always like the tare function on kitchen scales, which is included.  It has a back light, which is always a plus for me.  The numbers are large enough for me to read.  I like the small size.  I've not experienced it being too small for anything I've needed to weigh. Capacity is 2000 grams or just over 4 pounds.  This is the first kitchen scale that has come with lids or lipped containers that I've used, to help keep things like beads, or powder confined. A great feature.I can see how this would be very useful for someone who is into jewelry making, or one who sells jewelry pieces.  The PCS function is perfect for weighing 100's of beads quickly.  For instance, you can tare the lipped container provided with scale, put in 10 pieces of beads, press the PCS button, then enter the number of beads you just placed (10). Next add more beads and the Pro Pocket Scale will count the number of beads.  You don't have to count out the number of beads you desire, the scale does it for you.I really like the petite size of this scale, and the lipped containers/lids to keep things from rolling off the scale.  It comes with 2 AAA batteries so one doesn't have to worry about finding the lithium batteries.  It works great for everything I need.

I love Spirulina.  I feel it is one of the best products out there to provide many of the minerals our bodies need.  I often have a hard time finding it in my local stores, and when I do I stock up.  Now with Organic Spirulina by Sari Foods, I feel I get a much more perfect food product.  And now I can trust that I am getting a superior product through Sari Foods.I love the deep dark green color of the fine powder.  It pretty much stays bright green too when mixed with other foods.  Sometimes that can be overwhelming if you are not used to this.  I kept thinking as I mixed this powder into various food items, how this would have been the perfect item to add to my "green" foods for St. Patrick's Day.  I used to serve our kids all green meals that day from breakfast to dinner.Ok, so despite that, I've been very impressed that this does not taste or smell fishy nor like a swamp. There is a certain amount of freshness that comes to mind when I open up the package to add to various meals.  My favorite so far is adding to green smoothies.  Now they're really green.  I also add this to soups, rice, and salads.  I feel like my body is actually noticing a difference and starting to "wake-up" and feel energized.Currently, my husband and I are focusing on improving our immune system.  Spirulina is the perfect way to do this.  I must say I was very surprised that it is also a great source of calcum, magnesium, selenium and beta-carotine.  The chlorophyll is an added benefit.  Chlorophyll helps control hunger, promotes cleansing, helps with candida albicans, and much more.Sari Foods includes an ebook with all kinds of recipes to incorporate Spirulina powder.  There are appetizers, main dishes, snacks, smoothies, seasonings, and desserts.  I haven't tried them all, but the hummus recipe is great.The thing I like the best is the almost no-flavor, no smell yet powerful Spirulina from Sari Foods.  I feel this is such a concentrated powder compared to others, that you know you are getting a top quality product.

I've never owned a garlic press before in my life until recently.  Basically, I just don't like garlic, why bother.  Then my daughter mentioned that a garlic press would work great with fresh ginger, and now I was listening.  Having the opportunity to try this garlic press by Priority Chef, I thought I might give this a try not only on ginger, but garlic as well.I really liked the feature of being able to mince the garlic without having to peel it first.  I really don't like the smell of garlic, therefore, didn't want that on my hands.  It works real slick.  Just break the cloves off the main bulb, stick them in the chamber, clamp down on the handle grips, and woolah, minced garlic on one side, skins on the other.  The skins were easily removed with a knife.Next I did try the ginger.  I did peel the ginger first and probably didn't need too.  However, ginger at least peels easily, it's just slicing that is difficult.  I placed a chunck about the size of a clove of garlic in the chamber.  Squeezing the handles for the ginger was a little tougher than for the garlic.  But it worked.  Ginger produces a lot of extra juice, but the minced pieces soaked that up nicely.The handles on the Priority Chef garlic press are designed so that those with small hands can grip and squeeze comfortably.  Unfortunately, they actually didn't feel very good in my hands.  I thought if they were more rounded it would have been more comfortable.  Consequently, I have medium sized hands so that may have made a difference.  Despite the handles, the garlic press was impressive and something I'll use for a long time.This comes with a free e-book that states very clearly how to use the garlic press and how to clean it.  It also provides several delicious recipes, and a large variety of recipes in which garlic is used.  I've tried some of them, and quite frankly, for someone who doesn't like garlic, these are pretty good.  I'm learning to like garlic a whole lot more since it is so good for our bodies.Works just like they said.  Easy cleanup.  Don't have to have smelly hands from the garlic. Great recipes in the free e-book.Wished the handles were more rounded.  Would have felt more comfortable to me.

I love pasta, but pasta doesn't love my waist line.  Now I can have some of my favorite pasta dishes by subsituting vegetables and know I'm much better off eating healthier.The first time I tried this tool, I wasn't quite getting the hang of it.  I thought how silly, it's just like a giant pencil sharpener.  My first veggie of choice was a carrot.  Well, I rushed out to the store and stocked up on summer squash and cucumbers.  It was easier for me to master the hang of this cool gadget using a veggie that was a little less firm than a carrot.  Once I got the hang of it, I've been going crazy ever since. And now carrots are no problemo.I like having the 2 Julienne sizes.  I prefer the summer squashes thick, and the carrots extra thin.  I don't have to worry about the extra seeds, especially from the cucumbers getting into the spirals. This tool is designed to core the veggies and keep seeds from getting into the spiraled veggies.  I've made several dishes from these pasta like veggies.  I was even surprised when my husband said he actually liked the new versions of the pasta dishes.  Yeah!The Brieftons Spiral Slicer is a must have for a healthy way of living, for families with kids that need a new fun way of eating veggies, and for everyone.  Encourage your kids to help create their own veggie pastas too, while supervising them with the Spiral Slicer.  I know my kids were more anxious to eat when they helped prepare their own meals.Cleanup is a snap.  I just rinse under the tap, spray with a solution of vinegar and water, and rinse again.  I also just hand wash and utilize the cleaning brush to clear all seeds from the blades.I love the spiraled veggies, and the fun ways to incorporate them into my diet.  Very easy to swap out these spiraled veggies for pasta in many dishes.  It's fun and easy to use.

I like the taste of molasses, so figured this would be a great tasting product.  I began by substituting Yacon Syrup for honey I was adding to my warm lemon water, cayenne pepper and honey each morning.  Well, I'll tell you this much, I like molasses a whole lot better, and I prefer the honey in my lemon water.  BUT...given the facts that this product will help me feel full longer, will speed up my metabolism, and help me lose weight, I figured I could give this a try.  I've also tried it in green smoothies, and I like that option a whole lot better.So, I started this on Monday.  Today is Friday.  I've lost 2 pounds in just that short period of time-5 days. I've eaten the same as I have been, but I'll also mention that I have also started rebounding again for 10 minutes each day.  It is recommended to take 1 teaspoon 3 times a day.  I've only been taking 1 teaspoon a day.I believe that the Yacon Syrup is what helped get these 2 pounds off so quickly.  I'm not sure how fast it will continue to work, meaning, how fast will I continue to lose 2 pounds every 5 days, but as long as the weight loss is steady, I'm good with that.  I have just about 10 more pounds to drop, and I understand this will be the hardest 10 pounds to lose, so I'm hoping for continued success with Yacon Syrup.So far it is working very well in helping me feel full longer, and helping me lose weight.  However, the taste is hard to get used to.  Just cannot take it straight, but have to mix it with something.

I have never owned a garlic press in my life.  This is my first experience with one.  My hubby has been wanting me to incorporate fresh garlic into our diet for years.  Well, I personally don't care for it, so never obliged.  Now that we are focusing more on our health, not that we are unhealthy, but want to have better health, and lose about 15 pounds each, I gave in to the garlic once I had this opportunity to review this product.  Of course, it certainly helped to see how my daughter and her husband have each lost about 15 pounds over the last couple of months, and she uses garlic all the time and recommended that I get a good quality garlic press not only for fresh garlic, but ginger as well.  Hello Alpha Grillers!I already had fresh ginger in my pantry, and decided to try that first.  What a disaster.  Not blaming the garlic press at all, but the ginger.  It was very green, not bright yellow like we were used to.  I did get a lot of ginger juice though.That night I purchased a better root branch of ginger.  Much better results.  This was so cool, so easy. Love it!  We eat raw ginger on our tuna/salmon sandwiches daily.  I no longer have to worry if I'm going to end up getting my fingers cut when I sliced ginger, because I can now put it through this great garlic press.  Never would have guessed ginger would be so difficult to slice.Next I actually tried garlic.  Yep!  The garlic peeler worked wonders.  Just place a clove of garlic in the tube, rub it around a bit, and like magic the skin is off and ready for the press.Then I placed the garlic in the press, squeezed, much lighter than I had to with the ginger, and I was amazed at how swift this process was.  Painless, quick, and I didn't even have to touch the left overs in the press.  I just removed that with a butter knife.Now I'm going to make humus using the fresh garlic, butternut squash, and a few other seasonings.This is so easy to use.  Don't have to squeeze very hard.  Works great on ripe (if that's the correct term) of ginger root, and very slick process for the garlic cloves.  Washes up quick and easy by hand.  Peeler is a snap too.  Love this product.

Ozeri 3x 44"  Tower Fan comes with passive noise reduction technology.  It has 3 independently controllable fans and 3 fan speeds.  It offers up to 9 levels of cooling and the ultimate in customized airflow.It features 3 preprogrammed airflow patterns designed to help foster sleep, relaxation and comfort with a 90 degree whisper-quiet oscillation for optimal air circulation.The new Ozeri 3x 44" Tower Fan is one of the world's thinnest fans.  It is less than 3 inches thick.  The fan can swivel and oscillate 90 degrees.  Comes complete with remote.  Satisfaction is guaranteed.This tower fan is very stylish, and very quiet.  It stands 44 inches tall.  The base is solid and very attractive.  It has 3 individual fans that are placed one on top of the other in the tower.  The remote is very handy for me.  The fan sits behind my husband's desk, so he can just reach back and turn it on.  I get to use the remote from my desk and turn it on without having to leave the comfort of my chair.  The remote has a 7.5 hour timer that can be programmed in 30 minute increments.The fan provides just the right amount of circulation for our hot office.  Our office happens to be in the hottest room in the entire house, but we also have the very best view from here.Our desks sit up off the floor approximately 12 inches.  That way we are able to stand or sit comfortably at our desks.  This fan provides the circulation at just the right height for us when at our desks.  It keeps the air circulated nicely for the entire room.  It actually works better than our ceiling fan.  Not only that, but with it being so quiet, my husband can carry on conference calls without having to shut the fan off.We also like the 90 degree swivel of the fan.  This allows for more air circulation throughout the room.  We like the variable speeds the fan provides.  Obviously, during the afternoon, we need the fan running a full speed with all 3 fans running at once.  In the morning we prefer the nature mode.  Here the fan will cycle between high, medium and low speeds for 5 seconds each at high speed.  On medium speed the fan will cycle between medium and low.  If set to low, the fan will cycle between low and off.  Some mornings we set it at high speed, but lately, most mornings we only need it at low speed.The 3x 44" Tower Fan also has a sleep mode.  It will run on high speed above for 30 minutes, then 30 minutes on medium speed, then will continue on low speed.  You can also set a timer for night time as well, or any time for that matter.  For those that have a hard time sleeping at night, and sleep better with white noise, this fan is for you.  It will not only cool the room temperature which aids in better sleep, but has such a nice gentle hum you will fall asleep very quickly.Be sure to order your Ozeri 3x44" Tower Fan today.  It is not only beneficial during the summer, but it also helps circulate the warmer air and heat during the winter.  You won't want to be without this fantastic fan.This is a fantastic fan that works very well.  It is very innovative, attractive, quiet, and doesn't take up much room at all.  So much better than box fans or regular oscillating fans.

This is somewhat like eating a superior brand of soft oatmeal raisin cookies.  The ingredients are whole grain oats, honey, canola oil, raisins, oat bran, molasses, ground flax seed, vanilla extract, and spices (cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves).  A 2 ounce serving (based on 6 servings in the 12 ounce bag, is rated as 5 grams of protein, and 4 grams of fiber with 230 total calories.  I thought that the flavor was good, with some after taste because of the spice.

John Rebus is back at work.  The mandatory retirement age was changed and he is reemployed, although at a reduced rank.  He becomes involved in two cold cases.  One he is pursuing on his own - it involves a man he is sure is guilty of murder but they could never find the body.  The other is an old case that involved colleagues that he worked with years before - some people don't want that case reopened because there was something wrong with the investigation.  The second case becomes very hot when a couple people are killed, one of them being a prominent politician.  There are questions of people being paid off, and some people involved in shady activities.  Sometimes events result in doing an unintended favor for someone, and there are interesting ways that a favor can be called in.A lot of people may be damaged by the investigation, and Rebus has to manage to stay out of the line of fire, while determining who pulled the trigger past and present.  This is an interesting novel.  Sometimes you can figure out who is doing what to whom, but sometimes you will be kept guessing.  There are competing interests, even among the bad guys..

Sarah Booth Delaney is back in Zinnia after a stop in New Orleans where she meets up with a blues musician who is an old lover.  He is also heading to Zinnia where he is opening a blues bar.  Events are on a collision course as some people think that blues represent the devil (too many stories of blues musicians selling their souls to the devil at the crossroads).  There are threats.  Someone is going to be killed.  There are some strange people who have shown up in the area, and everyone has agendas of their own.  Events are further compounded when an old enemy of Sarah Booth is released on bail, and is able to roam.  Of course we have a collection of the usual characters, including the family haint who is pestering Sarah Booth to have a child and continue the family line.  An interesting plot that does not quite come to an end as evil people are left at large - some with unclear motives for their actions..

This product is sold as a cough drop, but I have found that it is very effective for dealing with a dry mouth.  If you have had a problem like I had, and wake up with a dry mouth, you can place one of these inside your cheek (between the cheek and your lower teeth) and you are good for the night.  They dissolve very slowly.  They are also good if you are getting a dry mouth from exercising.  I keep a couple packages handy for when I need them.

War has many kinds of casualties, both military and civilian.  Some people are killed.  Some people disappear never to be seen again,  Many people are injured, both physically and mentally.  The story starts in St. Malo, France in 1944, just before the bombing that destroyed most of the city.  The story is told mainly by flashbacks that establish the various characters who eventually are brought together by the war.  Add in a jewel that has a curse.  The story is fragmented as it moves from character to character and they have different experiences because of the war.  Not everyone will survive.  It would be difficult to make it into a motion picture.You won't be sure who to root for in this novel because many people are victims, often by circumstances of their birth.  They cannot always be what they want to be.  You have a blind French girl who has been brought to her great uncle's home in St. Malo as a refugee from Paris.  You have a young German boy with unusual talents who was pressed into special services that will haunt him.  There is the great uncle who has PTSD from World War I.  You will always find a collaborator with the enemy, and neighbors organizing a resistance group.  Then there are the people left behind when someone goes off to war.Stick with the story as it moves about.  It will all come together.  There is an afterward closer to the present.

Lucas is drawn into a case by his adopted daughter who is attempting to help a young woman whom she met out in San Francisco when the woman was busking.  Now the woman is worried about her male companion who went off to meet a group and disappeared.  The group seem to be a strange religious cult, but think in terms of Manson (if you remember him).  The group has a dangerous, possibly insane, charismatic leader who goes by the name Pilate.  The plot moves through South Dakota, Wisconsin, Michigan, and Minnesota.  People don't stay in place very long - usually just long enough to cause trouble.The novel has violence ranging from gun fights to physical attacks.  Expect some people to die.  There are some unlikely heroes and heroines.  In the Upper Peninsula, everyone has access to at least a rifle, and many have military training.  You will get a lot of details about tracking and containing dangerous criminals.  There is sexual content, mainly by discussion.  I would give the novel an R rating, with motion picture potential.  It has a surprise ending.  I am not sure where the author intends to take the characters.  Virgil Flowers makes a brief cameo appearance, but Lucas takes the lead on the law inforcement side, aided by various other people.

This is a low priced glove if you are going to be involved in food handling, or using cleaning materials, or handling silicone seal, glue, or other material you don't want on your hands.  They are cheap, so you can throw them away after use without worrying too much about cost.

An introduction to PI Gypsy Moran.  He ran from trouble in Las Vegas, leaving town fast.  Now he is at his sister's house in Wink, Texas.  This is not somewhere you go on vacation in the middle of August when the heat is above 100 degrees, and it's the typical Texas landscape (flat).  He gets drawn into a case of a suspicious death, taking it pro bono, but there is more to the case than meets the eye.  Of course there is his old high school sweetheart from a ranch in town, a hot woman reporter from an area newspaper, an outspoken grandmother, and a few other interesting characters.  The novel will keep you reading.

The basic product (sweet orange oil) is available from various sources.  In this case you can obtain it directly from Amazon.  Citrus oils are from citrus peel and can be used for a variety of purposes from food flavoring to aromatherapy.  I have been experimenting with natural air fresheners.  For todays experiment I used6 drops sweet orange oil6 drops lavender oil6 drops rosemary oil1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract2 cups wateradd ingredients to a small sauce pan.  Heat on the stove top at a very low heat.  Keep an eye on the water level - if the pan goes dry you will get a burned aroma instead of an air freshener.All essential oils are available at Amazon.  You can try various combinations.

I actually have an Epson XP-424 Printer which seems to be an upgrade of some sort, but it has the same features.  The printers are rated as wireless but can be connected to your PC with a standard USB cable (not provided).  I prefer to connect it directly to my PC as they are side by side in any case.  It is a low-priced printer that won't break your budget, and is adequate for most people's needs.  The multifunction features are more than I need, but it is nice to have a copier capability.  The printer cartridges are easy to install (much more so than my old HP printer that died, where I usually ended up with ink on my fingers).  This is a new printer, so I am not aware at this time how long the ink cartridges last or how much they cost to replace (my old HP printer had cartridges that cost almost as much as buying this printer).  For color prints, it is not top of the line as it does not distinguish well between varying shades of colors.  It is OK for most prints, and I used it for some family photos.  It is somewhat slow compared to other printers, and is not intended for high volume printing.My main issue (the reason I knocked off a star) is the scanty set of directions provided with the printer, written in four languages.  Hey, the U.S is a major market.  If you are selling your product here, write the instructions in English, and make them a little more comprehensive.  Customer support was not helpful.  I had immediate setup problems because the directions were inadequate.  You need to open the top of the computer (accessing the same area where you install the ink cartridges) in order to remove all the blue tape, and there was a small Styrofoam packing piece inside the back of the computer that was not mentioned.  Having got past that, the installation went OK, but then I got some strange error message saying the installation was not completed.  Hmmm... Before going through all the procedure again, I punted.  I closed the installation software, and tried printing a file.  It worked just fine.  I have no idea what installation was not completed, but it may have been a function that I don't use.  I received automatic updates of the software from Epson (printers that have been sitting in a store for a while usually don't have the latest updates)..I still have to figure out the other features, but I will get to them.  I would note that there were a lot of confusing pictorial directions for loading paper that I mostly ignored.  I little observation makes the process obvious.

This is the latest CD by Grady Champion and makes an excellent addition to his other CDs.  I had the good fortune to attend his CD release party at the Bottleneck Blues Bar in Vicksburg, and thank Shirley Waring and the Vicksburg Blues Society for helping to arrange that event.  I would note that his tour band has some variations from the musicians used for the studio recording.  The CD has 11 tracks with about 45 minutes total playing time.  They range from a slow spiritual to a lively jitterbug beat.  The musicians areGrady Champion - vocal and harmonica - all tracksForrest Gordon - drums - tracks 1 thru 5, 9, and 10Murph Calcedo - drums - tracks 6, 7, and 8James Robinson - drums - track 11David Hood - bass - all tracks except 6Ray Braswell - bass - track 6Clayton Ivey - keyboard - all tracks except 6William Purvis - keyboard - track 6Michael Thomas - B3 - track 6Barry Leach - guitar -  tracks 2, 3, 4. 5, 8, 9, and 10Maurice Morgan - guitar - track 6Stevie J - guitar - track 6Mike Griffin - lead guitar - track 11Jimmy Johnson - rhythm guitar - track 11Taylor Scott - guitar - tracks 1 and 7Castro Coleman (aka Mr. Sipp) - additional guitar - track 2Kimble Funches - TrumpetMicah Brown - saxWilliam Brown - tromboneBackground vocals on various tracks include Darrell Luster, Ray Braswell, and William Purvis (tracks 1 thru 6 and 8), Vick Allen (tracks 9 and 10), Sonya Allen (track 9) , J.J. Thames (track 7), and the Crowns of Joy (track 11 only).The 11 tracks, with composers indicated, are1.  Beg, Borrow, Steal (Larry Grisham) - lively dance beat.  Good breaks with horns and drums.2.  Bootleg Whiskey (George Jackson) - A little slower beat - good music breaks and background vocals with fade out.3.  Don't Waste My Time (Ernie Johnson) - a slow dance beat with fade out4.  Home Alone (Grady Champion and Larry Grisham) - a somewhat faster beat with instrumental breaks.5.  Ten Dollars (Grady Champion) - a slow beat with short instrumental breaks (good horns)6.  South Side (Darrell Luster) - A faster beat (good backup vocals) "It's where you wanna be"7.  Who Dat (Grady Champion and Larry Grisham) - a slower bear "Who dat callin' my name" with fade out8.  Here We Go Ya'll  (Grady Champion and Larry Grisham) -  A lively jitterbug beat that had people moving on the dance floor, with fade out.9.  I Tripped and Fell in Love (Darrell Luster) -  a little slower, but lively beat10. Mr. Right (Darrell Luster and Grady Champion) - a lively beat with good backup vocal and instrumental, with fade out "You might want to settle for Mr. Wrong, until Mr. Right decides to come along."11. White Boy With the Blues (Jerry Strickland) - a slow beat with backup vocal spiritual.

The latest adventures of Lady Georgiana Rannock, but this one does not involve the Queen.  Georgie has continued staying on as a poor house guest with some older women.  Her mother arrives unexpectedly and recruits her as a companion for a trip to America, in particular, to Reno where her mother plans to obtain a Nevada divorce from her estranged husband (the rich Texas oilman) in order to marry the rich German industrialist (who has given her the chateau on the French coast plus a Swiss chalet).So, it is off to London, with Queenie in tow, to stay at a somewhat posh hotel while her mother takes her shopping.  Then it is off to a first class cabin on an Ocean Liner bound across the Atlantic - her first trans-Atlantic trip.  Aw, but there is a thief aboard, and a valuable jewel disappears.  The game is afoot, and it turns out Darcy is chasing the elusive thief who has been plundering valuables from rich British aristocrats.Things become complicated when Lady Georgiana's mother, who started life as an actress, makes a side trip to Hollywood, in particular to Beverly Hills to stay at the best hotel in town.  One thing leads to another.  Could her mother be going back into acting?  Ah, but a weekend invitation to an estate leads to a death, which always seems to be the case where Lady Georgiana is involved.  There are numerous side plots involving the usual characters as the case winds down to a blazing finish.Onward to the next adventure.  Maybe the Queen will need her skills again.  And there is that character, Hitler, causing problems in Germany.  This was not the best book in the series, and I am missing her visits with the Queen, but it is enjoyable light reading, even though I guessed the villain before the end.

This is the first novel in the Dortmunder series.  He has been released from prison, and sent back home to start a "new life."  He is approached by a man who wants help in organizing a heist for a client.  They will get expense money plus a payoff.  Sounds attractive.  They need a lock man, a driver, and some muscle to make up a five person gang.  As usual with Dortmunder, nothing works out right.  The heist seems simple enough, but they separate in the escape, and the man with the stolen emerald (the hot rock) is picked up by the police.  OK, break him out of jail so he will tell them where it is.  Oops - hidden in the police station, except that it is not.  Someone else got there first.  OK, track down that someone.  They access a safety deposit box.  But then the whole thing is another double cross.  Steal it back.  Eventually they are going to get their money.

I am not sure how I missed this collection when it first came out.  I was checking on one of my favorite authors, and found the lead to it.  The title is misleading.  Assassin (noun) is usually defined as a person killing someone for pay.  In this case, some of the killers are not being paid.  As to the 23 stories (you get a lot for your money), we have -"Nightshade" by Stephen England - A team of CIA assassins are in Paraguay to take out a terrorist.  Things go wrong, but skilled people know how to improvise.  A recent novel by the author is Day of Reckoning (Shadow Warriors)"The Pepper Tyrant" by J. Gregory Smith - a man just wants to live his life, but is on the wrong side of a Mexican gangster.  There is a way to remove the threat, but not everything is as he expected."Everybody Wins" by Lisa Mannetti - A woman is suicidal, but someone has an arrangement to change her life, perhaps not as expected."Fat Larry's Night With the Alligators" by Ben Goldman - A question of disposing of a body in the Everglades, except that is not the only reason they are there."Thyf's Tale" by Christine Morgan - set in the Viking era with an unexpected assassin."Misconceptions" by Matt Hilton - sometimes two jobs get rolled into one."Second Amendment Solution" by Billie Sue Mosiman - Set in Texas, the home of the author, this is a story that would appeal to the NRA and others favoring the right to bear arms.  Big government in the form of Homeland Security has taken a man away without saying why.  His wife was brought up to believe a person has a right to defend themselves and their family (her father had killed an intruder).  So what should she do?"Killer" by Ken Bruen - is a strange story, almost surreal."For the Love of Boys"  by Rob M. Miller - A story about pedophiles and retribution."Bloodshed Fred" by Monica J. O'Rourke - A hit man gets an assignment that he had not expected and perhaps should have used more caution."Slasher" by F. Paul Wilson - This is a bit of an eerie story.  People need to be careful to check things out better."Fire and Ice" by Joseph Badal - Some punks who think they are above the law find out they have messed with the wrong family.  The author's most recent novel is Shell Game: Inspired by Actual Events (Volume 1) [Paperback] [2012] (Author) Joseph Badal"Madame" by Doug Blakeslee - It's a family business dating back several centuries."The Man Who Shot Hitler" by Elliott Capon - a fanciful alternate history."Mercy Killing" by Laura DiSilverio - An unusual plot with a blind hit man.  That can be a disadvantage in more ways than one.  Checking on this author led me to the collection.  She usually writes about PI Charlie Swift Swift Justice: A Mystery (Thomas Dunne Books) and the Mall Cop series Die Buying (Mall Cop)"Scrub" by Michael Bailey - A somewhat strange story about a woman with a sideline."The Wellmaster's Daughter" by James S. Dorr - Set in the Sahara desert, this story is not going to end well for anyone."Wish I'd Never Met You" by Jonathan Templar - Assassins with time travel who can change the past (with permission)."The Bluelight Special" by J. Carson Black - A man wants another man to pay for the injuries a woman suffered, but the man needs some convincing.  The author writes the Laura Cardinal series Flight 12: A Laura Cardinal Thriller (Flight 12 Begins Series)"Welcome to the Food Chain" by Weldon Burge - An unsavory type wants to cut a hit man's fee, and you should never annoy a hit man, especially one who may not be completely right in the head."Inside Out" by Al Boudreau - Dealing with a dangerous man is not always advisable, especially if you have given him a reason to dislike you."Katakiuchi" by Charles Colyott is in narrative form with a character that will remind you of Lisbeth Salander.  Amazing what you can do with superior computer skills; especially if you really don't like someone."Taking Care of Business" by Lynn Mann - Who is stinging whom?

An interesting collection of short stories, some of which were published elsewhere.  Of particular interest is the author's discussion of how the Dortmunder series of novels came into being.  What we have are 9 interesting Dortmunder stories, one story which I would call a scene rather than a complete short story, and one short story about other characters similar to Dortmunder and Associates.  It is only a dozen if you count the author's discussion.  What the collection contains is"Dortmunder and Me, in Short" - an interesting discussion by the author about the development of the Dortmunder character."Ask a Silly Question" - A solicitation to Dortmunder by an individual who wants to recover something given to his wife.  A usual with Dortmunder, nothing works out right, but there are some side benefits."Horse Laugh" - A man wants assistance in stealing a valuable horse.  Nothing works out as expected."Too Many Crooks" - A beautiful plan to tunnel into a bank's vault.  Oops...someone else had ideas about robbing the bank.  Well, there is more than one way to handle things."A Midsummer Daydream" - Dortmunder is off away from the city while things cool off at home, but gets accused of a robbery.  He has to find the real thief, and there is a little twist at the end."The Dortmunder Workout" - This is really a short scene at OJ's rather than a short story (my reason for knocking a star off the rating).  People should not include writing exercises in their published collections."Party Animal" - Dortmunder's escape from a crime scene takes him into the middle of someone's party.  He has to improvise a bit, and part with some of his loot.  All's well that ends well, at least for Dortmunder."Give Till it Hurts"  - finds Dortmunder escaping from another theft, and this time finding himself in the middle of a "friendly" poker game.  He discovers that you have to use care in how you play a game."Jumble Sale" - Dortmunder finds himself in the middle of an attempted sting.  As the end result, he makes a swap."Now What" - Dortmunder finds himself in possession of a valuable brooch.  The problem that he has is disposing of it as everything goes wrong.  It's like it is cursed.  He finally makes a deal, but it does not turn out as expected."Art and Craft"  - A former acquaintance, whom Dortmunder does not really trust, tries to pull Dortmunder into a robbery scheme.  Dortmunder is not buying, and the results are not what anyone expected."Fugue for Felons" - this is not about Dortmunder, but is about some similar characters who have plans for robbing a bank.  Things don't work out quite like they expected.

Dortmunder is offered a deal by his fence.  A wealthy individual in on extended vacation, and his penthouse apartment is full of expensive artwork.  The trick is getting the artwork out of the apartment without being caught.  Then a second problem comes up which detracts the gang - the OJ (their usual meeting place to lay out their plans) is being taken over by organized crime to use as a bust out business, i.e., running up huge debts on the business' credit, then going out of business and leaving creditors holding the bag.  This becomes two plots that run together to get surprising results.Dortmunder and friends are not going to come out of this with as much as they hoped, but it's a living.  Other people end up with problems they deserve.  Life will go on.  This is a 2005 copyright, and it is worth reading the rest of the series.  while not great literature, It is entertaining light reading.

This is a tooth friendly chewing gum similar to the Chiclets Chiclets Gum (2-Piece per Package), 200-Count Package that I remember from when I was a child.  It is made with Xylitol so that it protects the teeth.  The Xylitol sweetener is a tree sugar that suppresses harmful bacteria.  I personally prefer the spearmint flavor, and this is a good price for chewing gum.  I use two pieces at a time, so a single blister pack gives me six servings.  It improves your breath (getting rid of fish breath, etc.) while it protects your teeth.

This is one of the author's earlier novels (copyright 1969).  The value of money may seem low by today's standards, but the storyline is still good.  It is not great literature, but is good light reading for a rainy day.  Chester Conway has a tip on a horse from one of his fares - in fact it is the only tip he receives from the cheapskate.  But Chester is a gambler.  He bets on credit with his bookie, the horse comes in, and he goes to collect.  Oops - someone was there before him, and his bookie was murdered.  The bookie's wife walks in on the scene, and now Chester is a suspect.The horse was a longshot, and someone owes Chester a chunk of money, so he becomes an unwilling investigator both to clear his name and to  get his money.  Of course there are some people who would prefer not to have Chester nosing around.  And then the bookie's sister shows up to add to the story, and you get introduced to Chester's weekly card game.  Everything will work out, one way or another.

This is my preferred vegetable mix because it leave out potatoes.  It is a mixture of carrots, green beans, lima beans, corn and peas.  I normally microwave vegetables, and this forms a base to which I can add other things of choice (cauliflower florets, broccoli florets, sliced yellow squash, sliced bell peppers, etc.).  I normally season to taste with thyme, creole blend spice (Frontier Blackened Creole Blend, 2.19-Ounce Bottle), garlic pepper, turmeric, etc.  The 14.5 ounce can makes two good sixed vegetable servings.  The vegetables can be served with a helping of fish, chicken, turkey, etc.

It's easy to get along with anyone as long as they live in another state.  In this case Franny and Jim Post have planned a two-week vacation on Mallorca for their family and some friends, all staying in the same house.  What could possibly go wrong?  Well Jim, an editor at a magazine, was caught bonking a young editorial assistant who happened to be the daughter of one of the Board of Directors, and he has been summarily fired.  He and Franny now have a strained relationship that they are trying to conceal from their children.  Their daughter Sylvia has learned the hard way that, in the world of cellphone cameras, what you do at a party tonight can end up on Facebook tomorrow morning.  Their son Bobby is bringing along his live-in girlfriend Carmen - Bobby has a problem he has not told his parents about..  Franny has invited her longtime friend Charles - an artist she used to pose for (how many children have seen nude paintings of their mother) - and Charles is bringing along his husband Lawrence.Needless to say a few other people enter into the plot.  There is that college age son of a neighbor on the island who has been hired, at the recommendation of the house's owner, to tutor Sylvia in Spanish.  And Franny has discovered a distinguished looking older tennis instructor - someone she had seen in tennis matches years earlier.  Of course there are those two men in leather jackets whom they had seen on the airplane coming into Mallorca - a couple of bikers who are having a vacation riding the roads on the island.For better or worse, things work out as they work out.  Life will not be the same again.  As a warning, you will not like this novel unless you have liberal attitudes.  For the rest of us, it is enjoyable light reading.

There was a shift in feelings in this book in my opinion. Not that you don't think Belle will love the alpha, but rather her feelings change from being attracted to him and tolerating her situation to one of complete acceptance. It wasn't unexpected, but it felt sudden. Actually everything about the entire five book plot is sudden. I liked that because I wanted a story that I could actually put down while taking care of my kids but left ,e feeling satisfied with my knowledge of what was going on. This book delivered that. You get the final installment of the conspiracy in this book and get to experience what Belle is willing to go through for her husband. I thoroughly enjoyed it. I don't want to give too much away of the plot because this really is the summation of everything. This series is available as a single book. Seeing that I had to have the next one as soon as I finished reading the previous one, I think the complete series is a must have before you even start reading it.

In an extreme twist, Belle is broken out of prison by Grey's Beta who was standing guard. The problem is that he broke her out in order to kidnap her and take her to someone that wants her dead. In book one, Belle kills a starving werewolf in her own self-defense. It's a pretty amazing feat for a human to kill a werewolf which is what earned her Grey's respect and marriage proposal. Well now Belle has been turned over to another werewolf pack to serve a different murder sentence. Grey's beta felt that it was right to turn her over to the other pack to serve justice for losing one of their own. There's a lot more conspiracy to it and you will learn a little about the rival pack in the process. What amazes me is that we learn how much of a survivor Belle is. One of the lines I liked the best was Grey saying that it is really hard to be the hero when she keeps saving herself. That obviously is not the exact words, but you get the idea. She's a survivor and worthy to be the alpha's mate. The story ends with them discovering a plot that goes into the Shadow Pack's enforcer unit and could endanger everyone.

After reading book one, I had to know what was going to happen next between Belle and Grey, the Shadow Pack alpha. Grey marked Belle as being his before she went to The Choosing so that no other werewolf would dare try to claim her for their bride. It really wasn't something to worry about though since the alpha picks his mate first and he didn't give the other werewolves a chance to even consider Belle. In this book we learn how The Choosing really works and get to experience Belle's first time with a man and also what it is like for a werewolf to attempt to not let his wolfish nature take over during it. Grey proves to be a gentlemanly as he can be, but you are left wondering if Belle will be able to open her heart to him now that they are essentially married. She has a lot to learn about werewolf dynamics and their laws which is proven when she ends up arrested for murder during their honeymoon.

Belle has been arrested for murder, a murder that she knows she didn't commit and Grey feels she couldn't have done either. However, Grey can't speak against his lead enforcer who claims to have evidence to support her claim. Seeing that other enforcers have shown up to take Belle away, Grey allows for her to be imprisoned, but on his terms. Since they are in the midst of their honeymoon, her jail cell is turned into a luxury suite where the two of them will continue to consummate their marriage until Belle is freed. Grey gives us a little more information as to why he can't just drop the charges against her, but we learn from his beta wolves that her accuser has not been deemed unbiased enough to conduct the investigation. Her accuser is a rare female born werewolf who was once Grey's lover. Her jealousy of Belle is more than a little evident.What I really liked was that we get to see Belle start to open up to Grey sexually. Since she was a virgin, she knows nothing about the way of making love, and there's no better time to discover it than with your husband locked in a jail cell. There's really not a lot else to do. During this time, she evens starts to think that maybe this arranged marriage could be a good thing. The story ends with a twist that you will never see coming.

It's been a while since I have written book reviews. I took a sabbatical from them because I was burnt out, but now I am picking it up again. This book is the first one I chose to read. It's part of a five book series and for some reason I already had books 1-3 on my kindle. Each book is pretty short and if you put them all together you would have one book that would probably be around 250 pages. It was an ideal book to start back up with just because my kids haven't been giving me a lot of time to really sit and focus on any reading at all. The shortness made it so I could read the book in less than an hour or keep reading a few pages throughout the day and still feel like I actually got somewhere with the plot by the end of the day.That said, the story is very intriguing. This book gives you all the information you need to understand the dynamic between the Shadow Pack and Bleed City (the first is a werewolf pack and the other an actual town). Every 20 years, the people of the town send their 18 and older first born virgin daughters to be married off to the eligible male werewolves of the pack. This story is about Belle who is not looking forward to going to The Choosing. She was not the first born daughter in her family, but her older twin sister is no longer alive leaving Belle to fill in her footsteps. You learn all about The Choosing and a little about the pack itself in this story. Just when you think the story is in full force though, it ends. So have book two ready to go!

With my first child, we used these cabinet locks that went through the cabinet handles called slide locks. They were only good for the double door cabinets. I had to move everything around in my kitchen so that the single door cabinets didn't contain anything dangerous for my child. Well when we moved into our new house, those locks apparently didn't come with us. I have a second child that gets into everything leaving even the single door cabinets needing to be locked. Not knowing what else to do, I have locks that screw into both the door and cabinet wall. I hated to put screws into my cabinets, but you do what you have to to keep your children safe. Well what if you can put locks on that use 3M sticky tape? Locks that are strong enough for your kids not to pull off the doors or drawers, but still easy for you to use?Introducing Purple Safety. I received these locks in exchange for my honest opinion. These locks use 3M tape on the back that you simply peel off the tape cover, place on your cabinet or drawer, and then line up and stick the other part of the lock in the cabinet. The package comes with a pamphlet of instructions on how to install these locks, but I found the pamphlet to be rather confusing. If you like really extensive instructions, these will be great for you. Otherwise, Purple Safety has created a much easier to understand set of instructions via a video. I found this to be quite helpful and you can find it on their youtube channel under the name of Tomer Rabinovich.I tried to use these locks in a couple of places. I planned to use them on my hutch which has glass doors that I really would prefer my kids not to be able to open so freely. I learned that these locks are meant for a specific kind of door or drawer. The piece that is considered the actual locking mechanism according to the package is about an inch long.You can stick it to cabinet walls or lips, but I would say there needs to be at least half an inch of surface area for it to stick to. Unfortunately, not having it stuck more fully makes it much easier to pull off. I learned this from my hutch. Also, you really cannot use these locks with doors that close flush to their frame. At least it didn't work in my hutch very well. The doors push in flush and the engaging portion of the lock forced the door to either not close or wedged between the door and frame. I'm having trouble explaining this clearly I think, but I took a video to help out with this which you can find on my youtube channel under phaedracamille.So as you can see from the video, there are types of cabinets that these locks will work well with, but I don't consider them universal. You need to do a little research before getting them. Look at your cabinets and drawers to make sure that you have a long enough flat surface for the actual lock. If you have the right type of cabinets and drawers, these locks are great for you!

Butane torch lighters are useful to have in the kitchen, but they have other purposes as well. I recently did a review of Too Hot in the Kitchen, a cookbook, and did a YouTube video on White Chocolate Creme Brulee from this cookbook. Well In the process of making this dish, I tried to use the broiler to caramelize the sugar on top. The instructions say that this is one method to use if you don't own a kitchen torch. At the time I didn't. When I came across this butane torch lighter to review, I decided that I needed to try the creme brulee again.I was given this torch for my honest review. It does not come with fluid in it, for safety reasons. It has a trigger ignition to make it easier to light and a dual safety lock. Though I will tell you that I am unsure what the dual safety lock means. Like most torch lighters, you can lock the bottom where you fill the canister with fluid by simply turning the little wheel (see picture below).There's another spot on the lighter that says lock and I had interpreted that to be the second locking feature, but have since learned that that lock is to keep the torch lit. Once you have the torch lit, you switch use the lock switch to keep it lit. I don't see that really as a safety feature, but a convenience.The manufacturer boasts that you can use this torch on things like Light Welding and Brazing, Plumbing Repairs, Soldering, Jewelry Making, Hobbies & Crafts, Model Making as well as cooking and lighting cigars.We tried out the torch in two ways. My husband loves cigars, so our first use was him lighting a cigar. Since it was the first time we used it, we had a little trouble to get the lighter to start, but once it was lit it worked great. It lit the cigar evenly and quickly.The second way I used it was for Creme Brulee like I mentioned earlier. I took a video of this, so you can watch the torch melt the sugar. I will tell you, I wasn't able to get the golden brown color that most Creme Brulee has. The torch got too hot for me to hold after several minutes of melting the sugar. I don't think I used it wrong, but that is always a possibility. I was able to melt all the sugar, just not to the caramel brown color we are used to. The Creme Brulee tasted great and was better than when I tried to broil it the first time.

I'll be honest, I don't actually do yoga. I have always wanted to though. I signed up to promote Aurorae Yoga's "The Ultimate" Racer Back Tank Top a while ago when I was going to sign up for a yoga class at my YMCA. While waiting to hear back from the company, I found out that the Yoga classes available were at times that were impossible for me due to my son being in half day preschool. There was no way that I could pick him up from preschool and go to the beginners class. I never signed up for the class, though some day I will learn to do yoga. That said, I am still writing a review of this tank top from a non-yoga stand point.First off, I love the material. It is made from 93% Lenzing Modal and 7% Spandex. The high quality Lenzing Modal Fabric is made with an Eco-Friendly, Carbon-Neutral process from 100% rejuvenating Beech Wood Trees. This is my second piece of clothing made from trees and I have to say I like it. It is super stretchy, lightweight and thin. When I originally signed up, I was 10 lbs heavier than I am now, so the size I received really is too big for what I like, but it is still wearable. The material composition makes it so that when you sweat, the shirt dries really quickly without you feeling like the shirt is wet or sticky. You also don't get cold.Below is a picture of why I say it is a little too big for me. The shirt bunches in my armpits and does not cover my sports bra. If I pull it down so that it is its full length, more of my sports bra shows than I would like.I wore the tank top while cleaning my house because I break a sweat vacuuming. I also wore it while chasing my son up and down the street as he practiced riding his bike while I carried my one year old daughter. I tell you what! That was a workout! I ran probably about a mile carrying a 26lbs toddler and physically pushing my son periodically to get him moving on the bike. Not once did I feel uncomfortable in this shirt though. It is super comfortable even if my sports bra was showing for my neighbors. At the time, I was too worried about my kids to care about that.So even though I currently do not do Yoga, I plan to use this tank top for any kind of exercise I currently am getting. I like the way the material breathes and how I don't feel my own sweat. That is great.

I have a 14 month old daughter and another baby on the way. It will be a while before the new one gets solid foods, but I am always looking for ways to get my daughter to eat more variety. She does pretty good, but she won't let me spoon food into her mouth any more and she can't seem to do it for herself either. That means food like applesauce, yogurt, and pudding are not ate by her very often. When I discovered that there's such a thing as a reusable food pouch that kids can slurp food out of, I decided I had to try it.Easy Anywhere makes these pouches. They are dishwasher and freezer safe. They are also BPA-free, PVC-free and phthalate-free. It says specifically on the package and on each pouch that you should NEVER microwave them or boil them. Each pouch has a screw on cap that locks into place so they don't come unscrewed in your bag and so your child won't get it open unless you help them. It will help reduce the mess and make feeding your child a little cleaner as long as your child doesn't spit out the food that is! The bags have a super strong and durable zipper (like Ziploc bags only stronger) that you open to fill the pouch with food and to clean the inside of them (see below).I made pureed sweet potatoes to try in these pouches. My daughter used to love them back when she would let me feed her. Since learning to feed herself, she hasn't had any sweet potatoes so I figured this would be a good treat for her. If you're wondering how I made them, I peeled them and cubed them like a regular potato, boiled them until they were soft, and then pureed them in my Ninja. Using a spoon, I filled the pouches and patiently waited for my daughter to be ready for her next meal. There's a spot on the back of each pouch where I am pretty sure you write what is in the bag. I wrote on one and plan to check to see if the writing washes off when I wash it.When it was time for my daughter to eat, I first fed her myself using the pouch so she would get the idea that food actually comes out of the bag. Sweet Potatoes are a little thick, so it takes a little work to get them out of the pouch. I actually liked this because it meant she didn't squeeze it out all over the place. It worked wonderfully. She ate about 3 ounces out of it, which I thought was pretty good since she hasn't ate pureed foods in months.On the washing front, I put one bag in the dishwasher with all my other dishes. I highly recommend putting them on the top rack. It washed perfectly, except that my writing on what I thought was a label spot didn't come off. I have a way around that, so it isn't like the container is ruined. You can use scotch tape on the spot and write on the scotch tape. Then when you have emptied the pouch, you simply peel off the tape to show that there's something new in the pouch when you fill it again later.Video on YouTube on the channel phaedracamille.

You may or may not know that my daughter has a lot of lung issues. I was recently reminded that we need to be extra careful every time she gets a cold because it can turn into bronchiolitis very easily for her. She had this back in September that resulted in her being hospitalized for two days until she could breathe easily again, but this last cold she had turned into it again. This time I was able to keep her air passageways cleared enough so that we didn't need another trip to the hospital (thanks to the Snotarator for that!). Along with using the Snotarator to suction her nose though, I had to use her inhaler whenever she got wheezy. I took her to the doctor and they checked her with an oximeter. They had to make sure that she wasn't breathing more than 60 times in a minute and that her oxygen level was 93% or higher. Thankfully both were good, but I was under strict instructions to keep track of her breathing. That's easier said than done for a one year old with a chest cold. It seemed like every time I tried to count her breaths she would go into a coughing fit. I thought to myself, "If only I had one of those oximeters to tell me if her oxygen was getting low, then I would know if she really needed her inhaler." Imagine my surprise when I discovered an oximeter to review! It's like a sign from God that I will actually be able to keep my daughter breathing!A little about the GO-410 Finger Pulse Oximeter before I get into how well it worked for us. It is FDA Approved. Measures quickly and accurately pulse rate and SpO2 blood oxygen saturation of arterial hemoglobin levels. The bright color OLED display shows real time Pulse Rate, Plesthymograph of strength of pulse, Pulse Rate, SpO2 level and Battery level. The built-in alarm can be set to High and Low. Battery life of thousands of readings plus automatic power off. It is light and compact, easy to carry around. Accommodates wide range of finger sizes. Not a medical device.This little device is pretty amazing. I showed it to my friends and they both had to try it. Sadly, I had the highest pulse rate of all of us. I have a cold right now that is cause me trouble with my breathing so my heart is working harder than it should. You can see that in the image above. You can set up alarms on it and you can tell it when the alarms need to go off. It defaults the alarms when the oxygen level is higher than 100% and lower than 94%. It will also go off for a pulse rate high of 130 and low of 50. Everything is operated by a single button but it is done by long clicks and short clicks. A long click will get you into the menu and a short click will change which item you are modifying. So the short click will move you from Sp02 Alm Hi to SP02 Alm Lo. You move down the chart and then use a long click when you are on the item you want in order to modify the number which will set off the alarm. There is also a menu to determine if the alarm is on or not. In that menu, you can turn off the beep that it makes when you turn it on, set it to demo mode, or restore it to the original defaults. The defaults are exactly what I need in order to take care of my daughter, so I am perfectly happy leaving it as is. You'll see in my video how well it worked on my daughter and then what I learned after using it on her. She's only one, so her fingers are still small.If you watched the video, you saw that the alarm went off for my daughter. It indicated that her oxygen level was around 80%. That told me that she needed to use her inhaler, but at that level it would have been very obvious that she needed it. She would have been struggling to breathe visibly. The whole reason I wanted this for a review was so I would have a better idea of when she needs her inhaler, so I tried a few things. I found out that if you wiggle your finger or only have it partly over the red light inside, the reading will be inaccurate. Good to know, huh? I tried it on myself and recorded it so you could see what happens when the red light is not completely covered. It is possible to use the pulse oximeter on my daughter. When she holds still it works and when it covers her entire finger. I tried it later off camera and it worked wonderfully. The key in the future is to make sure she holds still as much as possible and to cover her entire finger. I feel very confident that I will be able to use the GO-410 Pulse Oximeter to help me determine when my daughter needs her inhaler. I have to say, it is a great load of stress and worry gone knowing that I have something here at home that will help me to keep her healthy.
Description said it was new, but it was missing a piece, the box was falling apart, and there was a dent in it.

I used to have the 7" one and I loved it. Unfortunately so did my four year old son. He wanted to play with it all the time and it quickly became his tablet. I got his one for Christmas so I can still have a kindle. I actually am loving the smaller screen. I love to read while taking baths, and the smaller one has been easier to hold on to while the screen is still big enough to read. I love it.

For Christmas this year, I received one TopChips kit made by Mastrad. Since just before I conceived my daughter, we have tried to eat healthier. We are on Weight Watchers, which has been amazing for us, and I have done things like make homemade baby food for my daughter in order to get her to eat things like fruits and vegetables (which my son won't do). The biggest change that has happened naturally has been our intolerance for fast food. All the grease in fast food causes major issues with my digestive track now. I don't even use much vegetable oil or olive when cooking our meals thanks to my Green Pan from Ozeri. Well recently even eating things like potato chips have been causing me issues due to the grease they are cooked in, but how do you get crunchy yummy snacks without grease? That is where TopChips comes in.This thing looks too simple to make something like chips honestly, but I have used it a couple of times and so far it continues to make chips that do not bother my stomach. All you have to do is use the slicer to slice your desired fruit or vegetable into thin slices. I have only made red potato chips so far.Now I don't know if you can use a different slicer with this or not. This exact one is rather small, and the blade is not adjustable. It is made to slice your item to the exact thickness that will work with the chip maker. If you try a different slicer, you might not get the best results. Also, you cannot use it on really soft items. It is not recommended for things like tomatoes or bananas. The slices are too thin. So far I love my red potato chips. I have made them twice and even purposely left some out in a bowl over night to see if they would retain their crunch. They did. The only other thing I have not tried is making them and storing them in a container. So far we have have ate them so fast that there hasn't been any need for storing.The pictures above are of the actual thing you use to make the chips. You put the thinly sliced item on this tray (do not overlap) and microwave according to the wattage of your microwave. My only complaint is that I only have one tray. To make one bowl of chips, it takes me thirty minutes to an hour because I have to cook each tray of chips for three minutes. You can use as many as three at a time. I wish my mom had know that when she bought this for me because I need three trays to save me time. I have two little kids and they don't always approve of me standing in the kitchen for any length of time.If you are an all natural eater or just don't like grease, I highly recommend trying out the Mastrad TopChips. I can eat chips now without them bothering my stomach.

FoxMind Games has created something that people who have trouble figuring out how to spend time with their kids or grandkids can use to help them out. Time in a Box is less of a game and more of a time management system and time capsule. At the very beginning of opening the box, you see five things, four packages of cards labeled for the different seasons and a rolled piece of paper.This paper is a pledge that you and your child sign saying that you will try to do two cards a week. You will take the time out of your busy schedule to spend time with your child. Phones turned off or put away. No tablets or gaming systems to distract you.You do what is on the card with your child. Each card has a place for you to date it and right some comments about how the event went for the two of you. What I like about the comments section is that as an adult you can keep track of the things that worked well with your child or didn't work at all. You can avoid doing the things that caused you or your child strife simply by taking notes about your activities. Below are all winter activities that we have done.Each card, as mentioned before, is labeled for a different season. Obviously there are things you can do during the summer that you cannot do during the winter. There are items that overlap and depending on where you live, you might even be able to do everything year round. We live in Ohio. We definitely will not be having a water fight in the middle of winter.I'm a stay at home mom, so I actually do something with my son every day even though I am still taking care of the house and his baby sister. I try really hard to take one of her nap times to do something with him. We are using Time in a Box to help come up with things to do from time to time, but not all the time. My first thought when I opened this was that it would be PERFECT for a grandparent. It's easy to not know what to do with a grandchild because of the generation gap. We have always tried to make sure the kids see their grandparents once a week (yes both sides). It is difficult on me, but at least they really know each other. I am thinking of taking the box with him when he visits and that way both sides of the family can have suggestions on activities they an do together to really spend time with each other. It's a great opportunity for everyone.

In this story, Leigh is super excited that Hunter will be finishing his police academy training. However, she also has the unfortunate task of trying to fix some of her mistakes in the past. Her best friends have written a book of their own and Leigh has decided that she will help them to get the guys they obviously idolize. She casts a little spell on their boyfriends to turn them into sexy cowboys...Unfortunately the spell doesn't go as planned, as usual. On top of that, Gertie, her witchy friend and mentor, goes missing. Now she is tasked with undoing her magic on her best friend's boyfriends, finding Gertie, and finishing her own books.It's a funny story with a lot of twists to it. I get a kick out of how everything Leigh does seems to backfire on her. Her words get so twisted that it makes me wonder why any witch with the writing power would ever write anything on the magical writing desk. Though it does seem that even things she writes not at the desk and just sets on it actually turn into magic spells as well. It's a romantic comedy to me. Very entertaining.

Just the other day, I was standing at my son's bus stop waiting for him to get home. It was 12 degrees outside and I was freezing. I also was standing there for 20 minutes because the bus was running late. I always have my phone with me so I started to play a game while I waited, but the temperature was so cold that my fingers froze. Did you know that it is possible for your fingers to get so cold that the touchscreen won't register that you are touching it? Yeah that happened to me. I posted on Facebook that day that I needed gloves with just an exposed fingertip so I could play on my phone and keep my hands warm. Well even that wouldn't have solved my issue with my fingertip getting too cold to use my phone. What does someone like me need then? A pair of gloves that somehow work on touchscreens and still keeps my hands AND fingertips warm.IGotTech has exactly what I need! I jumped on this opportunity so fast because The EXACT answer to my problem actually existed. They are black gloves (which go with everything) and have grey fingertips on the fingers that can be used on your touchscreens. They are made out of very high quality material and fit snug on my hands. Very easy to use. They do keep my hands warm just like any other gloves. I have always found that no pair of gloves keep my hands perfectly warm, but these work as good as normal non-texting gloves. The only issue that I foresee is that they fit my hands great which means they probably would be too tight on larger hands. I haven't tested that yet, but I plan to get a pair for my husband very soon. He's been out of town and hasn't been able to try my gloves, but honestly I don't really want him to because I am afraid he will stretch them and they won't fit my hands as well. I'm selfishly keeping them all to myself.I have used them out in the cold. I think it was 22 degrees the last time I used them outside. They still worked perfectly. I am more than happy. If I had known bout these gloves before Christmas, I would have bought them for everyone I know. I am going to refer everyone to them. Seriously, cellphone stores and technology stores like Best Buy need to carry these all winter long. Everyone needs them!

Easy@Home Ovulation and Pregnancy tests have been designed to make testing for your ovulation and pregnancy easier at home. While they were made for women who are "trying to conceive", they can also be used for women who are avoiding getting pregnant as well. The ovulation tests allow you to predict your most fertile days even if your cycle lengths vary. If you're like me, you have no idea when you ovulate because my cycles are very erratic these days. Having ovulation tests allow me to identify if I am ovulating when I think I am. Having these easy pregnancy tests help me to identify if I messed up when predicting my ovulations.Easy to test : simply dip the test in urine for 3 seconds; Easy to read: two lines means pregnant and one line means not pregnant ;Levels of hCG as low as 25 mIU/ml ( FDA standard) can be detected within 3 to 5 minutes. Results are over 99.8% accurate;100% customer satisfaction guaranteed : experienced and professional customer service are available for any questions coming up. Refund or return are acceptable by brand owner,who is dedicated to be the best home use tests provider.When I received this product, I immediately tried out one pregnancy test and one ovulation test. This is was my basis to compare later on because I knew I wasn't ovulating and I wasn't supposed to start my period yet. Both tests should have been negative and given me a good comparison of what the positive test strips would look like. Now I realize that the pregnancy test strip looks like it might be positive, but it wasn't. The little piece of paper at the end curled up a little and you are seeing the underside of that paper. I did indeed start my period a few days later, so that was not a positive result.I use an app on my phone to help me predict my cycles and ovulation. This really was a great month for me to try out this kit because my cycles have been so messed up that the app had me ovulating only four days after I finished my cycle. While this isn't impossible, I didn't really believe that was accurate. I immediately started using the ovulation strips in order to verify that the app was correct. I have discovered that it was very much incorrect. Thankfully, the ovulation test strips have shown me when I did ovulate so my husband and I could be more careful. My daughter just turned one, so we aren't ready to try again just yet. Something I did learn about ovulation testing though is that from the time you finish your cycle, your body starts producing the hormone for ovulation. So the strips came back a very very lite positive for several days before finally giving me something I felt was definite "You're ovulating" answer. So if you don't want to go through more than necessary, start using the tests closer to when you think you are ovulating. If you really want to be 100% positive of that day though, use as many as necessary.Now I won't be able to show you for this review that I am not pregnant at the end of this cycle due to time restraints for finishing the review. However, as of right now, I know I am not just because the tests have given us the information needed to take other precautions.I highly recommend using something like this to help you to either conceive or avoid it. It makes life easier and takes a load of stress off of you. I know from personal experience that stress can cause you to not conceive. I experienced that for a couple of months. Just for reading this review, you can get 15% off an order of Easy@Home branded pregnancy and ovulation tests at this link: http://healthcare-manager.com/collections/ovulation-tests. This is only good to the end of January though. So order fast. This will last you a few months and you won't regret it.

I have been drinking Insta Lite Weight Loss Tea for just under two weeks now. I was sent enough to have two cups a day for two weeks, but some days I just don't get to have both cups. The good part about that is that me not drinking two cups means that I wasn't snacking that day. The idea behind this tea is that you drink it between meals instead of snacking. So while I cannot really say if it suppressed my appetite a lot, I can say that using it as a replacement for snack works great. I started off weighing 182lbs and after almost two weeks, I am at 180lbs. With the holiday season, you expect to gain weight from all the cookies and candies and otherwise unhealthy food you tend to eat. I have not changed what I eat at all. The only thing I changed was that I tried to just have a cup of Insta Lite Weight Loss Tea in between meals instead of grabbing a snack. Now, I am a realist. I am sure that it is just water weight that I have lost, but losing 1lbs a week is the healthy way to lose weight, so maybe it's the real deal. Obviously, losing weight this slowly would take a long time to get anything significant enough to see. That is always the problem with reviewing weight loss supplements, you never get enough to see the long lasting effects so I can't vouch for it helping you lose the amount that they show in their pictures (See below).I like the way it tastes.
