I was provided a sample for review purposes.  With that being said, I like this scale but it is not perfect for me...let me explain.In my opinion, this is a scale designed for women.  It is a nice scale, the auto identify users work well, women will love a pink scale (I got the white one) and if you are ok with the BMI system than that is great.  I really like the tempered glass top and the beautiful display as well.  This review will not get into a BMI discussion - it is what it is and the scale uses it.  It is a nice scale, there is no doubt about it and it is accurate as well.Now, here is why it isn't perfect for me.  I am a big guy and have size 13 feet and my feet hang over this scale.  If I had smaller feet or was a woman it would be fine.  I just don't like my big feet hanging off of this scale.  If you have smaller feet or want a smaller scale than this is for you.My only other comment is that I wish Surpahs did the bottom corners like they did on another scale that I have reviewed for them.  They were completely covered, thus water and dirt could not get inside the scale and it wouldn't get caught in between the tiles on the floor.

I was provided a sample for review purposes.  With that being said, here is what I think about the cable.I have been testing this cable out for a few weeks now and really like it, scratch that, love it and not just because I got it for free either.  It is sturdy, the connectors are reinforced and you can just tell that it is a quality cord by the way it feels.By being Apple certified, you can rest assured that it will work with all of your products.  I actually am using this cord to replace my original Apple charging cord on my laptop at work.  My original Apple cord has worn through the outer sheath just below the connection point from all of the connecting and disconnecting - that is the weak point of the cables that come with Apple products.  This cable fixes this design flaw (in my opinion) by its reinforcement of this key stress area.I also like the length because sometimes you need a 6' cord.  My only comment for iClever is to offer this same cord in a 3' length.  They have a great design going but they are missing out on that segment of the market.Take a look at what other reviewers are saying but this is a great cable.  It is worth the extra money and I would recommend this item to my friends.  This is actually a very easy review for me to write.  Just make sure you will be ok with the 6' length before ordering and you will be ok.

I got a 30 oz. rambler for Christmas and have been testing it out over the last few days. I have a 22 oz. stainless steel Hydroflask and like that equally as well. But, they are different designs. Both are vacuum insulated but the Yeti keeps ice cooler for longer which is amazing considering the Hydroflask is fully vacuumed sealed and gasketed. The reason for 4 stars is because of the design of the top lid.I think Yeti could have made a screw on lid that is vacuum insulated but has a rubber plug that goes into the mouth port with no opening for the air port. I knocked this cup over on the rug the first day I got it and didn't notice it at first - needless to say the rug was all wet. I would like to see different types of tops for this cup so I can purchase them separately, they all will be interchangeable, and if I want to fill it with soup and seal it in my backpack then I can. The cup is huge, ice fits in easily, the plastic lid has a nice seal and it fits in my car cup holder perfectly.I would also like to see the cup and the lid dishwasher safe so I could just throw it in. I would give 4.5 stars if I could...almost perfect. I know I am being picky but maybe it is something the folks at Yeti will give some thought to for further revisions of this product. Also, without the mouth and air ports the fluids will stay cooler or hotter longer.I can tell I will get many years of great service out of this cup but will be careful when I choose between my Hydroflask and Yeti Rambler as my function changes.

First off, I want to let everyone know that I did receive a sample for reviewing purposes.  Now, with that being said, I don't think it is the perfect case but it is a very good case.Having had an Otterbox Defender case for my iPhone 5 and a Commuter Series case for my iPhone 6, I will admit that I was a little bit intrigued when offered this opportunity to review this case.  Anker does make great products and they back them with an 18 month warranty.  Just search for Anker on Amazon and a couple quick checks will let you know that this manufacturer is putting out high quality products that most everyone likes.Now for the case, at first I didn't like the way the rubber felt around the case.  However, after having consulted with the manufacturer, they injected polycarbonate into the rubber for greater impact resistance.  When you take the case apart, this is evident because the outer rubber case has some rigidity.  This is what you want, I wanted a soft silicone based rubber but the impact resistant rubber actually provides better protection for my iPhone.The next thing I noticed about this phone is how well the plastic part snapped around my iPhone.  The bottom of the plastic case is actually rounded to go along with the curvature of the iPhone.  This really snaps this baby tight in place and there is no wiggling.  There also isn't any room for dirt and debris to get in under the screen protector.  The screen protector is meticulously cut.  The holes are exactly where they should be, Anker took great pains to get their tolerances correct here and it is evident in their product.  All of the holes on my sample aligned perfectly.The next thing I noticed is how well the plastic inner case snapped into the outer shell.  The case fits in there just right.  Not too tight that you can't get it out and not to loose so it falls out.  I have used it for a week or so now, carrying it around in my work bag and no dirt has managed to get in.  Junk always used to get into my Otterbox Defender case, I am not going to have that problem with this case.  There is a little lip on the outside of the inner plastic case and the outer edge catches nicely on this.Here is the part I relaly like.  The speaker and microphone cut outs at the bottom.  Anker has done it just right.  The holes are precisely cut for only the openings.  The headphone jack and the lightning port don't just have a cover but they have pieces of rubber which go into those ports to further protect them.  I like this for the headphone port, because I don't use it a lot but don't think I like it for the lightning port.  You have to push the tab down kindof funky to jam the rubber nub back into the port.  I like this better on my old case because I just had to snap it up.  I am thinking about modifying my case by just cutting of this rubber nub out.  You have the option to do that, which is a nice option to have.Now, for the part I don't like.  I didn't like the back case.  I asked Anker why the back was depressed in and they told me so the phone wouldn't slip around.  At first, I thought this was to hold change in my car.  I could see how this would help the phone from slipping but I just don't like the looks or the design of this.  Hence, the 4 star rating and that is my honest opinion.  I think if it was just a straight flat gray back I would have given it 5 stars.  I think Anker could have done a lot of other things with the back of this phone to make it more attractive.  While I don't love the back, it gets the job done and covers the phone.I also want to point out that this case is extremely thin.  One of the reasons I switched from the Defender series to the Commuter series was because of how bulky the Defender series is.  Anker crushes Otterbox here, their case has the impact resistance and protection but does so in a very slim frame.  So you get the best of both worlds, the protection and the sleek case.I would also like to see Anker make this case in a couple different colors, at a minimum one to complement the space gray iPhone and one to complement the white iPhone.Again, I was provided a sample for review purposes but this is my honest take on this case.  If they fix the back panel they will have a 5 star case.  I would also ask them to considering trying to inject a little less polycarbonate and to try it with silicone so the outer rubber case feels a little softer in your hand.  It is a very nice case and I do have my iPhone in this case right now and my Commuter series in my dresser drawer collecting dust.

7:00 MinsAnker's 2nd Gen Astro E5 16000 mAh external battery is a power house.  Match it with Anker's PowerIQ Technology and you have a super fast, adaptive charger.  I like the form factor of this external battery because I could hold it easily in my hand.  It is a little on the heavier side but for it's charging capacity this is inline with comparable models of similar capacities.  The PowerIQ Technology is a really nice feature that Anker has put into all of it's devices.  I plugged in a Kindle, iPad 2, iPad Mini, iPhone and all of these charged as fast as they did with their original chargers.  I also don't have to worry about overcharging or undercharging any of these devices because of all of the safeguards that Anker puts into place.  Their units have voltage regulators, short-circuit and overcharging protection built-in.  There is a reason why Anker is one of the best selling brands out there.  The new E5 takes on the same shape as their smaller E4 and they use premium LG cell batteries for lots and lots of charges over the life of the charger.There is also a small LED on the battery pack for getting around at night.  Because the device is so big, I would like to see Anker put two more PowerIQ ports on the other end.  This way you could load it up with even more devices at the same time.  I also would like to see an AC adapter, so I could plug this into a wall to charge up.  It comes with a micro USB charging connection but that can only go so fast, so recharging this brick takes time.  Other than that, I think they have a pretty solid product on their hands.  They also back it up with an 18 month warranty.I was provided a sample in exchange for my honest review.

4:29 MinsThe Kitchen Frontier Infuser Pitcher is a great way to drink more water while adding a twist at the same time.  The pitcher was packaged very well and is constructed out of shatterproof acrylic that is BPA-free.  I really like the shape of this pitcher because it doesn't take up too much room in my fridge and is very ergonomic to hold and pour. The interior compartment which holds the fruit easily screws in and out of the top lid.The fruit infused water tasted great and is something that I have never had before.  I made tea and then stuck a bunch of cut up lemons in the infusion chamber and the tea tasted great.  Lemon water is another favorite and you can get several pitchers out of the same fruit.This pitcher comes with a lifetime warranty and is a hand wash only item.  My guess is that the dishwasher will either melt the acrylic or will cause the handle to eventually loosen after time since it is glued on - either way, don't put it in the dishwasher and you won't have to worry about these problems.  Future revisions of this product could integrate the handle into the pitcher so it is a true one-piece design.  The handle could be solid acrylic or it could be hollow to hold more water.  I would also like to see this pitcher made out of dishwasher safe materials that are BPA-free, even if it has to be top rack only it is still better than hand washing.I was provided a sample in exchange for a fair and honest review.

5:58 MinsThe Bolse 12-Amp, 7-Port Charging Station with SmartIC Technology is a great little charging block for all of your electronic devices.  As we gathered more and more electronic devices our charging situation got out of control.  I finally ended up going to Target to get a nice little woven basket and we now dump all of our electronics into the basket at night with this charging station.  This is the best looking solution that we have come up with to date.Let me go into a little more about this device.  I have reviewed other wall / desktop USB chargers before but this one offers the most power and ports in a small, compact size.  Plus, with the addition of SmartIC technology, you never have to worry about plugging Apple devices into Apple ports or Droid devices into Android ports.  There are a couple 50 - 60W chargers on Amazon right now but this one is by Bolse, a brand I can recommend based on my experience with all of the products I have from them.There is a small yellow light that indicates that this device is plugged in.  Sometimes when shuffling around devices the cord on the back of this unit gets unplugged.  So whenever you check this device you want to make sure that you see that small yellow light.  This is a marked improvement over there previous version of the product which required specific items to be plugged into specific ports for optimal charging and had a large yellow light.The SmartIC technology is great.  It senses what type of USB device is connected and then will charge it as fast as it can.  Bolse also builds overcurrent, overvoltage, short circuit protection into this little charging block as well.  We charge two kindles, two iPhones, some Garmin watches, and an iPad 2 on it each night and it charges them all right up.  With 12 Amps of charging capacity, that is enough to charge 6 iPads simultaneously so this charging block can handle pretty much anything you could ever throw at it.This is a must have for the power hungry travelling professional or small family with lots of electronic devices.  I was provided a small in exchange for a fair and honest review.

5:17 MinsGreat portable charger that has worked well for me for the last couple of weeks.  First off, the product I received looks different than both products shown here.  I think they were gen 1 and gen 2 and the one in my video must be gen 3.  I will place an e-mail to the manufacturer to confirm and then will update my review.The charger is 5600 mAh which is ideal for charging up cell phones and small tablets.  It will charge an iPad in a pinch, mostly will just keep it running rather than actually charging it.  It charges at 1A, so it isn't a rapid charger (1.5A or 2.1A) but it gets the job done.I like a couple of the features and the way this charger was laid out and designed.  I like how all of the buttons are on one side, this way they don't accidentally get pushed while in your bag.  I like the 4 LED battery meter on the side, it is discreet and is really all you need to do to be able to see where the battery is at in terms of charging/discharging.  I also like how the charger comes with an adaptable USB cord that will accept a 30 pin iPhone/iPod, a micro USB (which is handy to charge the charger with), a mini USB and a pin barrel.  So lots of versatility here in one cord and for the price this is a nice feature for just the cord alone.  The charger also comes with an integrated circuit protector to safely avoid overcharging your devices and short circuits.  One last point to mention, the blue LED light will also turn into a white LED so you can see your way around in the dark.  It isn't terribly bright but it is a nice add on feature that Alaska Bear thought to include.Last but not least, I was provided a sample in exchange for my fair and honest review.  I have tested this product out for several weeks now, so has my wife and we are both happy with it and it's performance.  If there were problems or concerns I wouldn't be recommending it.

9:33 MinsEvery now and then you come across a product that is really well thought out and designed.  This is the case with the Elune from Taotronics.  This light is very versatile and is well constructed.FEATURES-Three dimming levels-Nice gooseneck holds in place, doesn't move-Detachable head with place for a clip / carabiner-USB Charger-Head swivelsThe light is pretty easy to put together.  The gooseneck swivels into the base, you plug the base into the wall and then you just pop the head onto the gooseneck.  The connection to the light reminds me of a large headphone jack for a pair of studio headphones that you would plug into a receiver.  This connection also allows the light to swivel from side-to-side.  So, between this swivel and the gooseneck you get a pretty good range of motion with the light.  Add to this three dimming levels and you can really get just the right amount of light wherever you want it.The fact that the head can easily detach is very versatile.  Because the battery is in the head, you can also easily unplug the light and move it to another table for a little while.  Pop the head off of the light, and it doubles as a flashlight.  Add the carabiner and you can clip it to just about anything.  Need to charge your phone or tablet, just plug it into the base.  This light can do it all...I used this light for a little over a week now and really like it.  If you are in the market for a light, I highly recommend this one for the USB charger and detachable head that are both bonuses.One thing I did not like about this light is the color temperature at 5500 K.  I would like to see a warmer light around 2700 K (much closer to incandescent) for reading at night.  It is a cool white light and not a warm white, just be aware of that.  The other thing that I would like to see is a switch at the bottom of the base.  When I am laying in bed at night it is very hard to get to the switch on top of the light and the fact that it is flush makes it all that much harder.I received this product in exchange for a fair and honest review.

4:31 MinsThe Taotronics Floor Stand will get the job done for you if you are looking for a floor stand for your tablet.  This product is ideal for musicians who use their tablet to read music or if you just want to lay in bed and watch movies on your tablet.  I think with some adjustments it could be a much better product though.The base it pretty heavy, the whole assembly weighs in at almost 12 lbs.  The gooseneck is super heavy duty and the way it interfaces with the tablet holder could be improved as well.  That being said, it did work and it held my tablet.  I like how it is fully adjustable, just be sure to take your tablet out, adjust it, then put your tablet back in.The stand comes with a bolt that screws into the telescoping base.  Also included is a small Allen wrench which I used to tighten the clamp which locks down the telescoping portion of the stand.  This was a relief because this portion was slipping and falling down.  A few turns of the Allen wrench and that problem stopped.  The gooseneck is heavy duty, I think much heavier than it has to be to just support a tablet.  The gooseneck has a base that connects to the back of the tablet holder, you slide the back of the gooseneck in and then slide the tablet holder down to lock it in place.  This is not the best design as it could wobble or become disconnected.  The tablet holder has nice padding on the inside to protect your tablet and can hold a number of different sizes of tablets.I think if they took weight out of the base and gooseneck and improved the connection from the gooseneck to the tablet holder that this would be a 5 star stand.  As is, I do like the product and it has held up for me.  At least with it being so heavy duty you know the tablet will not move or move over time.  I expect this stand and gooseneck to be as sturdy in a year of use as it is today after only a week or so of use.I would suggest Taotronics make this stand sexy.  Go with a longer telescoping pole...make the gooseneck thinner and out of aluminum instead of steel.  Add some functionality like a charger to the base so you can charge your tablet while it is in the stand.  Chances are it is on, playing something and the battery is quickly draining.  I think the clip needs a whole redesign.  The clip should be something that securely fastens in place yet is easy to pop out and adjust so you can switch tablets in and out of it relatively easy.  I think the tablet holder can be made out of a sturdier material as well.  I think a ball and socket joint for the connection between the tablet holder and the gooseneck would be a much better design.I was provide a sample in exchange for a fair and honest review.

2:22 MinsI really like this soap.  When I first rubbed it on my skin the bar was really stiff and did not slide well along my skin.  Once it had some use it was fine.  Just don't expect it to lather up the first time you use it.  For me, it wasn't until the second time that I used it that it lathered up nicely.It left my skin feeling clean, lightly scented and a little dry.  When it comes out of the box it is a rectangular shape.  At first I didn't like this, I was hoping for a curved soap but after some use I liked this shape because you get more product.  I have used this product a few times now and think it is better as a facial soap.  When I applied it to my face, my skin tingled and I could tell that this soap had astringent properties.  Which is ok for me because I have oily hair and am always looking for ways to clean my pores and to cut the oil.  Just be aware if this as it did leave my face feeling deeply cleaned and degreased.  So, for the money, I think this is better off as a facial soap rather than an everyday all around soap.  I will use my normal soap for my body and this soap for my face from now on.Last but not least, the lavender smell really kicks once you lather up in the shower.  It has a very pleasant smell that was something a little different for this guy to experience in the shower.  I would like to see Vitae come out with a line of soap for men, with manly scents.  They could keep the same formulation but just change the scent components.The manufacturer provided me this sample in exchange for a fair and honest review on Amazon.  If you feel like getting a laugh, watch the video and me trying to read all of the ingredients.  It's organic...that's all that matters.  Plus, if you have any doubts, Vitae offers a one year money back warranty on this product.  They know they have a winner on their hands.

5:26 MinsThe Bolse BTS-12 is a very nice looking, nice sounding mobile Bluetooth speaker.  I have been really impressed with the design and quality of a lot of Bolse products and this one is no different.  It comes with a travel case, 3.5mm to 3.5 mm jack, micro USB charger and sounds great.  Bluetooth pairing was very easy and there is an on-off button on the back of the unit.  You can also do conference calling through this speaker as well, which is a nice feature to have and something I always look for in Bluetooth devices.  I like the top touch buttons, I think they are different and will help prevent dirt and grime from getting in there.  I do wish the charger, AUX line in and headphone jack in the back was gasketed to protect against dirt, debris and water.  I would also like to see space for a transflash card.  I have seen this on other units and my friends that go camping really like these cards because it doesn't kill their phone battery streaming Bluetooth.  Just load up the card and go...I would also like to see the speakers tilted slightly upward, this way it is easier to fill the room with sound.This is a very nice unit if you are in the market for a mobile Bluetooth speaker.I was provided a sample in exchange for a fair and honest review.

4:12 MinsArctic's S111 BT mobile speakers are a nice addition to Arctic's impressive line up.  These are mobile speakers, they sound good for their size but are not going to give you room filling sound.  These are best placed next to a computer as ideally they are computer speakers that come in a variety of fun colors.  I wish Arctic would have designed these with longer cords and cords that could be pulled out.  I also wish they would have included removable speaker grilles, if not to protect the speakers than to give it a different aesthetic every now and then.  These speakers come in a variety of colors, sound good for their size and come with a very nicely designed travel case.  Just be careful where you use and place these speakers and you will be ok.  The Bluetooth functionality worked really well and I was happy with the performance that they gave me.I was provided a sample in exchange for a fair and honest review.

6:03 MinsArctic's S111 M mobile speakers are a nice addition to Arctic's impressive line up.  These are mobile speakers, they sound good for their size but are not going to give you room filling sound. I wish Arctic would have designed these with longer cords and cords that could be pulled out. 1:01 MinsThe Alaska Bear money clip is just a no nonsense clip.  It is stainless steel, has an attractive brushed look and simply just works.  It goes to show that you don't need to spend a lot to get a lot.  The lip is just right to pry it open as well and the clip tension is right on the money.  Sorry, I couldn't refuse to get that in there.But seriously, this is a nice clip and will serve you well.  It seems to be just the right size and everything about it is well designed and executed.I was provided a sample in exchange for a fair and honest review on Amazon.

After our water and ice line in our freezer keep getting frozen we looked into getting it repaired and it was $100 just to get someone to come to our door not to mention any parts or repairs that he would do.  That being said, I told my wife that I wanted a faucet filter because the pitcher ones don't hold much water, always have to be refilled before being put back in and take up precious fridge space.  After some research, I found this product.I used it for 3 months and replaced the filter.  There is no indicator so you need to mark on a calendar when to replace it or commit it to memory.  To the filter's credit, when it worked, it worked well and the water tasted good.  I also like how the little pushbutton thing worked so you didn't leave the filter in the on position.  I then bought some more filter replacements on Amazon because you can't find them in a store or I haven't seen any in stores around me.  When I went to unscrew the filter it was basically cemented in place for lack of a better word.  I got 6 months out of this device and now had a three-pack of filters that I couldn't use anymore.  My advice would be to not screw it in so tight but I only did so to make sure it was securely in place.I went to Walmart and got a PUR FM-3700B faucet filter that I love for $25.  It has an indicator, doesn't leak, has a good snap on / snap off mechanism, is easy to change out and I can get a 6 pack of replacement filters from Costco.  Not much more to ask for in my opinion...I can't believe the PUR filter only got 3/5 stars, mine is perfect and this is part of the reason I went with the Culligan product in the first place.Just wanted to share my experience with this product

9:17 MinsI got this speaker, paired it up right away and was literally blown away at how awesome it sounded.  The bass was huge and tight and it was loud, very loud.  The bass was even solid at full volume while playing rap, it really thumped it out on my countertop.  The only thing that I can think that is close to this is the mini jambox but that costs over $100 bucks.  Just get this instead, I promise you won't be disappointed.As far as features go, this speaker is really jammed packed.  It has Bluetooth with Speakerphone, NFC, long playback from a rechargeable lithium ion battery, voice overs for the Bluetooth (voice says "paired", "connected" versus just beeps and colors), comes with 3.5 mm to 3.5 mm connector as well as a really nice illustrated manual.I wish this speaker came with a little padded nylon carrying case with some storage areas to stash the charging cable as well as the 3.5mm jack.  That is really my only wish list item for this speaker.By far the best feature about this speaker is the sound, particularly the bass which just cleanly rumbles at very high volumes.  I also wish there was some sort of a removable stand so that this speaker could be tilted 15-30 degrees so that it would not shoot straight out but rather fill the area a little better.  Another suggestion would be to add a little remote control, I know most people will have their phone handy but some people will not and may want a little credit card sized remote control.There are other types of Bluetooth speakers like this on the market but the Bolse one is the best that I have found.  I really cannot say enough good things about this product - I love it.I was provided a sample in exchange for a fair and honest review.  Seriously, get this if you are in the market for one of these.  They sound so much better than the mono Bluetooth speakers that just shoot straight up into the air.

7:01 MinsI like this product from Satechi but I think some of the features will not be used very much.  I keep it in my glove box and for what it is intended to do it does a great job.  The trickiest part about this flashlight was figuring out how to get the rechargeable lithium ion battery in and I demonstrate this in my video.  I was given a head's up from the manufacturer but when I went to test out this product did not have my phone or computer near me.Let's get into the PROS and CONS...PROS-Solid, rugged construction, fully gasketed seals-LED is bright, has different illumination levels, SOS and Strobe settings-Large rechargeable Lithium Ion battery-USB power bank charger-Translucent globe-Wrist strap-Very nice magnetic storage kit - the box doubles as a great way to store this in your glove boxCONS-Not waterproof as advertised, water resistant to some degree but has an exposed USB charging port in the back-Translucent globe feels as if it would shatter if you drop the flashlight with it on it on the road-Glassbreaking tool will not be used very much, even if it was an emergency, the flashlight is solid enough that you could just punch through a window with that-Can't focus light at the head end like you can with a Maglite - this is so the translucent globe can screw-in.-No seal for the USB charger for water resistance - you will have to put the glassbreaking tool on to protect itThis is a very nice flashlight for emergency use or for even general use.  I was amazed at how bright the LED actually was when I turned it on.  I keep this in my glove compartment but have used it camping and it has done really well for me.  This being an emergency flashlight I feel like it needs to come with a little survival pack  as well.  Maybe take a small compartment in the flashlight and put in some waterproof matches, tweezers, a little blade.  I think if Satechi took this design and tweaked it with a swiss army flavor than you would have a great product for a lot of campers and Boy Scouts out there.  This is just a suggestion but the rest of it is already there.I was provided a sample in exchange for a fair and honest review.

4:11 MinsThe TT-BS004 scanner is a great scanner for everyday use.  I hooked it up to my laptop running Windows 7 and it worked right out of the box.  I like the dual trigger that comes with the unit because it allows you to scan more comfortably.  It sits comfortably as shown in the picture.  The material is plastic and it makes an audible beep when you scan items in.  One thing you will want to do is to make a copy of the user manual or download a copy from the manufacturer's website.  The instruction manual shows you how to switch modes but more importantly it includes a bunch of codes to switch functions on the scanner...so you lose the manual you lose a lot functionality with the scanner.I scanned a bunch of items from all around my kitchen cabinets.  I scanned a bunch of different bar code shapes and sizes and this scanner picked them all up.  I had a Word document open and every time I moved an item in front of the scanner it would light up, beep and then output the bar code digits.My wife is a librarian and she used it at her work to scan in and out books and said it worked fine for that as well.I was provided a sample for review in exchange for a review.

This 5-piece silicone kitchen utensil set is a solid performer.  I really wanted to give this product 5 stars but with some minor tweaks I think we can get there.  Ok, so the product isn't perfect but it is pretty darn good and will get the job done.  Here are my thoughts on each element:Small SpatulaShaft goes too far down into the bottom and needs to be longer at the top.  The tip of the spatula is very stiff and the top by the hole is to flimsy.  If this gets redesigned and tweaked then I would give 5 stars.Large SpatulaTop shaft is good, wish bottom of the shaft was a little shorter so the spatula was more flexible.  I think about using this with cake batter or brownie mix and the tip of that spatula needs to be flexible and firm. I think this one is a little to firm and this is due to the length of the shaft into the bottom end.Slotted TurnerVery nice, don't change a thing.BasterVery nice, don't change a thingWhiskMaybe make the handle out of silicone?  Why not have this be one piece.  Perhaps construction is easier this way.  The hook at the top is a little big, suggest cutting it in half.  Also suggest opening up the bulb of the whisk a little more.  Did fine when I whipped up some eggs for scrambling.Pros-Soft feel-Solid one piece construction-Benefits of silicone constructionCons-Little spatula handle could be stiffer-No different colors offered-Spatulas are a little stiff-Little spatula shaft is not long enough at the topI have cooked with these for a few weeks now and really like them.  They wash well in the dishwasher and overall have a very nice design.  I like the feel of silicone, the bright colors and the fact that I no longer have to worry about the spatula head ever falling off of the shaft again and into my cake batter.  All utensils perform well but my only gripe is with the little spatula and this can easily be tweaked for the next go round.I was provided a sample in exchange for a fair and honest review.  This is a nice set, look at the other user comments, StarPack has done a nice job.

3:51 MinsThe F80 is the quintessential device missing from your life.  A couple of things stand out about this flash drive which set it apart from others.  First, it is the perfect blend of form and function.  I keep mine on my keychain and always have it with me now.  The device is water, shock, dust and vibrationproof - that is super impressive and it doesn't even have a cap.  I have had mine for over a month now in my bag and pockets and it still works great.  I really like the way it looks and when I plug it into my Windows 7 laptop it works fine.If you need any more convincing, just look at the reviews, wow...I like the circular loop, thin diameter and the fact that there are no cracks in the loop - it is one piece construction.  If you are in the market for a flash drive then the F80 is a great choice.The only con is that it is USB 2.0 - hopefully this will be fixed the next time the company updates the product.I was provided a sample in exchange for a fair and honest review.

3:42 MinsThis hard drive ranks among one of the best that I have tested.  I got transfer speeds better then Western Digital and Seagate drives at 114 MB/s.  Where this hard drive really stands apart from the rest is with the shockproof design and being built to military specifications.  This is a feature that is sorely missing from the competition because like many folks, I am on the go and want to throw this device in my bag and not have to worry about it.PROS*Shockproof, built to military specifications, rugged*Compact*Intelligent shockproof corners double to store connection cable*USB 3.0 - Lightning fast transfers, reads at 114 MB/s, writes at 100 MB/s in my benchmarking tests*Worked seamlessly with Windows 7.  I simply plugged it in, prayed and it worked.  I was like a miracle unfolded right before my eyes.*1 TB is 1,000,000,000, 000 bytes (1,000 MB) but shows up as 930 MB in Windows 7.  This is because size is based off of the decimal system whereas Windows uses the hexadecimal system.  Just keep this in mind if you are trying to back up 930+ megs in Windows - don't want you to be shortThis is a great product, I have been using it for several weeks and can't rave enough about it.  I mean, look at the other Amazon reviews - folks love this product.I was provided a sample in exchange for a fair and honest review on Amazon.CONS*Not really a con, but I wish the USB port was gasketed to keep sand and dirt from getting into the port
