The price is good and the bags do their job OK, but using the bags is very inconvenient and messy because they are not rolled on a cardboard tube but folded together and hard to separate; they are not like kleenex in a box where pulling one out will set up another one to be pulled. At one point I had to pull the entire clump of bags out of its box and then slide each single bag loose in order to access them, which led to lots of bags floating around loose in the drawer.

I bought this tool to cut away a small portion of tile countertop at the back of my stove so I could install a new stove that must be flush with the wall. Because the space was very cramped and did not have room to use my big and powerful Sawzall, a powered hand tool was the only feasible solution, so I purchased this item from Amazon.The tool feels heavy and solid and makes a very loud noise while in operation; the cutting blade feels a bit flimsy. The tool comes with a selection of sanding and cutting attachments; I used what looked like a spatula with a saw edge to cut through several pieces of wood that had to be removed. This process went quickly and effectively as far as the plywood substrate and backer board were concerned. However, I did not think the tool and blade could possibly stand up to cutting through the tile on top of the counter so I removed several pieces of tile the old-fashioned way, by chiseling out the grout and prying out the tile. Once the tile was gone the Pit Bull made the wood cutting part of the task a quick and simple matter. (I might have been able to use the Pit Bull to cut away the grout from around the sides of the tile, but the grout was extremely heavy and took lots of blows with hammer and chisel to remove it, so I did not want to risk breaking or dulling my only saw-edged blade.)The cutting, sanding and other attachments were easy to attach and remove with the included wrench.My main concern is that the construction of the Pit Bull tool seems a bit on the rough side, nothing like a precision piece of equipment, which makes me wonder how long it will last. Also included in the box was a set of motor brushes, which made me wonder if the brushes are likely to wear out. If I were a handyman or other worker who would give it fairly heavy use every day, I might have considered paying up for a brand-name tool that costs twice as much. On the other hand, I don't anticipate that I will need to use it very often, so I am awarding four stars. The other concern was with the attachments:  I am not sure I will be able to find other or replacement attachments in my local big box stores, and the saw-edged blade I used for cutting the plywood seemed to flex a little more while cutting than it should have. I had visions of the blade snapping in mid-use, though this did not occur.Bottom line:  Low price compared to similar brand-name tools, got the job done and was delivered on schedule for a time-sensitive project. It feels as if it might not stand up to heavy daily use over an extended period of time, but it was sufficient for my purposes.

Bottom line:  Several quality components in one box, major reduction in connecting wires, moderate cost, very good sound and video quality, whats not to like? I would buy this unit again if I needed another sound base and would recommend it to friends and family. Philips has pulled off a major technical feat by combining a sound system, 3D Blu Ray player, BlueTooth, several streaming channels and FM radio in a single box. Too good to be true, you ask? Well, read on.Warning:  I usually write thorough reviews, and this one has to be extra-long because it must cover a multitude of components and capabilities.I purchased the Philips HTB3525B Surround Base to support, and provide audio and video for, a 32 (diagonal) TV on a countertop in my 13x15 den, where a 5.1/7.1 surround system or even a typical sound bar simply wont fit.Many years ago I was an audiophile, with lots speakers and amps and preamps and receivers and all that good stuff, but in recent years I have found it necessary for space reasons to install 4 different sound-bar-with-subwoofer setups in three different homes and discovered that they were entirely satisfactory, if not as dazzling and immersive as 5.1/7.1 systems. Also, I find that in a smaller space like a den or bedroom it is desirable to eliminate most of the wires and equipment by using a good-quality sound bar or, in this situation, a sound base.I read the specs for, and listened to a wide variety of, sound base systems, narrowing my search to units with good audio quality and moderate price that could fit in a bookcase opening 30  inches wide. (Yes, there are some sound bases that are wider than 30  inches.)This Philips unit rose to the top of my list because it contains so many components in one box, the technical specs are impressive and the online reviews are generally positive. Finally, the price is surprisingly low given the number of included components, so I ordered one from Amazon. Here are my observations after more than two weeks of testing the unit.ProsMulti-Purpose:  Having all of the equipment and capabilities (3D Blu Ray, BlueTooth, FM radio, Dolby sound, HDMI) all in one unit, and eliminating all but one or two connecting wires, is wonderfully convenient and greatly reduces clutter. Sometimes all-in-one systems have one or two weak components, but I found all of this units functions to be of high quality.Sound and Video Quality:  I have two other Sony 3D Blu Ray players, and audio/video from this units BR is comparable to that from the Sonys. This Blu Ray does an excellent job with both video and music, and while it might be possible to get somewhat better images and sound out of a free-standing, top-end BR player, I am not sure I would be able to tell the difference. When playing BRs, DVDs and CDs and watching cable TV on this unit I have heard and seen details that I never noticed before, so I think its sound/video capability is definitely higher than average. (Of course, the final quality of video and music depends in large part on the source; for example, a Blu Ray movie will virtually always have better video and sound quality than the same movie on a DVD, and cable sources vary substantially in quality.)This unit contains sophisticated electronics normally available only on more expensive systems (go online and Google Philips Surround Base manual to see 2 pages of technical details). The HDMI connection to the TV is as simple as it gets.There is a large selection of audio presets that allow maximizing sound quality. If one of these doesnt meet your needs there is also an option to vary those settings and to create a custom audio setting that controls treble, mid and bass levels independently of each other. Finding a sound base that allows the user to control all 3 of these levels separately is unusual and highly desirable.Sound Volume and Field:  In my 13x15 den the units higher volume settings can be overwhelmingly loud. As an experiment I also used the unit to play CDs and BlueTooth selections in my much larger family room, where the high-quality sound easily filled the room. I know, it is not true surround sound like 5.1 or 7.1, but the units surround setting opens the sound field perceptibly and the stereo setting does provide noticeable stereo separation. The volume setting goes up to 45, but 20 is enough for me most of the time, anything over 30 is too much, and at 40 the sound begins to become distorted. For those who play BRs, DVDs, CDs and cable TV at low volumes there is a preset that gives added clarity to dialogue and singing voices, a helpful  option for folks with hearing issues or those who want to watch/listen at night without annoying those who are trying to sleep. There is also an earphone jack so you can turn the volume as high as you want and destroy your hearing without disturbing family and neighbors.BlueTooth:  The BT function, with its option of using NFC, works easily and well.Streaming:  The short list of built-in streaming services includes Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, Pandora and a couple more but, OMG, no Amazon Prime! However, if you want you can always add more services via a relatively inexpensive Roku or similar device; and if you happen to have a smart TV you already have lots of streaming services available.FM Radio:  With the on-board availability of BlueTooth and Pandora it is hard to get excited about the included FM radio. However, if you want or need an FM tuner this unit will do the job. For homes or areas where FM reception is weak it can be improved by plugging the included short antenna into the appropriate slot on the back of the unit. Another trick for improving FM sound quality in an area of poor reception is to switch the FM from stereo to mono, which reduces static and hiss (at the cost of losing stereo separation).Remote:  The remote is well designed and highly functional, allowing the user to make all sorts of modifications to the listening/viewing experience, particularly in the treble/mid/bass. For those who dont like to tinker with settings, the many factory presets offer varied choices right out of the box and are easily implemented by the remote. Backlighting would have been nice, but its absence is a minor annoyance, not a deal-breaker.Looks:  The unit is very attractive. Sitting on a shelf by itself it seems at first almost too wide and ungainly, but it immediately takes on an unobtrusive and proportional look when the TV is placed on top of it.Capacity:  According to stickers on the product, this sound base can support up to 55 TVs or up to 48.5 lbs of weight. Some smaller TVs and of course larger TVs can weigh even more, so be sure to double-check the supporting capacity of any sound base you are considering and confirm the manufacturers stated weight of the TV you want your sound base to support. The size and configuration of the TV stand are critical, too, because some TV stands may be too big or oddly shaped to fit on top of the sound base. If your TV is too big or heavy to be supported by this unit, you can always put the sound base on a shelf just below the TV.Cost:  Amazons price for this unit is a bargain, especially when compared with buying all of the included functions as separate stand-alone units, and is a bit lower than other mid-range sound bases. Based on my research on higher-end sound bases you would have to pay at least $450 and up to $700 to get any incremental improvement, and the more expensive sound bases would likely lack Blu Ray and FM.ConsThis unit has so many benefits and positive attributes that it takes some effort to identify any issues that are significant in my situation.Despite Philips calling this unit a Surround Base, forget about getting true surround sound from this or any other sound base or sound bar. However, if you are shopping in this niche you already know and accept that sound bars and sound bases just cant provide the same immersive experience as a 5.1/7.1 system.The bass from the small, down-firing subwoofer on the bottom of the unit is good but not gut-punching, so for those who want the ultimate, window-shaking bass experience it would be nice if this unit had provided, or allowed connecting, a wireless subwoofer. However, in my den and even in my much larger family room I found that the bass from this unit was enough to handle typical crash/boom/bang movie scenes as well as the lower-register nuances of classical music and jazz. Higher frequency sounds and music are clear and crisp.After playing more than a dozen Blu Ray discs, DVDs and CDs and TV programs over a period of many days, I have noticed only one other issue:  the units sound field is narrower and shallower than that of my Sharp HT-SB60 sound bar, and the stereo separation is less because my Sharp bar is 54.5 wide versus the 27.5 width of this Philips sound base. However, this is a secondary AV installation, my den and TV are so small that  large stereo separation is not necessary, and there is simply no room for a sound bar anyway, so for me this is a non-issue.Thank You Amazon Prime:  Should problems arise during the initial period of product use, dealing with Amazon as opposed to the manufacturer or a vendor other than Amazon is usually a great advantage. These days I find that I buy almost everything except groceries and gasoline from Amazon because its selection, customer service, return policy and delivery are outstanding.Disclaimer:  I have no personal or business relationship with Amazon nor the manufacturer of this product and I paid for it with my own funds.

Bottom line:  This versatile vest has lots of pockets and lots of potential. However, I had to return it because after several days of trying to close the front zipper it consistently jammed when I attempted to zip the vest up. It has several pros and other cons, including loose CC pockets and tight, noisy velcro pocket fasteners that call into question the vests suitability for CC use.While Rothco calls this a plainclothes concealed carry (CC) vest, Rothco also states that it is a modified version of its deluxe safari outback vest, so it is generally suitable for other activities like hunting, fishing, photography, hiking, safaris and travel, whether or not CC is involved.Construction/Durability:  The vest is made well enough and feels fairly sturdy, though I did notice several loose threads that often are a sign of problems to come. Bar-tacking its stress points, which 5.11 does with its vests, would provide even greater sturdiness but undoubtedly raise the price. The two-way front zipper is a nice feature but I found mine would jam whenever I tried to get it started. The vest feels a bit heavy, but that is due to all the pockets and other layers of cloth, webbing, etc. The washable poly/cotton material is not waterproof, but an application of an appropriate spray will help with that. Webbing and slits in back help with ventilation, but the slits make total waterproofing impossible.  Issue: Some reviews suggest that durability may be a concern, so factor those comments in when judging whether this vest will stand up to your type and frequency of use.Size/Fit:  I am 60 tall, weigh 220 lbs and normally wear a size 45 Long or 46 Long sports jacket, an XL (extra large) long-sleeved shirt and an XL (extra large) golf shirt. Because many Amazon reviewers commented that this vest runs big, I ordered a size smaller, L (large), which fits a bit loosely but not enough that I would want anything smaller. The top outside edges of the vest extend pretty far out along the tops of my shoulders: any farther and I would probably want a smaller size, which then would probably make it too tight around my torso. The bottom of the vest hangs to about 6 below my belt. If you fill only half of the pockets with stuff, too small a size would probably make the vest look too lumpy and feel tight, so having a bit of extra room in the fit is probably a good idea. There are straps and D-rings that allow tightening the vest around the torso, though doing so might create printing issues. Issue:  Many of the reviews address sizing, so those that include information on height, weight and clothing size can help determine what size vest might be best for you.Stealth...Not:  Most of the pockets are closed with industrial strength velcro patches that usually take two hands to open and create quite a loud noise when pulled apart--any perp or threat source close enough for you to shoot or vice versa will probably be able to hear the ripping noise of the velcro. Some of the velcro closures are so tight that it might be hard for someone with arthritic hands to open them. Issue:  If you need to be able to open your CC pockets quietly and quickly this is not the vest for you. (Note:  ScotteVest has magnetic closures on some of its vests and jackets, which makes opening pockets much quieter and easier than those with velcro but the magnets feel too weak to secure anything weighty like a pistol.)CC:  While this vest is well suited to safaris, travel and various outdoor activities, it is not so good for concealed carry. There are two large, inside pockets that will hold fairly large pistols without obvious printing/patterning, though all sizes can move around in the pocket unless stabilized with a minimal holster or some after-market velcro customizing. The large interior pockets are open on two sides and held closed at one upper corner only by small but very tight velcro patches, so there is some danger that pistols, especially small ones, can fairly easily slip out of the pockets when the wearer bends over, lays the vest on a chair or couch, etc. The two pairs of inside mag pockets also have the velcro closures, but these are a bit quieter and easier to open than the ones on the CC pockets. Oddly, the padding of the two inner CC pockets is on the inside, so the padding doesnt really help prevent printing; it is the exterior pockets that cover the inner CC pockets that seem to be designed to reduce printing. Issue:  Do you really want to carry a loaded, unholstered pistol loose and pointing any which way in a large, not well secured inner pocket? Can you realistically expect to make a quick draw or swiftly grab another mag if you have to use two hands to open tight velcro fasteners?Shoot me first:  Some reviewers have suggested that wearing a vest like this is a blatant advertisement that you are carrying and therefore makes you likely to be the first target in certain encounter scenarios. There may be some truth to this, but there are many locations where plenty of non-carrying folks commonly wear vests like these for hiking, photography, hunting, fishing, etc. and therefore are not necessarily likely to be primary targets. Something to think about:  there could be situations in which bad guys will spot the vest and decide to pick on a softer target to mug or carjack. Issue: If this vest were black it would look like a tactical vest; in khaki it looks like vests worn in many areas for a wide range of outdoor activities. Whatever color vest you choose, in most urban and rural areas most LEOs and most bad guys will have a good idea what this vest is for. As for wanting to be inconspicuous or unidentifiable as a carrier, I am pretty certain that no air marshal would ever wear one of these vests while on duty. Whether or not you are carrying, if you wear this vest or anything like it while traveling abroad you will generally be identified as a tourist or other outsider.Safari:  In the 1960s I lived in Africa for a couple of years and went on numerous safaris; I wish there had been something like this versatile vest available back then to carry all the stuff I needed while out in the bush. Tailors in Nairobi or Dar es Salaam or Addis Ababa were able to sew up custom safari jackets or vests overnight, but they were made of a heavy, chafing, canvas-like cotton, didnt have enough pockets, and lacked vents and internal mesh backing, so this contemporary Rothco version is much better. Issue: These days custom tailored safari wear is still more attractive but still less functional and much more expensive than off-the-rack vests like this one. BTW, if you wear this vest while on safari or engaging in various outdoor activities you will be envied for its convenience and carrying capacity; if you wear it in a city you may be a source of amusement for locals and foreigners alike.Photography:  The pockets will hold lots of gear, but only the inner sides of the two CC pockets are padded and there is no pocket really suitable for a long telephoto lens or a bulky SLR or DSLR. Opening the noisy velcro pocket closures will be clearly audible to your human and animal subjects unless you are using a long telephoto lens.Travel:  Travelers can carry a lot of their necessities in a vest like this, which is easy to remove and place in a plastic bin at the airport security line. The vest is an item of clothing, so if you wear it onto the plane it and its contents will generally not count as part of your carry-on baggage allotment. (Important note:  Unless you are an air marshall or otherwise officially authorized, do not even think about using this vest to carry restricted items through an airport security checkpoint, and even if you are authorized you wouldnt want to put this vest in an overhead bin or under the seat where any heavy items might fairly easily slip out of the inside CC pockets.)Style:  Lets face it, vests like these wont earn any style points, but thats not why people buy them. If you want a svelte, uncluttered look this is not the vest for you. Moving more of the pockets to the interior, as 5.11 and ScotteVest do with some of their vests, creates a smoother and less conspicuous look, but the overall functionality of this Rothco product is hard to deny if you need a lot of wearable hauling capacity. Issue:  Will your family and friends be willing to be seen with you if you wear this vest in public?Thank You Amazon Prime:  Should problems arise during the initial period of product use, dealing with Amazon as opposed to the manufacturer or a vendor other than Amazon is usually a great advantage. These days I find that I buy almost everything except groceries and gasoline from Amazon because its selection, customer service, return policy and delivery are outstanding.Disclaimer:  I have no personal or business relationship with Amazon nor the manufacturer of this product and I paid for it with my own funds.

I know, who can get excited about alkaline batteries? While they are a critical part of our lives, they all look pretty much alike and we tend to take them for granted until they run out of juice, at which point we curse them. Tough life, being a battery--ignored, then at the end of life berated.That said, I must observe that these are good, long-life batteries that serve a critical purpose in my home, where I use four of them at a time to power a flood alarm in the closet where one of my water heaters is located. A leaking or flooding water heater can easily lead to thousands of dollars' worth of damages, so buying these reliable batteries for my leak/flood alarm is a no-brainer. Their useful life in this setting is about 8 months so, to be on the safe side, I replace them every 6-7 months. When all these batteries are drained I will buy another supply of them--from Amazon, of course, where I buy almost everything these days except groceries and gasoline.Disclaimer:  I have no business or personal relationship with the manufacturer of this product and I paid for the product with my own funds.

I had one of these a couple of decades ago, back in the dark ages when microwaves did not come with automatically-rotating turntables, and I tossed the device out when I moved into a house that had a microwave with a turntable.Fast forward to 2014, when we bought a house with very recent and upscale appliances--except for the microwave, which is of recent vintage but has no turntable. Most of the time this is not an issue, but I often cook and reheat main meals in the current microwave, which heats unevenly due to the lack of a turntable. I finally broke down and bought this item, which works as advertised. It costs twice as much as the almost identical item did 20 years ago (while high-end microwaves cost half of what they did 20 years ago). The device still makes an awful noise when being rewound, and the need for frequent rewinding is as irritating now as it was 20 years ago. On the other hand, this item gets the job done and I haven't found a better alternative. Truth to tell, I am secretly wishing for my current microwave to die so I can have an excuse to put in a new one with a built-in turntable.

Halle Berry offers an outstanding performance and looks great, as always. The plot is twisted and complex and the cinematography is A-OK.My only substantial criticism is that Ms. Berry's male co-lead is a real clunker whose acting is rather wooden and whose accent jumps from faux-American to his native Croatian (or whatever it is) from moment to moment; perhaps the producers had to scale down the male lead's salary--and therefore capabilities--in order to pay whatever premium Halle Berry deservedly commands these days. Since scientists are often portrayed as having foreign accents it would have been better to let the male lead keep his native Croatian accent and let a brief bit of dialogue reveal that his back story includes his having immigrated from Croatia.BTW, I have nothing against foreign accents--Bela Lugosi was compelling in Dracula, and Russell Crowe does a fine job with an American accent when his role calls for losing his native New Zealand accent. I just find it annoying and distracting in a movie or TV show when an actor/actress can't maintain an appropriate--or consistent--accent.Bottom line:  With good special effects, an engrossing plot and Halle Berry, this series is definitely worth a look. With a more credible and capable male lead I would have given 4 stars for sure or possibly even 5 stars.

By 21st century standards, this film is a dinosaur. However, for its time it was the epitome of special effects and sci-fi escapism (literally). Today's young people will undoubtedly laugh at the funky sets, the often-wooden acting and the lack of ethnic diversity (no people of color on the rocket to the new planet), but this film is worth four stars if only for its historical value and amusement quotient.By the way, the lack of ethnic diversity on the U.S. escape rocket could have set the scene for a sequel, which was not so common in the 1950's:  Other nations were building escape rockets, too, and had those ships also made it to the new planet a basis could have existed for a subsequent film dealing with international and inter-ethnic disagreements and conflicts (U.S. colony vs the Russian colony, Cold War redux, etc.).

I use this fan to circulate air in a large walk-in closet (8x10).It oscillates, it is small, it is powerful, its angle of delivery can easily be adjusted. It really is a little blizzard:  the high speed is so great that it is sufficient for my purposes to use the low speed. For personal use it is appropriate on a desk or table; it does not really have the horsepower to work well in a bedroom or living room. However, this is correctly labeled a "personal" fan, so look at bigger models if you require whole-room usage.I would have preferred a white fan to a black, but that is a quibble that does not prevent me from giving this unit a five-star rating.I have no personal or financial relationship with the manufacturer and I paid for this unit myself.

I bought several of these night lights to put in my home's bathrooms and hallways to make it easier for guests (and residents) to get around at night.They do put out a fair amount of light, and they do make it possible to navigate in what would otherwise be totally dark rooms. However, they have an approximate lighted area of just over 1-square-inch, which gives off less light than the 3-square-inch units I used in my other house.If the larger night lights had still been available at a comparable price point I would have opted for the bigger units; however, these do the job well enough that I decided to keep them even though I could have returned them at Amazon's expense.On the positive side, these were not very expensive and they have a negligible electrical draw (0.03 watts).

I haven't played bridge for decades and wanted to take it up again, so I bought this summary as a way to refresh my memory. It was useful to a degree, but I did not find it to be entirely up to date as far as the current style of bidding and playing is concerned. Fortunately, a friend who is a bridge fanatic was kind enough to write out and share with me her shorter version of current point counting and playing, which I found much easier to understand and follow.

I bought this for a trip to China and found it to be essentially useless. This product is fantastic in theory, but in practice it is simply too difficult and impractical to use. The sound quality was poor and the Chinese people I tried to use it with had trouble hearing and understanding what the unit was saying.
This are nice pants and I was sorry they did not fit. I found them too tight in the crotch and they did not come in a long rise, so I had no choice but to return them.
This are nice pants and I was sorry they did not fit. I found them too tight in the crotch and they did not come in a long rise, so I had no choice but to return them.

In my ongoing quest to improve my golf game I have tried many training aids. This one is a bit peculiar in that you have to fill it with rags or towels or somesuch in order for the bag to do its work, and implementing the swing that the instructions call for is counter-intuitive. While using the bag makes it possible to get a feeling for the preferred angle of the club at impact, transferring that feeling to using an actual ball is challenging. This is not a training aid that I have used much after the initial novelty period.If you have been having a bad day this bag offers is a socially acceptable way to take out your frustrations by banging the heck out of it.

Over the years I have had several different neck pillows, and this one is the best of the lot.The velour surface is comfortable and does not make your neck sweaty where it touches the velour, a problem I have noticed in competing products. The inflation/deflation valve is noticeably better than those found on competitors--it is very easy to adjust the inflation level to get just the right softness for any situation, and the large size of the valve allows quick inflation and almost instant deflation. The shape and fit are very comfortable. If necessary, you can hand-wash the pillow with mild soap.This pillow clearly stands out from the competition.

I wanted a ceiling fan for a room that has an 8' ceiling, and most ceiling fans hang down so far that they are visually obtrusive and also a bit of a safety hazard. After scouring the internet and the big-box stores I found this low-profile Hunter fan, which has to be one of the lowest-profile fans ever made. Having fan blades so close to the ceiling does not affect the ability of this unit to blow up a good breeze--I plan to buy more of these.

I used to be a great fan of Broan, which for many years had the quietest bathroom exhaust fans on the market. However, these Panasonic Whisper series fans are noticeably quieter and I have purchased five or six for retrofitting two different homes. Get the lowest sone rating you can afford--the Panasonic fans with ratings at or under 1 sone are amazing.

We have bought several editions of this book over the years in preparation for retirement. Coming from the northeast US we found that warm weather was our main criterion in selecting our retirement location, and this book provides a wealth of information related to weather and its seasonal variations. However, the book goes on to provide detailed information about many other criteria:  health services, crime rate, cost of living, real estate, quality of life, etc., all of which are important decision-making components.My wife and I have been retired in FL for 6 years and, while the warm climate is still very important to us, we find that health services are of increasing concern. Our small community has limited and relatively low-rated health services and facilities, though we have found an internist we really like. However, the local hospitals and specialty doctors are, to put it nicely, ranked in the middle of all of the medical quality ratings. The nearest bigger cities, which have better facilities and services, are about 2 hours away, and the very best medical services and facilities are in the biggest cities, which are 3-4 hours away.We are fortunate that our health is relatively good, but if we ever have to face serious illness (heart attack, cancer), I know we will wish we were closer to top medical care.

I bought this set for an insanely long air trip from NY to Hong Kong and back. Fortunately, I tested it before the trip and found out that it would not meet my needs.The mask did not fit very well in terms of blocking out light, even after I did a little bit of reshaping of the mask with scissors.The ear plugs did not help all that much with sound suppression and they were uncomfortable.I found that the traditional soft sleep mask given out on the plane (business class) did a better job, and my regular wax-type earplugs can't be beat for muffling sound.

I find the metal frames to be too heavy and more likely to feel tight or pinch the bridge of my nose. I have had much better luck with the all-plastic versions available at Wmart and other outlets. The lenses of these readers appear to be made of glass, but it is not clear whether they are shatterproof, so I also feel safer with all-plastic glasses.

Many golfers prefer to work through a few tips or drills rather than take a lesson or two from a pro because lessons can be more time-consuming and expensive.  However, others prefer lessons to drills and tips. In short, this is an issue of personal preference. As a psychologist and mid-handicap golfer I find that a mix of tips/drills and lessons is the best fit for me. At any one point in time I do not relate to all 120 drills in this book, but many of them seem to resonate with my current stage of experience and training and these are the drills that I add to my repertory. My skills and needs vary from week to week or month to month, so it is very convenient to have this comprehensive set of drills to refer to whenever one or another of my skills needs improvement.

These were my first high-quality earbuds, and they are great. They fit comfortably and have excellent sound quality. They must be one of the best cost/performance values for this kind of product, and if I lost or damaged them I would want to replace them in kind.

When traveling at home or abroad there are countless instances where you find yourself wanting or needing to clean your hands, and these wipes meet that need perfectly. Each wipe is individually wrapped and you can simply toss a bunch of the tiny packets into your suitcase, purse or backpack and use them as needed. And believe me, you will need them, and you will be very glad you have them. Sharing the packets with other members of your tour group is also a good way to make friends.

This product is a cheap and simple precaution when traveling in areas where TP may not be readily available.I got these for a trip to China after reading that many public toilets lacked toilet paper. This is only partly true, and varies from rural to city areas and region to region. Also, mid- and upper-range hotels and restaurants in major cities can usually be counted on to have TP available. However, let's face it, running out of toilet paper while traveling or visiting tourist destinations is not a pleasant prospect, so having a few of these compact and cleverly packaged dispensers in your backpack or purse (and a main supply in your luggage) is a cheap and simple precaution. And there is no better way to earn a fellow traveler's undying gratitude than to offer one of these packets when the need arises.Also (and sorry to be so graphic), in some countries the available TP is often more on the order of wax paper, so having a familiar product to use can be very reassuring.

I did not like this unit, and returned it, because it is a bit bulky and does not have enough dividers and pockets to meet my needs. It may be suitable for other people, but definitely not what I needed.

This is not an Academy Award-winning film, nor will it keep you on the edge of your seat with suspense or fear. We bought it in advance of a trip to China and, while nothing can really prepare one for the immense scope and variety of the people and landscape, my wife and I found it to be one of several films that provide helpful introductory pieces of the fascinating puzzle that is China.(See also Still Life and Manufactured Landscapes, for which my reviews are identical)

This is not an Academy Award-winning film, nor will it keep you on the edge of your seat with suspense or fear. We bought it in advance of a trip to China and, while nothing can really prepare one for the immense scope and variety of the people and landscape, my wife and I found it to be one of several films that provide introductory pieces of the fascinating puzzle that is China.(See also Up the Yangtze and Still Life, for which my reviews are identical)

This is not an Academy Award-winning film, nor will it keep you on the edge of your seat with suspense or fear. We bought it in advance of a trip to China and, while nothing can really prepare one for the immense scope and variety of the people and landscape, my wife and I found it to be one of several films that provide introductory pieces of the fascinating puzzle that is China.(See also Up the Yangtze, for which my review is identical)

I love this paper towel holder because over the years I have had literally dozens of different types and this one is by far the best at controlling the dispensing of the towels. However, my wife, who thinks this unit is unattractive, has banished it from the kitchen to the laundry room, where it performs commendably.
These vitamins appear to be made of better products than some others, the price is decent, and vitamin C is good for you, so, yeah, I recommend this vitamin.
My dogs ate it.  The ingredients seem okay but don't seem to be any better than other, cheaper foods.  So overall, I don't see any reason to pay so much for this food.

This took a little while setting up because all did not go well at first, but it all turned out well.  One is instructed to use the HP website for set-up, but I used the disc that came with the printer.That said, the printer works fine.  It will take awhile to see if I am happy with ink usage.  If it s u c k s ink, I will give the printer a bad report.  If it is conservative on ink usage, I will give it a better report.  But in the meantime, the printer works fine.  I especially like there being only two ink tanks--black and color.

There are very few books that once I started reading, I read all the way through without putting the book down.  This is one of those books.  For this book one of those reasons was the writing style.  I am not sure how to describe it exactly, but it "flowed" very well, from one sentence to the next, from one paragraph to the next, from one page to the next.  It was engaging and delightful to read and pulled me along into the next page and the next and the next.  The other reason, of course, was the story itself. Part of that was because of Dana herself who had such a positive attitude even before she was paralyzed as she grew up in a rather troubling revolving-parent family life.  She rolled with the punches, as they say, living the best that could be done at the moment she was in.  Watching her after her attack was even more amazing as she would not be defeated, and stood up, took control of her life, and lived it as she saw her limitations to be (or not to be), not as others told her that her limitations would be.  What was most distressing about that situation was the attitude the military took with her in the terrible choice she was given that lead her to not persecute her attacker.  Hopefully her story helps to change that type of behavior.Increasing the interest of the book is the alternate forms of therapy she investigated, especially stem cell work.  Her involvement with those who helped her forgive was also enlightening.There is much to this book--the story itself, the information on various therapies that helped her, PTSD, the military's reluctance to prosecute rapists, and the power of forgiveness. But most important is the message to never give up, to take control of one's life instead of accepting limitations that others put on you, and to make the best of each moment you are living now, not just putting off life until tomorrow or the next week or the next year.

This is an enjoyable book to read.  The writing is well-done; the action moves along quickly; the characters are interesting; and the plot is imaginative.  Also, even though this will be a three book series, this book does have an ending and can stand on its own.  I would have no problem having my children read this book.  There is no garbage language, sex, or twisted nonsense that I wouldn't want them to read.  It is just an enjoyable, fun story.
Great history instead of the liberal rubbish trying to be pushed onto kids in public education (government indoctrination centers).

This is a good product.  The handle is comfortable, the entire thing is constructed well, it looks good, and the latch works fine.  That is all one can ask for in a leash.  I would buy another if I ever need another lease.

These are thick enough to hold heavier stuff, the "zipper" works well and holds well, and they are big enough to hold a good size amount or whatever you choose to put in it.  They are larger than a standard sandwich bag which is good because it does not squish the sandwich.  I guess that is all one can ask of a plastic storage bag.  They are as good or better than any other bag I have used, so I gave them a top score.

This is a good idea, I suppose, but it just didn't work out all that well for us.  The cars are a cool size and the track is really nice because it sets up easily and it stores is a very small space.  However, when racing in partial computer control mode (whatever that is called) you are not fully in control of the car.  When in RC mode you are, so why have the other mode?  While it was kind of fun, I don't see long term use here.  Too tell you the truth, I like the old slot car set my kids have better.  That and I don't have to buy batteries for the slot cars--although the batteries for these seem to be lasting quite well. This is an okay toy, but not a great one.

Within 25 pages or so,I knew I would finish this book.  The description of place and people drew me in as if I was there.  There were already multiple instances of me thinking, "Hmm, I wonder what how that is going to work out later in the book?"  By the time I had read those pages, it was already obvious this would be an interesting and enjoyable book to read.  The time of history was well done also.This is one of the most enjoyable books I have read in awhile even though I thought a few things were a little flaky there at the end.

This feels good in my hand.  The balance is decent.  The fit and finish is good.  The blade is a good workable length.  However, when received, the blade just wasn't all that sharp.  It was sharp, but not sharp how I like sharp.  I will have to sharpen it.  But I do like the way this knife fits in my hand and the feel of it.

I read kid's book to see what kids are reading.  This is not a literary masterpiece, but it is fun and amusing, so if it gets kids to read, I am all for it.  This is the first book of Captain Underpants I have read and it seems the Caption is not a large part of the story, so that makes me wonder.  But anyway, there are illustration on every page, the writing is harmless fun, and the story is amusing.  So overall, if gets your kid to read, then get this book.

This is a decent speaker.  It is loud enough and the battery lasts quit a while.  I never really timed it, but I am guessing it gave me about 6-8 hours on a full charge.  Overall the sound quality is good, but I think it leans toward the bass a little much.  But it is easy to use and get connected to whatever gizmo you wish to connect it too.
Good book.  Well written.
These work well so far.  I like them.

The squish idea is a good one as kids have fun with that.  But beyond that, this game has little value.  There is absolutely no skill or memory involved.  You just keep turning over cards until you get the correct fish in a row.  It is like a game for people who don't want anyone to lose because they aren't as good as some other kid.  Well, this game is complete, absolute luck of the draw (or the "turn" in this case).  So while kids have fun smashing the fish, this game has little value of any other kind.  There is no challenge of any kind.  It is a "look, no one has any advantage whatsoever" kind of game.  No skills, no memory, no nothing needed.  Personalty, I like my kids to have games that have at least a little effort involved.  These increasingly common "no thinking at all" games are really a downer.I only gave it a three star rating because the fish smashing amuses the kids.  But I really doubt that will last for long.

These are good towels.  They are a good size and a good thickness.  They absorb well.  Not much more you can ask out of a towel.  I think they are worth the price.  They could very well be a five star towel, but how does one "love" a towel?  I like these towels.  They are good.

This is a very nice product.  It is very colorful and seems to be very well made.  There are plenty of toys that dangle from the overhead rails.  There is a music gizmo, but I don't like noise so I don't use it (it isn't annoying loud, but everything doesn't have to make noise!).  The toys hang at a good height for a kid to swat at and move around.  It is easy to clean.  Everything looks harmless to even very little children.  It is well thought out.  We watch a several month old child at times and this is nice to have.

These appear to be made from quality products.  And my dogs love them.  I gave the product a four-star rating because I am cheap and want a lower price.  My dogs would give them a five because they don't pay for anything.  But too bad for them as they can't operate the computer.  So a four it is.

This could be a good game, but it isn't.  It is colorful.  The board is attractive.  The little cars are cool.  There are stars and events and singing and acting out situations. The money and all the various cards are durable.  The rules are simple and easy to learn.So what is the problem?  It is impossible not to win in a matter of minutes.  It is like the game makes set out to see how fast he could make someone win.  Does no one have more than a 3 minute attention span?  This is a nice looking game, but in the about 12 games I have played with my kid, never did either of us get around even a third of the game board before someone won.We fixed this somewhat by changing the rules.  No "attraction" is free.  One dollar attractions now cost $2. Any card that says you get two free stars means you only get one.  Any card that says you get one free star is only worth half a star.  Any card that says you lose a star means you lose two stars.  You don't get a card at all unless you roll certain numbers.  Some events you need an exact number roll to get in instead of just going in as you pass by.  We have been messing around with the rules and how to make money (like you get a dollar for passing any starting space not just your own) in order to make the game more enjoyable and playable.  We don't have it perfect yet, but it is getting better.  Out changes have made the game better because you can actually play it for awhile.So this is an attractive game with good game pieces.  It is just too easy to win.  Play it as it is and you spend more time getting the game out and putting it away than you will spend playing it.  Change the rules on your own, so it is not so ridiculously easy to win and it is much better.  I only gave it three stars because it is attractive and has nice pieces.  For game play however, it is not more than a one.  Make up your own rules so you can play more than three minutes and it is much better.Oh, don't compare this to the original game of Life because it is nothing like it.  It just uses the name to catch your attention.  But I don't care what they call it.  I cal it a decent attempt at a game ruined by the inability to make the game last more than a few minutes unless you make up your own rules.  It is so easy and quick to win that it is just ridiculous.

These bags work fine as they are more tear resistant than some I have used.  The drawstrings are good also.  The only problem I see is when you are holding the bag open trying to dump stuff in, but because the bag is a stretchy thing, it is trying to be small when you need it to be large.  Other than that, it is fine.

This a fun game for all ages with the right attitude.  The board looks good, the little characters are nifty looking, and the instructions are easy to understand and quick to learn.  However, this game is nothing like the original life game.  It is more like a more complicated Uncle Wiggly or a jazzed up version of Candyland.  I see no big faults in the operation of the game, and I really had no problem spinning the little characters on the spinner spaces as some seem to have--neither did my ten year old daughter.This is a very quick game to play.  I doubt if any game between me and my daughter went over 10 minutes.  So we changed the rules so to win you needed ten banana bunches instead of just five.  This made the game better for us.There is not a lot of strategy going on here, as the game is mostly luck, but this makes it possibly for a kid to play with an adult and either can win.

This was a very interesting book to me.  I knew there was a bunch of diplomacy going on between Great Britain and the North and South in the Civil War, but I never heard of this "spy."  He is not the perfect spy and not the perfect person, but just a human doing a job--a dangerous job as he lived in the South while basically informing Britain not to recognize the South because of their continued interest in the slave trade.The history presented in the book in interesting and so is the double life that R. Bunch lead in pretending to have an attitude of Southern sympathy while at the same time totally disagreeing with the South and doing his best to make sure Great Britain did not recognize the South as an independent nation.

I like this case.  It looks good and I like the material it is made of.  It has a kind of plastic/rubbery feel.  A little squishy, but not too squishy.  It seems well built, but only time will tell.  It is  reasonable weight also.  So unless it falls apart in the future, I will be happy with it.

I screwed up and bought seed for an area of the country I do not live it.  Well, I had it so I planted it.  It grew well.  However, I am sure it will die this coming winter.The moral of the story is read the dang package before you buy seed.

This is a fun book.  It is the kind of book I liked when I was a kid.  It moves along quickly with no unnecessary words used to bulk up the length of the book.  The type is large and easy to read.  The reader learns some interesting things about bugs and lizards.  There are pictures.  The adventure is simple and easy to follow.  But best of all, it is fun to read.

This seems to be well built and it works well.  I didn't measure it, but I really doubt that it shoots up to 38 feet.  Well, on second thought maybe it does if attached to the water hose.  But my kids did not use it that way, so I do not know.  And anyway, that attaching it to the hose thing they talk about--uh, if you have the hose, why do you need the water gun?  Oh well, the pump thing works well, it shots a pretty good stream of water, and it shoots a good distance.  It also holds a fair amount of water.So overall, I am happy with this gun.  So is my 10-year-old daughter as she squirts the dog in the butt from probably 15-20 feet away.  It was kind of funny.  Well, not to the dog.

My daughter really like this apron because of the Elsa character.  It fits her well.  It is a sturdy material. It wipes off well.  I have no complaints about this apron...well, it costs a bit more than an apron should I think, but functionally it works fine. And it looks good also.

I am not a fan of fondant.  I avoid fondant.  Actually, I kind of hate fondant.  I like icing.  Icing is your friend!  However, even though I hate fondant, my daughter likes using it to decorate cakes, so I buy her fondant.  And this is much better stuff than the fondant I have been buying her which I get at Walmart.  It spreads much thinner and is much less likely to tear.  She is very happy with using this brand of fondant.  So now, she will probably not be satisfied with the cheap stuff.  Dagnabbit.  Oh well.  And everyone in house but me also eats it. Actually, my son doesn't eat it either but he doesn't even eat cake, so his vote does not count.  So I haven't tasted this fondant yet and I do not intend to because there are some things I just won't do.  But it is better for shaping and spreading and decorating with, I do know that.

This is an okay ball.  My dogs play with it.  So far, they haven't been able to rip it up.  The small size is really pretty small, however.  It is quite a bit smaller than a tennis ball.  I only have 12 pound rat terriers, but I even with those smaller dogs, I should have had a larger ball.  Oh well, next time.There is nothing really wrong with this ball, but my dogs play with used tennis balls just as well and don't seem to care about the difference.So, I will call this a good toy, but nothing really special.Edit: The dogs now play with this ball and leave the tennis balls sitting.  They grab it and carry it around and fight over it.  So, now it is better than the old tennis balls--at least to the dogs.

This is a good book that explains the battle well.  It explains who was involved and how their personalities and actions affected the battle.  There is a section on the draft, weapons, communications, battle conditions in the back of the book that is also very good.However, I think for the younger reader, the book could have had more effort in pulling the entire battle together.  It is excellent in dealing with all the details in the back and forth battle, but it tends to make the big picture a bit confusing.But even then, this is a well told story that moves along quickly without getting boring.  The chapters are arranged well and there are plenty of pictures to make the book visually appealing.I would recommend this book for the intended audience.
My wife and daughter both say this is just okay perfume, not all that great, but not something they will go out of their way to use.  Personally, I don't like the smell all that well either.

This is an okay game.  My kids and I played it once.  The instructions aren't all that great, but once you get going it is easy to master.  The game itself flows along easily enough and there are some fun moments.  It just isn't a game I think I will play over and over.  It isn't a terrible game; it just isn't all that good of a one either.

This has a very good flavor.  It pops well with few leftover seeds.  I agree with the description that it is "virtually hulless."  I like this much more than many other popcorns that are overly salted and fake buttered.  Not much else to say.  It is good.  I like it.  I will buy more.

This is a very attractive watch.  It is rather large, so if you like small watches, this is not for you.  However, surprisingly, it seems very light for its size.  The build quality seems to be excellent.  The band is good too, but I think something with a little more color would be niftier.  However, since the watch is my wife's and not mine, and she likes it, I guess there is no problem.  This is not a flashy watch, but it has a quality, classy, look to it.

I enjoyed reading this book.  There is much information on basketball and basketball players (and many other current and historical athletic characters) , and the physiology of being able to jump and how far the author was going to have to go to get to where he wanted to be...yep, all of that kind of stuff was in there.  And I don't even know if "physiology" is the right word, but I think you know what I mean.  But anyway, all of that stuff I mentioned is in there, so you can learn something, but all of that is not the main reason I like this book.I enjoyed this book mainly because it is fun to read, and the author is a likable character and therefore a person who one can cheer for while he moves along in an attempt to achieve his goal.And while you are having fun reading this book, you will learn something along the way.  That is enough for me to give it a high rating.  It appears the author's goal was to write an interesting and enjoyable book to read.  He succeeded.

This is a very well made case.  It fits great.  It looks very good.  It has a nice texture to it.  It is very thin, however, so I think while it will help protect the phone, I think it is more for looks than protection.  Also, it costs quite a bit.  Still, this is a nice case.

This is decent case.  It looks good and holds on the phone well.  Also, it has a good texture.  However, to me it seems a bit expensive.  Also, it was supposed to be pink, but it is blue.  The sticker stuck on the package even says "pink."  Maybe it is just a really strange shade of pink that looks blue.  I received this free just to test, so I can't complain, but if you want pink, well, I hope you get pink.  But the product itself seems to be of good quality.

This actually looks pretty good.  Unless, of course, you look at it from the head or tail, in which case it appears to be a really skinny turkey!  But I am happy with this.  I haven't used it yet as a decoy, but it looks good and it sets up quickly.  I think the cost is a bit too high for a 2D turkey, but the piece itself is good.

I can't complain about the quality of this towel.  It looks good, it is large, it is thick, it absorbs water well.  So it does what it is supposed to do and it does it very well.  It also costs more than any other kitchen towel I have ever bought.  But then it is better than the less expensive towels I have purchased.  Well, I guess you pay more and get better stuff, or pay less and get not as good as stuff but more of it.  It is up to you.But this towel definitely is a quality item. I only give it four stars though because the price is high.  Ah, to heck with it, it is a nice towel, I give it five stars.

I enjoyed reading this book.  It is written well and very informative.  This book makes it clear there is much more to any battle than just which country won or which commanding officer won.  If a battle is won, it is the men doing the dying who win that battle, but they never seem to get the credit.  The author does an excellent job describing what is going on and what the men are doing and experiences they are having.  It kind of sticks the reader right there in the middle of things so he can see for himself what the soldier sees as he fights for his life.  A very good book.

My son hooked this up to the computer he uses for online schooling.  He said it sped up everything considerably.  I don't know a great deal about computer stuff, but he does, so if he says it helps, I  believe it.
My son's shirt.  He likes this brand of shirt.  So he is happy and I am happy, and now this is off my review list.

This is pretty nifty.  It works just as it says it will.  I think the number section is a bit too bright at night, but I really like how the light gradually lights up over time.  It would be good if I could change the amount of time it took to do that, but overall I like this thing and am happy with it.
These look great.  I was expecting something of lesser quality.  I was wrong.  And for the price, these are excellent.  Good enough that my daughter is taking them to the prom.

I have used this stuff before.  It grows very well.  I have a couple terrier dogs that tend to dig small holes in the ground because they apparently don't have brains.  So I throw dirt back in the hole, put this on and water it regularly with a sprinkler can.  It comes up pretty quick and fills in well.  If I have large areas to seed, I just buy plain seed--because it is much cheaper--and put straw over it to keep it moist.  But I like this for small spots so I don't have to mess with the straw.Overall, I am happy with it.  I think it costs a bit much for the amount of seed or I would have given it five stars.
This is easy to review.  It works just like it says it does, and it appears to be made of quality components. I have no complaints.

It looks like the woman on the front of the box has to go to the bathroom really badly.  That is strange.  Anyway, my wife likes the taste of these.  I don't.  I think them too dray and chocolately.  The peanut butter flavored part is good, however.  But in the end, there is no way I am paying over three dollars a piece for these.  They do seem like they have decent ingredients, but so does cheaper stuff.

There are coyotes in the area in which I live.  I have seen them.  I have heard them.  However, I can't convince any of them to stand watch over my garden.  I have deer, rabbit, and probably other critters running around in my garden.  It is mainly a problem when the plants are small and critters eat the sprouts off.  And since there is always a framer growing field corn near me, the deer tend to wander out of his area and over to my garden periodically after the plants finally grow to a decent size.  They don't do major damage, but they tend to nibble the young ears of corn just enough to ruin them.  So I figured I would try this thing.  It actually looks pretty good.  It is easy to set up, but a little fugly, so I am not sure I would want to be folding and unfolding it a great deal.  The coyote material and the hardware seems decent enough that this will last awhile.  It holds in the ground well enough and doesn't fall over easy in the wind.  It moves around a bit in a breeze, but that is a good thing.However, since I don't have my garden planted yet, I have no idea if this works to actually scare critters.  In fact, since I don't have animal problems every year, it will be hard to know if this thing scared the critters off or if it is just a good year to not have critters lurking about.  But the idea I have is that since there are already coyotes in the area, the deer just from being harassed by the real coyotes will think this is also real and will stay away.  The problem is that deer aren't stupid, so the whole concept worries me.  Anyway, while I think this is built well and should last awhile, I also think it costs a little much for what it is.  Actually, for what it cost, I could probably buy more corn than I will grow anyway.  And I am hoping I don't find it full of holes from bow hunters in the area!Oh well, I am happy with this thing.  It looks the part and seems like a decent quality thing.  I will know more after growing season.

This is a nice towel.  It is not very thick, but it is not extremely thin either.  My daughter doesn't use it as a towel, however, because she doesn't want to "mess it up."  She uses it for a blanket and a decoration in her room.  It looks very nice, so it works pretty good as a decoration.

What a disappointment. Other than the usual fight sequences this movie sucks and blows. The story line was completely lame. The acting was  flat. The characters were not engaging in any way. I didn't care one way or the other about any character in the movie. They were like cheap furniture.If you don't care about acting, writing, plot, flow, or anything else that makes a movie worth watching, then you will love this film. I gave it two stars for the usually entertaining fight sequences.

I do not view Halle Berry as a great actress. She does well when playing a supporting cast, but not the lead. With that said this was a decent show with some good casting and an interesting theme. The visuals were top notch! The near future gadgets caught my attention throughout the series. If I were not a Sci-Fi buff I would rate this three stars versus four. The theme did flow well enough to keep me engaged and watch the series to the end. Therefore, I felt that it earned a fourth star.Be patient. It takes a little time for the show to explain how it got to the starting point of where you picked it up. There are a few disjointed scenes throughout the series that interrupt the overall flow, but they are not "show" stoppers (ba-dump-dump, ting). Depending on ones mood, this could be a three, four, or (with enough wine) five star show. I lean more toward three and one half stars.

Excellent product. I alternate days (or sometimes weeks) between this product and Zinc Balance. Zinc Balance contains a little copper with it and is 15 mg of zinc L-Monomethionine which absorbs exceptionally well. A 25 mg dosage is as high as I would go with zinc supplements unless I were sick. Then I would consider taking this twice per day for a few days.I purposely do not take zinc supplements more than five days per week. If I have had a very stressful week I may take  zinc six days per week, but never seven. I take zinc either on an empty stomach or with a protein-rich meal such as scrambled eggs.30 to 50 mg of zinc will deplete copper and iron (to a lesser degree). Your body dose not require much zinc to be healthy. In addition, you do get some zinc in food (possibly not enough especially as you hit 30 and older).Zinc absorption is blocked by phytates found in plants such as salad and veggies. Try to take your zinc on an empty stomach or with protein. Not with veggies or salad.Megadosers believe that the more you take the better off you are. They are wrong. They overdose on every vitamin and mineral that they can buy not realizing the long term peril they are putting themselves in. You body prefers balance, not excess, to operate at its peak.Consider reading a book called "It's Not The Cans: The Best Nutrient Balance for a Stronger and Healthier You"
I received this battery set and they work as described. I lost my original battery set when moving. I am certain it is buried in an unopened box in my garage (one of many).

Now Foods is a decent brand for the buck. They have good quality products (not top quality) that are affordable for most. This particular product does NOT specify the type of Menaquinone it uses, which I find suspicious. Yet on their website they do sell a product that lists Menaquinone-7 as the ingredient.I do not recommend purchasing mystery ingredients for three reasons; 1) there is no easy way to tell if the product is working or not, 2) your bone health depends on how well this product works, 3) your very life depends on how well this product works.MK-4 requires 4 mg or so to be effective where as MK-7 only requires 100 to 300 mcg to obtain long term results. The MK-X (unknown) in this product is costing you money while gambling with your bone health and your life if it is not effective. Until this label is updated to reflect the actual form of Menaquinone, I suggest buying a different brand.Your bone health and your life are worth it.To those who have given this product high ratings I say; "The devil is in the details".

This product is now recommended in a new nutrition book called It's Not the Cans: The Best Nutrient Balance for a Stronger and Healthier Youhttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/0692028781/sr=8-1/qid=1418007338/ref=olp_product_details?ie=UTF8&me=&qid=1418007338&sr=8-1Great multi-vitamin that is far superior to the products you find in grocery stores and drug stores such as Centrum and One-a-Day. Grocery store multi's are of extremely poor quality. People buy them because of the commercials and the convenience of already being in the store to buy other items.Opti-Men absorbs extremely well. They are fairly soft and easy to swallow. Our bodies flush out excess "stuff" over a four to six hour period or so. This is why it is best to reload your nutrients periodically throughout the day.I never take the full daily dose of multi's (except when sick which is extremely rare). I typically stick to a half dose or 1/3 dose. I break one pill in half and take half in the morning and half (or whole one) late afternoon. I eat fairly healthy as well.This product will help to keep you healthy. I strongly advise against taking a full daily dose unless you have a cold, or the flu, or getting over a harsh medical treatment or condition. I also advise you to spread out the dosage to at least twice per day. Do not take it too late in the evening as it may slightly interfere with your sleep (depends on the person). Take it with a meal so that it can dissolve inside a mass of "chime" (goo) inside your intestines. Sort of like dropping a blue pill in water and watching the water turn blue. This will maximize the absorption as the nutrients mix in with the goo that was your meal. The goo will shuttle the nutrients through your intestinal tract for maximum absorption over a longer period of time.I encourage you to skip taking this or any multivitamin at least one full day (if not two) per week to allow excess that may have collected over several days to be flushed. I typically skip Sundays or one weekday. Keep in mind you are getting additional nutrients in your food.High protein meals trigger your intestines to slow down the "pushing" process to allow more time to absorb the protein (our bodies are awesome machines). So if you take this vitamin with a high protein meal, it too will spend more time inside your small intestines allowing a bit more to be absorbed. I sometimes take my multi with a protein shake. Chicken, fish, beef, and so forth are rich in protein which enhances nutrient absorption.==> Don't forget. Your food contains nutrients as well.
Very touching story. I enjoy it every time that I watch it..

Easy fix for similar complaints. Purchase anti-skid liner for drawers from your local Target and cut to size. I purchased a roll of black anti-skid liner for about $2.50 and use it under my bathroom rugs, and a variety other places. It is very thin and easy to cut. I even lined the trunk of my BMW with this stuff to prevent groceries and what have you from sliding all over the place. I have used anti-skid liner under car floor mats as well.So just buy a roll of the color of your choice. Cut four or eight squares (four if you just want it on the top of this product. Eight if you want to prevent skidding on the top and the bottom of this product. Problem solved for about $3.00 and 7 minutes of time.

This product is also recommended in a nutrition book called It's Not the Cans: The Best Nutrient Balance for a Stronger and Healthier YouThis is a brand I have come to trust. They are the true gold standard for the supplement industry. I hope that they continue to keep tight Quality Assurance checks and balances on their products. They can be a bit pricey sometimes but the quality and the correct dosage of their products are worth every penny. I have not tried all of their products. However, the ones that I do take always meet or exceed expectations.About this product: Vitamin D stores exceptionally well in your system for several weeks. Taking vitamin D3 daily actually slightly impairs utilization. Studies show that blood serum levels increased when supplemental vitamin D is not taken daily. I recommend taking one 2000 IU capsule, 3 nonconsecutive days per week. An example would be Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. This product should NOT be your only source of vitamin D.Megadosers suggest ingesting massive amounts of vitamin D for some imaginary benefits. A total of 8,400 IU  to 12,600 IU per week (averages out to 1200 to 1800 IU per day) is more than most people for maximum benefit. Anything that averages more than 2000 IU per day (14,000 IU per week) is a waste of money and will not do anything more for you.You also need adequate magnesium levels to activate the vitamin D inside of you. Rather than megadosing on vitamin D, you will  be better served by ensuring that you are getting 300 mg to 600 mg of quality magnesium each day. This will activate your vitamin D. Doctors rarely ensure that their patients have adequate magnesium in their diet before they prescribe massive doses of vitamin D due to a perceived deficiency. Although you may be moderately deficient in vitamin D, a moderate increase in D coupled with adequate magnesium intake will yield far better results than a massive increase in vitamin D alone.PS don't forget to get 100 mcg of vitamin K2 as well to protect your arteries from the increased calcium absorption and strengthen your bones and teeth.Checkout not the cans d ot com for more info.

Excellent product. I am very impressed at the quality-to-price ratio! It doesn't take a lot of this product to produce a rich, long-lasting lather so one bar lasts me quite a while.The soap you choose may not be the only issue. It may also be the water. I would like to suggest that you add 200-300 mg of ascorbic acid (pure vitamin C) to your bath water and facial cleansing water. It neutralizes 100% of chlorine and chloramines in water. These chemicals are used to disinfect our water. However they also dry and irritate the skin and lungs. I also suggest installing a shower water filter. I use the Sprite 2 slim line. Water filters will remove the  chlorine but not the chloramines.Here is a link to the ascorbic acid powder that I use to bathe and shave in. When I shave I add it to a large bowl of water.http://www.amazon.com/Nutribiotic-Ascorbic-Powder-Bioflavonoids-Ounce/dp/B000I4DETC/ref=sr_1_4?s=hpc&ie=UTF8&qid=1412714079&sr=1-4&keywords=ascorbic+acid+nutribioticI hope this info helps.

This product is now recommended in a new nutrition book called It's Not the Cans: The Best Nutrient Balance for a Stronger and Healthier YouThis is a potent product. 1/2 teaspoon equates to 25, 100 mg tablets in a single dose.I bought this product primarily to neutralize the chlorine and chloramines in my bath water. Based on the science, 1000 mg of vitamin C will neutralize 100% of the chlorine and chloramines contained in 100 gallons of water. This equates to 10 mg of vitamin C to completely neutralize the chlorine and chloramines in 1 gallon of water.The average bathtub holds approx. 30 gallons of water when full. This means that on average, you require only 300 mg of vitamin C to neutralize the chlorine and chloramines in a full tub. Of course, when we leave room for our body we do not completely fill the tub.==> Let us assume we place 25 gallons of water in a tub to bathe in. That means we would need to add 250 mg of vitamin C to the water to neutralize 100% of the chlorine and chloramines. That equates to 1/10 of 1/2 of 1 teaspoon of this product!!!!==> Let's say we want to be certain because your area may use a little more chlorine and chloramines to treat the water. So we decide to double the dose. This means we would add 500 mg of vitamin C to 25 gallons of bath water. This equates to 1/5 of 1/2 teaspoon of this product!!!==> Let's be paranoid and go 4 times the amount of C for a 25 gallon tub, which equals 1000 mg. This equates to less than 1/4 teaspoon of this product!!!According to the label there are 181 servings (1/2 teaspoon) in this container which means even at 4 times amount needed for a 25 gallon bath, we have 362 baths in each bottle (that is after rounding up to a full 1/4 teaspoon)!!!!Not only do I bathe with this product, I also add a little to a large bowl of water when I choose to wash my hair in the sink. I use a cup to scoop out water to rinse my hair. After doing this and installing a chlorine filter in my shower, my scalp has completely stopped itching!!! Please note, vitamin C may cause hair des to fade quicker.If you choose to drink this product, I strongly encourage you to stay below 1/4 teaspoon per day. Please consider that 1/4 teaspoon is still 1200 mg of supplemental C. I get my C from strawberries and pure, organic orange juice as well as via a high quality multi-vitamin (Opti-Men). Excess vitamin C intake (300 mg or more) can be a causal factor for insomnia. You do not need much to be healthy.I highly recommend bathing in this product, shaving with this product added to the water, and washing your hair and face with this product. I also recommend installing a quality, chlorine shower filter.Please note that chorine filters do NOT remove chloramines. That is okay because removing the chlorine is still great for your hair, skin, and lungs.In case I forgot to say it, BUY THIS PRODUCT. You will not be disappointed.

I recently had a bad case of stomach flu for several days. Every couple of hours I went to the restroom to pass stool and only water came gushing out each time (sorry if I grossed you out). I woke up every 90 minutes or so throughout three consecutive nights to pass water, a lot of it. I should have gone to get something like Imodium or what have you but I decided to tough it out which made it last five days versus the typical three.I drank a few liters of 7-UP over a few days to help stay hydrated which appeared to be running out the other end. I added powdered potassium to the 7-UP but grew concerned about my other electrolytes.I started taking one of these every couple of hours and I could tell it helped me to not feel as drained. I could not eat anything for three days for fear of vomiting. Even tap water irritated my stomach. This product did not disturb my stomach at all. To the contrary, it seemed to ease a little of the discomfort. It seemed my periodic stomach cramps became a little less severe and a little less frequent.This product should be marketed in the medicine section as well, IMHO, along with products such as Pepto Bismal, Imodium, and so forth to be taken when suffering from diarrhea.

I have used this to power a compressor I used to change my break fluid and to put air in my tires. I love this little gadget. I lost a sleeve on one of the negative (black) clips. Still works great but I deducted a star due to the sleeve sliding off. Not a deal breaker by any means.Buy this product. It is very handy.

This product is now recommended in a new nutrition book called It's Not the Cans: The Best Nutrient Balance for a Stronger and Healthier YouI take this product four days per week (Mon, Tue, Thr, Fri). My asthma has improved dramatically. My libido is through the roof.Zinc depletes copper. This is good because too much copper can trigger depression. However, too little copper can cause problems as well. This product contains an excellent ratio of zinc to copper when you consider many people are copper heavy due to environmental factors as well as diet.I take this product on an empty stomach and also with meals. I have never encountered stomach upset. If you have a delicate stomach you may need to take this with meals. If so, animal-based protein will enhance the absorption.This particular form of zinc, L-Monomethionine, has an extremely high absorption rate AND is not blocked nearly as much by grains and legumes like other forms of zinc. You do not need a higher dose because the majority of this form of zinc will be absorbed into your system.If you do not consume a lot of red meat you should consider supplemental iron as well. Zinc depletes copper. Zinc also depletes iron a little but not nearly as much as copper. So I take GNC's Gentlesorb Iron once or twice per week. You do not have to do a one-for-one, iron to zinc supplement ratio because zinc may deplete, for example, only 15% of iron versus 60% of copper. Since iron is only partially impacted by zinc, you need only to partially supplement it to counteract the losses caused by zinc.The capsules are very small.
